He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be his 4th loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Him S. is a 30-year-old married woman and is the village bank president, having been selected by the seventeen members of this group loan located in Doung TU. village in Takeo province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different businesses.  Mrs. Him S. and her husband, Mr. Din Sorn, are farmers who own 1.20-hectare of land to cultivate rice. They work very hard with their farm but they still earn too little income to support their family. In order to increase their income, Mrs. Him S. requests a loan to buy piglets and pig food to start a pig selling business. This couple has three children who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah has been operating his mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya, for the last ten years, selling his products to the local market. He also owns and operates a motorbike in the same area.

Josiah is 38 years old and is married with eight children between the ages of 4 months and 14 years. Six of the children are currently attending school.

Josiah has requested this loan of 85,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says that with the income from the sale of milk he will be able to provide for the needs of his family. His biggest challenges have been the high competition in the market, a lack of skills in animal husbandry, diseases, and lack of farm inputs.

In future, Josiah would like to have at least five quality cows that daily produce ten liters of milk each. He says that Juhudi is a good company that has changed people's lives a great deal and he has a strong hope for further progress with Juhudi.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Néfissa

texts.fr: M. néfissa  est une femme de 48 ans,elle est une dame très dynamique. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de tubercules d'ignames. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la localité d'anié. elle a une ancienneté de 5 ans dans ce commerce; sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle est en rupture de stock et n'arrive donc plus à satisfaire tous ses clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de vingt tas de tubercules d'ignames pour rehausser son stock. elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Néfissa M., 48 years old, is a very dynamic lady. She makes a living selling yam tubers. She gets her stocks in the inland locality of Anié. She has been doing this for five years, and her customer base includes anyone. Her stocks are currently depleted and she can no longer meet customer demand. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase twenty heaps of yam tubers to increase her stocks. She is married and the mother of four children.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yam tubers

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en: Rafael K., age 38, is dedicated to raising animals in order to generate revenue from the products they provide. Rafael has earned a living from breeding sheep since he was young. His monthly income is about 150-230 AZN.  He is married with one child.  His low income isn’t enough to provide for his family and, for this reason, Rafael works enormously hard to improve their standard of living. Rafael needs to buy more sheep.  He also wants one milking cow for the milk and milk products which it can provide Rafael and his family, ensuring they will never go hungry and will always have at least cheese and yogurt. He has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: To buy one milking cow and six sheep.

loans.name: Herminda Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Herminda del Carmen, tiene la edad de 42 años, vive acompañada de su pareja de vida en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene con su pareja 3 hijos mayores de edad de  los cuales los dos mayores trabajan y apoyan a sus padres en los gastos del hogar, la menor estudia la secundaria y depende económicamente  de sus padres, ellos tiene una pulpería desde hace mas de 7 años, por los problemas económicos que atraviesa el país sus ventas son variables, antes trabajaba en un zona franca y con sus ahorro y su liquidación fue que inicio su negocio de venta de abarrotes, productos para el hogar, y personal.

Su hija pronto entrara a la universidad y espera tener los recursos Económicos para apoyarla a mejorar su calidad de vida, ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de  un mayor inventario de mercadería  para su negocio que garantice un incremento en sus ventas y condiciones propias para llevar a cabo los estudios de su hija menor.
Este es el tercer ciclo de la señroa con el apoyo que se le ha brindado, ha mostrado una gran mejoria economica, pues es una mejer trabajadora responsable y con mucha iniciativa en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Herminda del Carmen, 42, lives with her life partner in the Laureles North neighborhood. With her partner she has 3 grown children, two of whom work and help their parents with the household expenses. The youngest is in high school and is economically dependent. Herminda and her partner have had a general store for more than 7 years. Due to the economic problems that are affecting the country, her sales are variable. Previously, she was working in the free trade zone, and with her savings and severance pay she started her business selling groceries, products for the home and personal products. Her daughter will soon enter the university, and she hopes to have the financial resources to support her effort to improve her quality of life. Now she requests a loan to buy a greater quantity of merchandise for her business to ensure an increase in her sales so that she can support her daughter's education. This is Herminda's 3rd loan cycle, and with the support that has been provided to her she has shown great economic improvement. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman who shows a lot of initiative in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase the inventory in her store

loans.name: Pak

texts.en:
Mrs. Pak S. has been spending almost all of her life cultivating crops, a skill she learned from her grandparent who died of senility years ago. Pak S. is married with four children, three of whom are no longer in school and work in different fields, while another one attends school. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual action that provides her with formal income. 

Pak S. dreams of having a vehicle; however, her income is only sufficient to support food for the family. This is the reason Pak S. requested a loan to buy a new motorcycle to serve as transportation for family. Additionally, her husband can use it to provide a taxi service for a profit.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to provide transportation for the family

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 56 year old married man from Lebanon. He has made his living as a professional driver. He has operated a van service for students in his village, as well as neighboring towns, for over 12 years. In addition, he presents transportation services for customers upon request. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform much needed maintenance on his van, including changing the tires and repairing the engine. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new van and to employ a part time employee to work on it.

loans.use: To perform much needed maintenance on his van.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe G., 41, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Gerry G., an employee of a printing business, and mother of four children, all of whom are already in high school. By the grace of God, Fe has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college. A dream for most Filipino parents like Fe, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Fe maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Fe dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her customers

loans.name: Nerea

texts.en: Nerea is a widowed mother of three. She is proud of the fact that she has been able to educate her children despite being the family's sole breadwinner, and is grateful for the support she has received from Faulu Kenya.  Her dream is to see her children through to the university level. To make this possible, she has worked very hard as a seamstress for the last 13 years. She is applying for a loan for 10,000 Kes to buy fabric, zippers, canvas and thread.

loans.use: To buy fabric, zippers, canvas and thread for a tailoring business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 48 years old. Merlinda is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Merlinda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlinda also grows pigs and ducks. She hopes to acquire more ducks and piglets to raise. 

Merlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pig feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pig feeds

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
María Nelly es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío Quemazón del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola habitada por personas humildes y muy trabajadoras, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Usualmente cría aves de corral, cerdos y ovejas en algunos ambientes situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo viaja hasta la ciudad de Chiclayo para venderlos en el Mercado Moshoqueque. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia, por ello María siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda responder a la demanda que durante estas fechas suele aumentar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Nelly is a 25 year old mother who lives with her husband and son in the Quemazón settlement, located in the Mórrope district.  This is an agricultural zone where the people are humble and hard working.  It’s located within the Lambayeque province and is more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells animals; usually farm birds, hogs, and sheep in an area behind her house.  When they have reached a level state of development, she takes them to sell in the Moshoqueaue market in Chiclayo.  This business is an important source of income for her family’s finances, so she always tries to keep it in the best shape possible.

María wants to expand her business by buying more animals and balanced feed so that she can meet the end of year demand.  For this reason she has seen fit to request a loan for 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Animals and feed

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is 37 years old, married, and has two children.  He makes and sells handbags to earn a living.  He has been running this business for ten years and has managed to employ ten people.  Being a father of two, he works hard in his business so he can provide for his family.  He hopes to open other businesses in the future.  He needs a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy raw materials to make handbags.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make handbags

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo tiene 54 años, nació en la ciudad de Puno y actualmente vive junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq.

Luis Alfredo tiene un pequeño restaurante llamado “El Fogon" donde vende menú a S/. 3.50 nuevos soles. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Luis Alfredo que espera recibir de $ 500 USD  desea comprar artefactos como por ejemplo horno pollero, congeladora y otras cosas más.

Luis Alfredo pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.

El distrito de Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, llamada el distrito de las flores y localizándose a 5 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo, age 54, was born in the city of Puno.  He currently lives with his wife and their three children in the Wanchaq district.  Luis Alfredo has a small restaurant named “El Fogon” (The Kitchen Stove).  He sells prepared meals for S/. 3.50 nuevos soles.  He has had this business for two years, and it is going extremely well for him thanks to the great effort he puts into his work.

With the next loan Luis Alfredo hopes to receive $500 USD.  He wishes to buy items like a roasting oven, a freezer, and other things.

Luis Alfredo belongs to the “El Templo del Inca”  (The Incan Temple) Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa.  The communal bank is in its second year, and it is well managed by the governing board.

The Wanchaq district is in the Cusco province in the Cusco department.  It is called the district of the flowers.  It is five minutes from the Plaza de Armas in the architectural capital of South America (Cusco).  Cusco is an enchanting city, which dates back to Inca times. The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

loans.use: To buy items like a roasting oven, a freezer, and other things.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 54 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 68 años, que es obrero y sus 2 hijos mayores, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 8 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, de una reconocida marca; y esta muy satisfecha pues las ganancias que obtiene le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Le gusta mucho su labor pues la desempeña visitando a sus amigas y conocidas, de esta manera  les va enseñando los catálogos para que le realicen pedidos; además paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la enseñanza en un programa de alfabetización de su zona. Esta muy contenta pues ambos trabajos le permiten salir adelante, y ya tiene muchos planes para  el futuro como el de vender ropa, pues aunque a solo veces se dedica  a este negocio sabe que es muy rentable. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Irma tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de tela, pues quiere mandar a fabricar pantalones cortos y blusas para comercializar estas prendas durante el verano.
texts.en: Irma, 54 years old, lives in her own home with her 68 year old husband José, a laborer, and their two grown children. Together they work every day to get ahead. For 8 years this businesswoman has sold a well-known brand of cosmetics. She is very satisfied as her earnings that she receives have enabled her to help her husband with the household expenses. She enjoys her work as it allows her to visit friends and acquaintances, showing them catalogs from which they then order; in addition to this business she also teachers a reading program in her neighborhood. She is very content as both jobs allow her to get ahead, and she has many plans for the future such as the one to sell clothing. Even though she has only sometimes sold clothing she knows it is a profitable business. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually,  as she doesn’t want to disappoint the people who make the money possible for her to be able to continue working and becoming successful. Irma has planned to invest the money into buying a quantity of fabric, as she wants to arrange for the making of some shorts and blouses to sell during the summer.

loans.use: Buy fabric to make pants and blouses

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario C. is from the town of Tagbilaran. He is 51 years old and married. To make a living, Dario owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. 

Dario joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dario has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Dario is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Ou R., 57, resides with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Ou is a farmer who raises pigs, earning an income of USD 3 per day, while her husband, a construction worker, earns an income of USD 4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 85 on other necessary expenses.

Ou is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to operate a coffee shop, and in the future she would like to use the resulting additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To operate a coffee shop

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene tres hijos y vive en la Comunidad de San Isidro de Chicon que se encuentra ubicado a 15 minutos  de la ciudad de Urubamba, Cusco – Perú. En la comunidad de Chicon los pobladores se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura. Antonia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y otros pequeños animales que sirven para el consumo de la familia. Antonia requiere el microcrédito para comprar animales y para comprar alimento. 

Antonia pertenece al banco comunal “Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicon” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Antonia has three children and lives in the community of San Isidro de Chicón located 15 minutes from the city of Urubamba, Cusco, Perú.  Chicón’s residents are mostly farmers and raise livestock.  

Antonia is a hard working, enterprising woman who supports her family.  She raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and other small animals that are used for her family’s consumption.  Antonia needs the microloan to buy animals and to buy feed.

Antonia is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicón” (San Isidro de Chicón’s Dynamic Ones) communal bank and she is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means; she also commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy animals and to buy feed.

location.town: San Isidro de Chicon- Urubamba - Cusco

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new carpet-weaving frame and other important equipment

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo, reside en Quelepa, departamento de San Miguel, trabaja en Fibras de El Salvador (elaboración de muebles), vive solo, es viudo y sus hijos tienen sus propios hogares, desde joven inicio como ayudante de un taller y hace 10 años instalo su propio taller donde perfecciona el oficio de trabajar con fibra de vidrio.
El necesita un préstamo para la compra de resina (barril), hierro, tubos cilíndricos, cuadrados, tornillos y otros materiales; Este préstamo le ayudara a realizar una buena compra y a un precio más bajo de lo normal.
Sus aspiraciones es crecer como microempresario, tener una buena solvencia económica para el pago de las cuotas de este préstamo y para cubrir sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives in Quelepa in the department of San Miguel.  He has a workshop called "Fibras de El Salvador" where he makes furniture made of fiberglass.  He is a widower who lives alone; his children have their own homes.  From the time that he was very young he worked as an assistant in a workshop.  Ten years ago he set up his own workshop where he perfects the craft of working with fiberglass.

He needs a loan to buy resin (a barrel), iron, cylindrical tubes, drafting squares, screws and other supplies.  This loan will help him to make a good buy at a price that is lower than usual.

He aspires to grow as a businessman and to have good earnings so that he can make the payments on this loan and also cover his personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy resin (a barrel), iron, cylindrical tubes, drafting squares and screws

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria es una cliente antigua de la institución ella tiene tres hijos que ya son independientes, la señora Victoria se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido ya que le ayuda mucho con el cuidado de su papa que ya es un señor de edad el cual vive con el en la casa, ella a parte de su actividad de venta de ropa también da en alquiler habitaciones en su hogar,  antes la señora tenia un salón de peinados en obrajes, el crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de mercadería como sacones, chompas para el día de la madre ya que sus clientes ya le están haciendo pedidos, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Victoria is a longtime client of the institution.  She has three adult children and she sells clothing to order.  The income helps her care for her elderly father who lives in her home.  Aside from her clothing business, she also rents out rooms in her home, and used to have a beauty salon there.  She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as coats, and sweaters for mothers’ day, now that her friends are making requests.  She is a hard working woman and is grateful for the support from the institution.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for mothers' day

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 27 year-old Rugiatu, who is married and has one child aged two years. In 2007, Rugiatu established her food (Tea & Achekeh) business as a means of earning income for herself and her family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month.

Rugiatu would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy provisions such as milk, sugar, tea and garri (used to prepare Achekeh). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Rugiatu plans to open a restaurant, employ workers to run the shop, and educate her children. Very determined and hardworking, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy provisions such as milk, sugar, tea and garri for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, oil, sugar, potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Erika Vanessa

texts.es: La señorita Erika  es cliente antigua trabaja a la misma vez con el grupo solidario portada desde el año 2007, durante todo este tiempo  ha demostrado ser una persona responsable ya que todos sus pagos fueron de forma puntual. Erika es soltera, se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa, chompas según a la temporada, aparte de su actividad estudia enfermería ya que tiene ganas de superarse para así poder ayudar a sus hermanos menores. El crédito será destinado a la compra de chompas y sacones para su venta  en  invierno que se aproxima, es una joven muy trabajadora viaja hasta Oruro los fines de semana llevando mercadería de la ciudad de La Paz, esta agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Srta. Erika is a long-time client who has worked with a solidarity group since 2007. Throughout this entire time, she has demonstrated that she is a responsible person who has made all of her payments on time. Erika is single and has a business selling clothes, especially sweaters according to the season. In addition to managing this business, she studied nursing and already has the will to succeed so that he can help her younger siblings.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase sweaters and coats for the upcoming winter season. Erika is hardworking young woman. She travels to Oruro on the weekends in order to bring back merchandise from the city of La Paz. Erika is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters and coats for the winter season.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is 33 years-old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 3. 

In 2000, Parbati established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to increase inventory of her store. In the future, Parbati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Sethembiso Group

texts.en:
Hlengiwe is 31 years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 10. She has been selling clothes and cold drinks from her home for the past year.  Hlengiwe has requested this loan from Kiva and WDB to purchase more stock for her store. She also receives a child support grant from the South African government to support her family.

Hlengiwe says that the biggest challenges to her business are the clients that do not properly pay for the merchandise that she sells. She would like to grow her business into a supermarket over the next 5 years. She is very excited to appear on Kiva's website and would like to thank Kiva and WDB for helping her family. In the photo she is pictured rasing her hand.

loans.use: to buy clothes and drink for sale.

loans.name: Mercedes Sebastiana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son  mayores de edad y el ultimo de 17 años que  estudian en colegio, cuatro de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella como buena esposa trata de ayudar a su esposo en lo que más puede por eso realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo, él se dedica a la venta de frutas, legumbres y verduras el mismo que lo realiza cuatro días  por semana en el mercado Tarqui en Manta, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que el señor se desplaza de madrugada a dicho mercado con la finalidad de comprar a comerciantes mayoristas y luego realizar sus ventas a las personas que asistan a este centro de abastos a comprar los productos para el consumo diario.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque se divierte con sus compañeras y por la ayuda que le dan. 

Sus sueños son algún día tener un bazar o una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora (Mary Help of Christians) Loan Group meets in La Sequita parish, which belongs to Montecristi Canton, a flourishing canton in Manabi, known as the birthplace of the Viejo Luchador ("Old Fighter" and a former president of Ecuador) Eloy Alfaro, and known for its famous Panama hats, which are known in and outside of the country.

Here we met Mercedes. She is 46 years old, married and has five children. Four of them are grown, and the youngest is 17 and in high school. Four of her children still live with her. Her husband is a businessman.

As a good wife, Mercedes tries to help her husband as much as she can. That is why she is getting this loan for her husband's business. He sells fruits, legumes and vegetables himself, and he does this four days per week at the Tarqui market in Manta. Our friend Mercedes tells us that he leaves at dawn to go to this market and buy from wholesalers, and later he makes sales to people who come to this supply center to buy products for daily use.

They will use this loan to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes. Mercedes has been in the Loan Group for more than ten years, and she likes it because she enjoys being with her friends and because of the help they give her. 

Her dream is to one day have a bazaar or a well-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy fruits, legumes and vegetables.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter de 50 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lamabayeque.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura,ganadería y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Walter  es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) desde hace algunos años, el lugar donde cría  a sus animales es en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y pastos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para ofertarlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes.  Walter es una persona conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa porel bienestar de los suyos, con el anhelo de que en un futuro tenga exito su negocio.
texts.en:
Walter is 50 years old.  He lives with his family in his own home, which doesn't have water or electricity.  It is located in the rural part of the Mórrope district, which is in Lamabayeque department.  This area focuses on agriculture, livestock, and tourism.

The field that Walter works in is raising and selling sheep (ewes), which he has been doing for several years.  He raises his animals in the rear area of his house, and feeds them with balanced feed and natural pastures.  Once they reach the ideal size and weight, he sells them in different markets.  He has his own customer base, and with the income he earns he is able to cover his family's needs.

He has requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,500 New Soles to buy more animals and their respective feed.  This will allow him to keep them well fed, so as to be able to sell them to his customers for a better price.

Walter is a well-known person where he lives, because he is always focused on the well-being of his family and has the desire to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Elena's Group

texts.en:
Elena is the leader of this group. She is 39 and married to a builder. Four years ago with an initial investment of 500 soms, Elena started to breed poultry and pigs. At the moment, her monthly profit is 2,000 soms. She applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing more chickens and pigs. She hopes that the loan will help her to improve the business. In the future with the profits gained, she plans to repair the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and pigs to breed

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, a 31-year-old tuk tuk (auto rickshaw) driver earning $8 per day, has two children, both yet too young to attend school. His wife used to sell vegetables, but has been at home since the birth of their last child. Each month, Chanthorn spends $75 on food, $5 on electricity, $30 on transportation and $10 on other expenses.

He would like to request a loan of $400 to buy a new tuk tuk for his business. His wife plans to resume selling vegetables soon.

loans.use: to buy a new tuk tuk for his business.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children. 

Angeles has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles, breads & beverages.  She has had this business for 6 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Angeles has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Angeles hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: La señora Adriana, es  comerciante de artículos de segunda mano (ropa americana y juguetes) y su esposo es rentista jubilado. Adriana con su actividad y la renta de su esposo cubren los gastos de su familia. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (calamina, clavos, madera) ya que realizara el techado de una habitación. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri  en la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la segunda vez que Adriana utiliza el financiamiento disponible en Kiva.
texts.en:
Adriana sells second hand American clothes and toys.  Her husband is a retired pensioner.  Adriana’s business activity and her husband’s pension cover the family expenses.

She needs the loan to buy construction material (sheets of corrugated metal, nails, and wood).  She will put a roof on a room.  She lives in her own house in the Pasankeri  area of the city of La Paz.  This is the second time that Adrian will use a Kiva loan

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal, nails, wood, and other materials to put a roof on a room in her house.

loans.name: Patty May

texts.en:
"To be successful in life" is the main goal of Patty May, a responsible housewife who manages a variety store in their village. She is now 31 years old and has two school-age children. Despite financial difficulty, she wants to improve their sources of income to support the education of their children. 

To improve the business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, eggs, noodles, junk foods and seasonings to sell in her variety store. She believes that when she works hard, she will improve the business. In the future, she hopes that she will see her business grow and their children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, eggs, noodles, junk foods and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Assumpta

texts.en: Assumpta is 51 years old and the mother of two children, ages 29 and 32. She is looking after three children, as well as her husband who is now mentally handicapped. She owns a house in Hoima district in Western Uganda. She has a business where she sells fresh foods, which she has been doing for the past 11 years. Her business challenge is that fresh foods perish very fast. In the future, she hopes to have a big shop where she can sell all kinds of fresh foods. She is requesting a loan to buy bananas, oranges, and other fruits for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase fruits like oranges and bananas

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. She also practices dairy farming from which she gets milk to sell.  She is 40 years-old, married to Michael and they have five school going children.  

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm materials and fertilizer for use in her farm during this planting season.

In the future, Agnes hopes to improve both her farming skills and dairy farming so as to get more income as well as educate their children.

loans.use: to buy farm materials and fertilizer.

loans.name: Akofa

texts.fr:
Akofa est une femme âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 5 ans et le dernier a 09 mois.  
Akofa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des bijoux pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence. 
Akofa a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bijoux. Elle veut réinvestir son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Akofa voudrait agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie la famille.
texts.en:
Akofa is a 26-year-old woman who is married to a driver. She has two children; one of them is in school. The first-born is five years old, and the last is 9 months old. 

Akofa has been working as a retailer since 2007. She sells jewelry to any customer at the market. She purchases her goods in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is the competition. 

Akofa has requested her first loan with WAGES to buy jewelry. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the next few years, she would like to expand her business. With the profits, she says she plans to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis said that,"Patience and hard work" are the key to become a successful entrepreneur.

Luis is married and has two school-aged children. His wife is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker), while he is in charge of taking care of his rice fields and children.  Luis' goal's push him to face challenges in life.  Nowadays, he is suffering from a shortage of funds because of his family household expenses and needs of his children. He decided to borrow additional capital of PHP30,000, allowing him to buy farm supplies to improve his rice fields. He believes that he can increase his rice production this coming crop season and save for the future of his children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies needed in improving rice production

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 40-year-old married woman with five children. Her husband works as a driver and farmer.

Anita and her husband are farmers, working together to till their land and grow rice crops. According to Anita, their farming business earns them 8000 PHP (Philippine pesos) per month.

Anita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and feed. She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and feed.

loans.name: Mirian Iralda

texts.es:
Mirian es una mujer de 28 años divorciada que vive con su pequeño hijo de 3 años en la "Cooperativa 11 de Julio" de Santo Domingo que es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador después de Guayaquil, Quito y Cuenca. Su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. La provincia tiene de superficie 3.857 km² - 352.300 ha a una altitud de 625 msnm. Su temperatura habitual es de unos 25.5°C  y a veces llega a los 38 °C. Toda la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas"  figura como parte del territorio montañoso de la costa, de la cordillera occidental, históricamente conocida como Provincia de Yumbos y Capital de los Colibríes. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. Es una provincia considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Mirian trabaja fabricando cepillos de plástico para uso doméstico desde hace 7 años. Su jornada de trabajo diaria es de 8 am a 5 pm; le ayuda una persona que ella contrató para poder cumplir con los pedidos que realizan sus clientes. Ella desea un crédito para poder invertir en materia prima y así lograr que su negocio crezca, este sería el segundo crédito que Mirian ha solicitado para invertir en su negocio y se destaca la puntualidad en los pagos que mensualmente realiza.

A pesar de la materia prima ha subido y de que hoy en día la situación económica del país se ha vuelto difícil, Mirian se esfuerza para que su negocio cada día crezca más ya que su meta es incrementar la producción y así tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mirian is 28, divorced, and lives with her small three year-old son in the Cooperativa 11 de Julio area of Santo Domingo, which is the fourth most populated city in Ecuador, after Guayaquil, Quito, and Cuenca. Its population continues to grow rapidly, with its rich commercial activities and the largest cattle market in the country. 

The province has an area of 3,857 square kilometers; 352,300 hectares is at an altitude of 625 meters above sea level. Its normal temperature is about 25.5° Celcius, and sometimes it reaches 38° Celcius. The entire province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas forms part of the mountainous coastal area in the western cordillera. It is known historically as the "Province of Yumbos (an indigenous people)," and the "Hummingbird Capital".

It is located in the humid tropics of Latin America. It is considered a new province, as it was created in 2007.

Mirian has been making brushes for home use for seven years. Her daily work day is from 8:00am to 5:00pm. She has hired a person to help her fill the orders from her customers. 

She wishes to obtain a loan, in order to invest in raw materials, so that she can succeed in making her business grow. This would be the second loan Mirian has applied for, in order to invest in her business. Her punctuality in making her monthly payments is outstanding. 

Despite the fact that raw materials have gone up in price, and that nowadays the economic situation of the country has become difficult, Mirian is doing her best to make her business grow. Her goal is to increase her production, and so have a greater income.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making brushes for home use.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 55 years old and a single mother of one adult child. She has been in the farming business for the past year with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which she uses to support her child.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lilian will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her farming. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Juan Antonio es soltero, tienen 23 años de edad, esta graduado de maestro de deportes, se dedica a jugar fútbol en una federación deportiva, lleva ya 5 años con este trabajo.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para apertura una tienda de artículos de consumo diario, va a compra aguas gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, dulces, cereales, azúcar, etc. Espera su negocio sea rentable y recupere una buena ganancia.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio is single. He is 23 years old and has a degree in sports. He plays football in a sports league. He has had this job for 5 years.

He decided to ask for a loan to open a store that sells products for daily use. He is going to buy carbonated water, juices, candies, snacks, cereal, sugar, etc. He hopes his business will be profitable and that he will make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy store products.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with five children between the ages of 4 and 18 years old.  She describes herself as innovative. Mwanaidi  operates a retail business where she sells sand; she has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are masons.  In addition, Mwanaidi provides rental housing services. She describes her biggest business challenge as low purchasing power at certain times, especially during rainy season. 

Mwanaidi will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more sand to sell. Her business goal is to run similar retail outlets that will help increase her income within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more sand to sell.

loans.name: Nyaibanda Savings & Credit Group

texts.en: Stellah is a 39 year old woman with three children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She operates a bar alongside farming to supplement her incomes. She started business in 2006 where she has managed to make tangible benefits and has paid school fees for her children. She intends to use the loan to buy Waragi a local brew and beer to sell. The biggest challenge in her business is inflation accompanied by low turn up of customer. She is a member of Nyaibanda Savings & Credit group where members offer member group guarantorship to obtain a group loan.

loans.use: to buy Waragi a local brew and beer to sell.

loans.name: Tesla Rudibel Andino

texts.en: I have had the shop for 8 years, and I have been able to grow the inventory and develop strong customer loyalty in order to provide for my whole family.  I sell shoes for the whole entire family from my shop in the San Juan market in the town of Siguatepeque.

loans.use: Buy inventory

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
My name is Carmen D. and I sell french fries with sauce and grated cheese. I have had my business for 3 years and I have a good clientel as I sell my product inside a public institute. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to have better production. With the additional earnings I will be able to buy another frier for the potatoes as well as give a good education to my daughter, who is ready to enroll in school.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Carmen D. me dedico a la venta de papitas fritas con salsa y queso rayado, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que yo vendo mi producto dentro de una institucion publica, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprarme otro carrito de freir papas asi mismo darle un buen estudio a mi hija que esta por ingresar a la escuela.

loans.use: To purchase oil, butter, salt, potatoes, plates, napkins, grated cheese, tomatoe sauce, drinks and gas.

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en: Muzaffar is a father of three children. He is 36 years old. He started his business 10 years ago, after he lost his job at the factory. At the beginning, he was helping another entrepreneur. Over time, he collected enough money to rent his own place and sell food products. He often says that no matter what happens, people will always buy food. Therefore, he chose to sell food instead of another type of goods. The location of his business is in a main market of the town- “Panjshanbe”. It is a closed market, and he thinks he is lucky to have a comparably comfortable place of work. He will use the loan to expand his business and purchase a bigger volume of goods.

loans.use: Trade of food products

loans.name: Khazangul

texts.en: Khazangul is a mother of 7 children. She was born in 1950  in Salyan region, Yenikand village.This kind woman is a widow. It is difficult to bring up children alone. 15 years ago she decided to start  breeding cattle in order to  support her family. Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy  2 machines to help her in her work.

loans.use: To buy 2 pieces of equipment to help in her work

loans.name: Unisa

texts.en: Unisa K. is a petty trader.  He owns a stall at the market in Makeni, Sierra Leone, where he sells imported clothes and shoes.  Aged forty-nine, K. is a father of six children and is the sole breadwinner for the family.  With his previous loan from SMT, K. managed to increase his income and pay for his children’s education and other family expenses.  He is determined to improve the standard of living for his family by expanding his business.  He is therefore requesting for a larger second loan of $200.

loans.use: Expansion of his clothing shop

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Mrs. Lach K., age 28, works with her husband to manufacture chopping boards to sell to wholesalers, earning about $4 per day together. They have one child who is too young to attend school. In order to increase their output, she would like to request a loan of $600 to purchase more wood and saws. She anticipates that the increased output will raise revenue and provide more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase wood and saws to make chopping boards

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children. He makes and sells ice cream which he makes in a small production facility in his home. He has been doing this for more than 10 years. He also sells plants. Both businesses are going well, as during winter he primarily sells plants and in the summer he primarily makes and sells ice cream.

With the loans he has received from the Fundación Paraguaya he has invested in the purchase of more freezers which enable him to store a larger quantity of ice cream. Oscar affirms how important it is to have a good amount of working capital so people can work independently so as to be able to purchase products at discounted and wholesale prices.

One of Oscar's wishes is that during the Virgen de Caacupé festivities in December, that this year is like previous years where there is a lot of business and activity that contribute to his earnings. He hopes to obtain a loan in order to improve the infrastructure of his business and thereby prepare himself for the upcoming holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Oscar tiene 41 años está casado y tiene 3 hijos, el se dedica a la fabricación y venta de helados, su pequeña fábrica lo tiene en su mismo domicilio y en éste rubro está hace más de 10 años, como actividad adicional también vende plantas, en ambos negocios le va muy bien ya que en la temporada de invierno se dedica en gran porcentaje a la venta de plantas y en el verano a la fabricación y ventas de helados.

Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya los ha invertido en la adquisición de más congeladores que le permita almacenar gran cantidad de producción de helados, el señor Oscar afirma lo importante que es contar con un buen capital de trabajo para las personas que trabajan en forma independiente porque esto le permite obtener los productos a precios mucho menor y al contado.

Uno de los deseos de Oscar es que ésta temporada de las festividades de la Virgen de Caacupé que se realiza en el mes de Diciembre, sea como los años anteriores dónde hubo mucha concurrencia de personas y que contribuyó a obtener mayores ganancias. El desea obtener un crédito para mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y de esta forma prepararse ya para las festividades de este año.

loans.use: Remodel the infrastructure of his business (paint and repairs)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a refrigerator and making improvements to her work space (Comprar un enfriador y arreglar su lugar de trabajo)

loans.name: Jesús Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jesús del Carmen O. is a woman who has dedicated a large portion of her life to working. Her business consists of selling fruits and corn-based drinks in small quantities. She is a single mother with four daughters under 15 years old, and she needs to provide for them during their scholastic years. She also sells clothing in small quantities during times of need, with the sole goal of maintaining the family nucleus.

She started her business 22 years ago. Of course, with the birth of her four daughters and being a single mother she looked for other business opportunities to help with their expenses. It's for this reason she decided to purchase her produce and then market them to her customers and later do the same with a small volume of clothes.

Kiva partner Ceprodel has helped her invest in her business with a total of 16 loans, which she has used to purchase products to sell. He goal is to reach higher sales levels and be one of the best merchants in León.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Jesús del Carmen O. es una dama que gran parte de su vida la ha dedicado al trabajo. Su negocio consta de venta de frutas y refresco a base de maíz (refresco de chicha) pero en menores cantidades. Es madre soltera con cuatro hijas menores de 15 años por lo que es su deber buscar la manera de suplir las necesidades de cada una de ellas por estar en la etapa escolar. También se ha dedicado en determinados momentos a vender ropa pero en menores cantidades con el único propósito de mantener su núcleo familiar.

Su negocio lo inicia hace 22 años, sin embargo con el nacimiento de sus cuatro hijas y al ser madre soltera busca la manera de obtener otro negocio que le ayude con los gastos de sus pequeñas. Es por esto que decide Invertir para la compra de sus productos para luego comercializarlos y además invierte en la compra de mínimos volúmenes de ropa para ofrecerlo a los clientes.

Ceprodel ha sido su ayuda ya que le ha brindado un total de 16 créditos que los ha invertido en la compra de sus productos para comercializarlos. Su meta es alcanzar mayores niveles de ventas y ser una de las mejores comerciantes en el departamento de León.

loans.use: Purchase products to increase inventory

loans.name: Azimhuja

texts.en: Since he was sixteen Azimhuja has been providing taxi services with his car. In spite of his young age, Azimhuja is very diligent and hard working. He is dreaming of developing his business in the future and with this purpose he has applied for the loan of $225.00 US dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase spare parts for his car in order to be able to provide services of higher quality to his clients. Let us help this young man develop the business that will play an important role for the future of his family. Borrowing for the first time, Azimhuja promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
With the idea of helping out with household expenses and helping her husband with the education of their children (who at the time were all minors) Vilma decided to open a business 12 years ago, and since then Vilma has gone to work every day at the market in her district. At her stand she sells all types of seasonings for cooking and also cleaning products.

Her husband works as a mechanic and fortunately always supports Vilma in everything. She has no limitations and plans to keep working as long as she has the strength to do so. For the time being, what she would like most is to be able to expand her store so that she has more space to put more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Con la idea de ayudar en los gastos del hogar y a su esposo con la educación de sus hijos (en ese entonces menores todos) Vilma decidió abrir un negocio hace doce años y desde el primer día Vilma sale a trabajar a diario al mercado de su distrito. Ella vende en su puesto todo tipo de aderezos para la cocina y también productos de limpieza.

Su esposo trabaja como mecánico y felizmente siempre apoya a Vilma en todo. Ella no tiene límites y asegura seguir trabajando hasta cuando tenga las fuerzas suficientes. Por el momento lo que ella más quisiera es poder agrandar su tienda teniendo más espacio para poner más mercadería.

loans.use: Expand her store in the market.

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en:
Anjela is 38 years old and is a divorced woman with 2 children, ages 16 and 12 years old. Anjela has sold fish since 1998. Everyday, she works from 3am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $258 from her sales.

She is hoping for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Señora Karina lives in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department and belongs to the Mujeres Coraje Communal Bank. She is 37 years old and has three children. Karina’s husband is a merchant, but his income alone isn’t enough to support their family. Because of this, Karina decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300 Soles in a business selling homemade meals. Now she has a trolley where she sells sausages and fries, hamburgers, and roasted chicken. In the mornings Karina cares for her daughters and her home, and leaves to sell her food at night. She’s very popular with her clients. With a loan of 1,500 Soles Karina will buy: disposable plates, eggs, meats, sodas, flour, potatoes, vegetables, and other supplies. She’s very grateful for the loans that she’s received from Manuela Ramos, because they’ve given her the opportunity to work hard and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Karina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Coraje, ubicado en el Jr 1° de Mayo 650,del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Karina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de salchipapas. En la actualidad ella tiene un carrito salchipapero que con los prestamos recibidos pudo comprar, ahora también vende hamburguesas, pollo brosther, por las mañanas atiende a sus hijas y su hogar, en las noches sale a vender, y tiene mucha aceptación por sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: platos descartables, huevos, carnes, gaseosas, harina, papas, verduras, etc. Karina esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por los prestamos brindados, le dio la oportunidad de invertir y poder trabajar para salir adelante.

loans.use: With the loan, Karina wil purchase supplies to make her products.

loans.name: Kheang

texts.en: Kheang A. is married and lives with two of her children. She works as a farmer in the Kampong Cham province, typically making US$2 each day, and she is supported by her husband who works and sells land. Her husband needs a backhoe to first dig up the land before he can sell it, so the family would like a loan of $1200 to rent a backhoe. In the future, the family hopes to purchase a backhoe to work the land, but for now a loan to rent will bring an increase of income to the family.

loans.use: Rent a backhoe

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru:
Habiba A. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is married and has three children. She is a housewife and practices agriculture. She grows vegetables and sells the harvest at a market. Habiba leases a large plot of land and would like to obtain the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers and also to pay for the land lease. She can repay the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Эшбуриева Хабиба Эргашевна жительница города Турсун-заде. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Домохозяйка , занимается сельским хозяйством. Сажает овощи , а получаемый урожай продает на базаре.Взяла в аренду большой участок земли и хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить семена и удобрения . А так же оплатить аренду земли. Погасить кредит сможет за 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mgeni's Nyota Njema Group

texts.en:
Mgeni is 33 years old and married with 2 children, aged 6 and 3. She has been a clothes seller since 2003. Every day she works from 8 AM to 6 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mgeni now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Asha and Jokha.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Нурматова Зульфия жительница района Восъе.Возраст  35 лет, вдова, имеет 4 детей. Зульфия н центральном рынке района имеет небольшую торговую точку.Торгует клиентка  бытовой химией.Жителям района не нужно ездить в город за стиральными порошками, мылом и т.д.Они знают ,что все это она могут купить не далеко от своего дома.Клиентка содержит своих детей сама одна. Поэтому хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки.Чем будет у нее больше качественного товара,тем больше получить доход.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zulfiya N. resides in the Vose region. 35-years-old, she is a widow with four children. Zulfiya has a small trade outlet at the regional central market, where she deals in household cleaners. Her neighbors do not need to go to town for laundry powder, soap, etc. They know that they can buy all that not far from home. As the sole source of support for her children, Zulfiya wants to increase the variety of goods she has to offer. The higher the quality of the goods she has, the greater the income. She plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Mrs. Rama T. lives in Balkhu, Kathamndu with her husband, Mr. Manohari T., one son and daughter-in-law. The entire family is engaged in farming. They grow seasonal vegetables in their land. Now they are growing green vegetables in their land. They sell their vegetables in the morning and the evening daily. 
Now, Mrs. T. is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for their work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Darine

texts.en:
Darine A. S. has owned a mini-market in Jnah, a suburb of Beirut, since 1996. A mother of three, she opened this small business to help her husband with the family's income and to pay for their children's schooling. Her mini-market is situated in a busy area, so she has been able, over the years, to have a growing number of clients pass by her shop and buy all type of food products. 

Today she requests a loan of $1200 to buy more inventory and continue to cater to her clientele.

loans.use: Buy Inventory

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth tiene 26 años, es soltera y viven en casa con su madre. Se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de casacas de cuero, las cuales trae desde la ciudad de Desaguadero, que queda aproximadamente a 3 horas de Puno, lo cual se le hace difícil, ya que ella vende al por mayor y tiene que traer grandes cantidades. A Lizbeth le gusta su trabajo porque le da independencia y puede ayudar en los gastos a su mamá. La venta es muy buena, ya que vende cada casaca a un buen precio y la demanda de estas prendas van en aumento, es por eso que Lizbeth quiere aumentar su venta, comprando más casacas para vender en estas épocas navideñas. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y está comprometida en pagar de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is 26 years old, single and lives with her mother. For the past four years, she has sold leather jackets which she brings from the city of Desaguadero, approximately three hours from Puno. This is very dififcult for her since she sells the jackets wholesale so she has to bring huge quantities. Lizbeth likes her job for the independence it provides her and because she can help her mother with household expenses. Sales are very good and she is able to sell each jacket at a good price. Demand for her goods is increasing which is why Lizbeth would like to increase her sales, buying more jackets that she can sell during the Christmas season. This is her first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the stock of jackets to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 43-year old married man with two children, living in his village Al Kfour in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon. Ali has been a taxi driver for 15 years. Today he wants to borrow $500 to change his taxi tires. In addition he plans to fix his taxi's engine.

loans.use: Change his taxi tires in addition to fixing his taxi engine

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Esther J. age 42 is married with three children ages 23, 14 and 10. She owns a genge  (fruits and vegetable stand). She started this business in 2005 and works daily from 8am until 6pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $175. 

This will be Esther’s fouth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the three previous loans to increase the stock of her genge and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to expand her genge by purchasing more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Esther will share this loan with subgroup A of the Mapatano group. The subgroup has 8 members, who run shops, grocery, hardware, sell clothes and are photographers. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Esther in 1st on the right front row.

loans.use: To increase on her genge (fruits and vegetable stand).

loans.name: Ayaba Djigbondi

texts.fr: Cette dame fait un peu de commerce général, elle vend des boissons, des produits de beauté et des produits d’alimentation. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2002 et a déjà obtenu du crédit de chez wages, elle demande un second crédit de wages d’un montant de 500000F pour acheter des produits de beauté, des boissons et des produits d’alimentation. Elle est célibataire et mère d’un enfant. Elle travaille dur pour pouvoir bien s’occuper  de sa famille
texts.en:
This is a lady who works in general commerce a little. She sells beverages, beauty products, and grocery items. She has been in this business since 2002 and has already been the recipient of a WAGES loan. She is asking for a second loan from WAGES in the amount of 500,000 francs to buy beauty products, beverages, and groceries. She is unmarried and a mother with a child. She works hard to take care of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and more

loans.name: Chhiem's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for three joint borrowers. Mrs. H., 29, is the leader of the group and is a mother of two young children who attend school. She supports her family's daily expense by raising pigs at home. She can sell her pigs to a slaughterer once in every six months. To further support the family’s need for food, her husband, Davy, works as a truck driver. Recently, H. sold all her pigs to a slaughterer and hopes to have other pigs for raising. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy piglets to raise. 

The other two borrowers are K. and K. K.. K. is a widowed mother who sells groceries in the village. She requests a loan to increase the stock of her grocery inventory. K. K. sells sweets to pupils in the local school, and seeks a loan to buy ducklings to raise. The borrowers of this group live in Toul Ta Ek Commune in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Mohammad Dahood

texts.en:
Mohammad Dahood is the son E.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 47 years old, married, and has six children. Two sons work with him in his general store and the others are students. He works very hard to earn money to pay for his family's living expenses.
 
Mohammad wants to purchase additional materials for his shop and make it larger. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to buy all the materials for the shop. 

He would like to say that Kiva is the best.

loans.use: To buy materials  for his shop

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Victor A. se dedica desde hace 17 años a la venta de platanitos fritos en bolsa en el Mercado Mayoreo siendo esta actividad el único sustento que le permite mantener a su familia. 

Todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana el señor Victor fríe los plátanos en su casa y luego los introduce en bolsas para comercializarlos en todo el mercado. Una estrategia que utiliza es que por lo general se establece en un área donde venden juguetes para niños ya que este lugar es muy visitado por los compradores y allí aprovecha para vender sus platanitos. No solo se mantiene en este lugar sino que  también se mueve por todas las calles del mercado ofreciendo los platanitos y busca la manera de cómo venderlos todos para así obtener sus ganancias. Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito a lo inmediato para la compra de los plátanos y las bolsas para continuar con su trabajo en el mercado.
texts.en:
For the past 7 years Victor A. has been selling fried plantains in the Mayoreo Market, this being the only source of support that permits him to feed his family. Every day since the very early morning hours Victor fries the plantains in his home and puts them in bags to sell them in the market. One of his selling strategies is to place himself next to vendors who sell toys in the market, since these spots are the most visited by his potential clients. He also walks the streets of the market selling his product and he looks for ways to sell out to improve his earnings. Currently he has sought out the help of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner), seeking a loan to purchase bananas and bags to be able to keep working in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bananas.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị  Trình Group

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị T. is 33 years old and lives in the town of Y. Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She leads a six-person loan group. While each member of this group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 03 (3).

Nguyễn is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Nguyễn owns and operates a livestock-raising business. While she has other means of support, her main source of income is raising pigs for sale.  Nguyễn has been engaged in this business for over four years.

Nguyễn joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and engage in business. She is requesting a new loan to buy breeding livestock.  The loan will be her first from DINARI.  Nguyễn plans to use the revenue generated by this loan to improve her life and expand her small business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  Nguyễn V. H. is a 27-year-old male who is requesting a loan to manufacture furniture.

2.  Nguyễn thị H. is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a loan to manufacture furniture.

3.  Trương Thị Hà is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a loan to manufacture furniture.

4.  Nguyễn Thị N. is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a loan to support her business raising livestock.

5.  Nguyễn Thị Y. is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a loan to support her business manufacturing  furniture.

About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050011) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Y. Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Nguyễn là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 03 (3).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Nguyễn thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nguyễn kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 IDR.  Nguyễn đã tham gia DINARI để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 IDR.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ DINARI.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Nguyễn V. H. (20203050012) là 27 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.

2.  Nguyễn thị H. (20203050024) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.

3.  Trương Thị Hà (20203050013) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.

4.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20203050014) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5.  Nguyễn Thị Y. (20203050015) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.

Về DINARI:
Nhiệm vụ của DINARI là cố gắng giữ giàn một môi trường cho phép người nghèo và tạo cơ hội phát triển kinh tế xã hội cho những chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to expand various small businesses

loans.name: Amitié Plus Group

texts.fr: Constant Nsotala fabrique des cakes et des gâteaux qu’il vend dans son quartier situé à l’ouest de Kinshasa. A coté de cette fabrication, il est entrain de développer une petite boutique d’articles divers sollicités par beaucoup de gens. Il a planifié d’acheter avec le crédit de ce mois de mai des produits recherchés par sa clientèle tels que des savons, du sucre, des conserves, etc…dans le souci de renforcer son capital et accroitre le revenu. Constant est menuisier de formation mais il est content d’exercer ce commerce car ca lui procure des moyens financiers pour supporter sa famille. Il a commencé son commerce en vendant du maїs et du manioc en 1996 avec un capital initial de $25. En 2003, au bout d’un dur travail, de la détermination et surtout d’une bonne gestion, il est parvenu à atteindre un capital de $600. C’est ce montant qui lui a permis d’acheter deux fours d’occasion de fabrication des gâteaux. Actuellement, son capital est de $270 et son activité génère un bénéfice de $120 par mois.
