Son ambition est d’ouvrir un jour une boulangerie car la demande est très grande. Constant est mieux connu dans son milieu à cause de la qualité des ses produits. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants âgés entre 10 et 14 ans. Tous deux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Constant Nsotala makes cookies and cakes that he sells in his neighborhood, located in the western part of Kinshasa. In addition, he's developing a small shop selling various commonly used items. He plans to use this loan to buy products his clientele is asking for, such as soaps, sugar, canned food, etc... in order to bolster his working capital and increase his revenue. Constant is a trained furniture maker, but he's happy to run this business because it provides him with financial means to support his family. He started his business in 1996 with an initial capital of $25, selling corn and cassava. In 2003, after years of hard work, determination, and, most importantly, good management, he succeeded in achieving a $600 capital. This amount enabled him to buy two used ovens to cook cookies. His capital now amounts to $270, and his business turns a monthly profit of $120. His ambition is to one day open a bakery, because demand for it is very high. Constant is well known in his field, thanks to the quality of his products. He's married and the father of 2 children, age 10 and 14, who both attend school.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 boxes of soap, 1 sack of sugar, and canned food

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 30 años, es soltera, vive con sus hijas Celeste de 8 años y Erica de 2 años y medio de edad en su casa propia. Ella se describe como una persona muy curiosa, y por esta curiosidad nació su iniciativa de dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza, ya que le permite aconsejar a sus clientas sobre los cosméticos le van mejor de acuerdo a su tez y color de piel. Además de eso también elabora bonitos collares, pulseras, anillos, aretes, etc., siendo una mujer muy creativa. Desde que incursionó en este negocio ha pasado un año, en el cual le ha ido muy bien, ya que todo lo que ofrece y diseña es muy requerido por su clientela, por ello tiene ingresos mensuales seguros, resultándole muy rentable. A Gladis le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que no tiene un jefe, ella misma decide qué hacer y cuándo hacerlo, lo que le da tiempo para el cuidado de sus hijas. Pero su trabajo no es nada fácil, pues requiere de gran dedicación y esfuerzo para realizar cada una de las joyas, además de buena visión y puntería. En un futuro cercano, Gladis quiere tener un gran bazar donde ofrecer toda su mercadería. Este es su primer crédito individual  con MFP, donde se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos, cuando trabajaba con un banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos para cumplir con sus pedidos y también adquirirá mostacillas y otras piedras para realizar sus lindas joyas.
texts.en:
Gladis is thirty years old and single. She lives in her own house with her daughters; Celeste is eight, and Erica is two and a half. She describes herself as being a very curious person. Her initiative to sell beauty products was born from this curiosity. She gives her customers advice about which cosmetics are best for them according to their complexion and the color of their skin. Being a very creative woman, she also makes beautiful necklaces, bracelets, rings, earrings, etc. She has been in this business for one year, and it been going very well. Everything that she designs and offers is much in customer demand. Because of this she has a secure monthly income, which is very profitable. Gladis really likes her work. Since she does not have a boss, she gets to decide herself what to do and when to do it. This gives her time to take care of her daughters. But, her work is not easy. It requires great dedication and effort to make each one of her pieces of jewelry. It also requires good vision and being good at close work. In the near future, Gladis would like to have a large bazaar where she could offer all of her merchandise. This is her first individual loan with MFP. She was punctual with all of her payments when she worked with a community bank. With the money she will buy more cosmetics to fill her orders. She will also buy beads, and other stones to make her lovely jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and buy materials

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso L. is a 34-year-old rice grower who tills a 1.5-hectare farm. He wants to establish a sustainable livelihood and save something for his future family. He is making the most of every opportunity to earn a larger income so that he can buy more farmland. Soon he will settle down but before that happens, he will save all his earnings.

Celso is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). He will use the loan to purchase necessary fertilizers and seeds. Hopefully, this will bring him a good return on his investment.

About CEVI
CEVI helps small farmers to sustain their livelihoods. CEVI gives loans, training and insurance cover to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Tô's Group

texts.en:
N. Tô Thị owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector making general household furniture and selling to local businesses and community members. She is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. N. is married and has two school-age children. N. has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

On 30/12/2008, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,186,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase materials to expand her product offerings. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional materials to expand her product offerings. This will be her second loan from SEDA. N. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

N. is the leader of a four member group seeking a loan from SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đức Lân 05 (5). No. 20213050006

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Tô Thị L. is a 30-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. No. 20213050007

2. Đỗ Thị Huệ is a 43-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. No. 20213050008

3. Trương Thị L. is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. No. 20213050009

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

N. Tô Thị (20213050006) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. N. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đức Lân 05 (5).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND. Vào 30/12/2008, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. N. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.186.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Tô Thị L. (20213050007) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

2. Đỗ Thị Huệ (20213050008) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

3. Trương Thị L. (20213050009) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for furniture making

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia, age 39, is a member of the Tuinuani borrower group in Kola Morogoro. She is married with two children.

Afia started her own clothing business four years ago. She works six hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 120,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Afia's second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested a loan in the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she expects to gain from the use of this loan, Afia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, three sons and one daughter, who are all still in school. She works very hard to help her husband who is a farmer provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Adwoa is a petty trader. She sells underwear for ladies. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. Adwoa procures her goods in bales from Accra. She has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy more goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles for resale

loans.name: Natana

texts.en:
Natana S. makes a living selling bread and charcoal, and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell to her customers. She is 21 years old and married to a clerk. She has three children, all of whom go to school.

With the extra income made possible by her loan, Natana hopes to pay school fees for her children and provide them with school bags, uniforms and other items they need to continue their studies.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Sdeurng K. is a villager in Slaeng Kaung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a tailor. In this work, she needs a loan to buy some cloths and to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. Mrs. Sdeurng K. is 33 years old widow with two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy some cloths and to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 37-year-old businesswoman who lives with her husband and her three young children in the village of Minallo, Naguilian, Isabela. Their eldest, Rhea Joyce, is now 14 years old and currently a third year student in secondary school. Second is Rosalie, 11 years old who is in grade five in primary school. Their youngest is just four years old and not yet studying.
	To make a living, Susana indulged herself in planting vegetables in their backyard. She has been planting various kinds of vegetables which bring a lot of benefits to her family. It gives her a lot of savings since their daily consumption of vegetables comes from here. 
She hopes to maintain her business with a new loan amounting to PHP8,000 for the maintenance and development of her business. She will utilize her loan to purchase more vegetables to plant and other necessary materials such as fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetables. Susana will also purchase additional vegetables and fruits from the market to be able to sell for additional income. She hopes and prays that her loan will again be provided by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Efracia

texts.en:
Our client is Efracia. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors who live in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru. Efracia is from Ccorao. She is 32 years old and is married with two children who are studying in secondary school.

Efracia is new to the group but has received other loans in the past. She has a small grocery store where she sells products like rice and sugar. She sells approximately 80 soles per day, which is roughly equivalent to $28. She will use this loan to stock her grocery store with more items.

Efracia appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María Lourdes Rosas tiene ya más de un año dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, este negocio y el trabaja de su esposo son la fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que tiene tres hijos de diferentes edades y quieren lo mejor para ellos.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión, y no quieren descapitalizar el negocio.
Es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir  en mercancía y así su negocio crecerá más en ventas y tendrán mas ingreso. 
Con las ganancias de esta nueva inversión del negocio planea pagar el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor Gilberto Reyna se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso de su trabaja como supervisor de mantenimiento de una compañía de trasportes.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Lourdes Rosas has been selling groceries for more than a year. Her business, as well as her husbands work, make up the family's income. She has three children of various ages and they want the best for them. María needs more varied merchandise for her business but, at the moment, does not have the funds necessary to invest without taking away from her business. For this reason she and her husband are applying for a loan- to invest in merchandise for her business to increase sales and create more income. With the profits of this new investment she plans to pay back her loan, as her husband, Mr. Gilberto Reyna, will pay for household expenses with the income from his work as a Maintenance Supervisor for a transportation company.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier Zúñiga C. tiene la edad de 45 años habita en la comunidad el Edén ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual le ayuda con las cosas del hogar y en los cultivos, ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos dos jóvenes que estudian su secundaria y un  pequeñito de cuatros años, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que su casa esta construida de madera y quiere que en un futuro se le apoye para construir su vivienda , el desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento ya que sus cultivos carecen de fertilizantes e insumos , el inicio con sus propios esfuerzos para poder mantener su a su familia , el quiere financiamiento para la compra de insumos el cual aplicara al cultivo
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Javier Zúñiga C. is 45 years old and lives in el Edén, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Together with his wife who helps with the household and farming duties, they have 3 children. Two of the children are in secondary school and the other child is 4 years old. The family’s plan is to improve their quality of life, their house has been built of wood and in the future, the family would like to build a home. He has worked in agriculture for 30 years. The biggest difficulty has been the lack of financing since his crops lack fertilizer and supplies. He started with his own efforts in order to take care of his family, he wants financing to buy supplies that he will apply to his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve production

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is a 27 year-old single woman who lives in Nablus, a city in Palestine. Shireen has a beauty shop where she sells makeup, cosmetics, perfumes, creams and accessories.

She requested a loan of 3,000 US dollars from Ryada in order to purchase merchandise for her business.  Shireen will be able to grow her business and provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.en:
Mahmadali D. is 38 years old. He is married and the father of three children who are all in primary school. He began to work with land at a young age because of lack of financial resource. He grows different kinds of vegetables, which has allowed him to support his family, but with difficulty. Mahmadali is now requesting first loan of 4000 Somoni to enlarge his business and purchase seeds and fertilizer to grow for onions and wheat. This should allow him to satisfy the needs of his customers and improve socio-economic conditions for his family and himself.

 

 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: http://www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: María Thelma

texts.es:
La venta de cosméticos es el negocio al que muy esforzadamente se dedica la señora Thelma en el mercado Central en Chinandega donde muy temprano inicia sus ventas para lograr la satisfacción del cliente. Atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en el negocio y para ello ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los cosméticos tales como shampoo, jabones, cremas, perfumes, entre otros.
Por este motivo es que ella espera que su crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y así logrará mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia al adquirir los ingresos de la venta de estos cosméticos.
texts.en:
Thelma sells cosmetics in Chinandega's central market. She starts her day very early in the morning in order to satisfy her customers' desires. She needs to invest in stock inventory, so she is asking for funding to buy cosmetics like: shampoo, soaps, creams, perfumes, etc. She hopes her loan request will be granted so that she can improve her own and her family's living conditions through the earnings from the sale of these cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Reyna Sulema

texts.es: Doña Reyna tiene la edad 55 años,  desde su juventud ha apoyado a sus hijos que junto con su esposo crearon, el trabaja en vigilancia y su salario es bajo es por eso, que doña  Reyna vende desde varios años  hielo y helados  para ayudar a pagar los gastos de agua de luz, luego comenzó hacer pasteles de queso lo cual se ha ayudado. Para ellos es difícil hacer mejoras a su pequeña casa ya que le es difícil comprar todo de una solo vez, es por eso nace la iniciativa de hacer préstamo en Afodenic para levantar las paredes de concreto ya que vivía insegura por  lo cual lo logro por este medio. Ahora desea con este financiamiento poner piso ya que su casa es de tierra para mejor higiene, como que sus muebles no se le pudran en la tierra y reparar la división que es de durpanel, le puso de este ya que es el mas barato. Para comenzar comprara: cemento, arena, piso, madera, clavos para hacer las mejoras y poder estar en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Reyna, 55, has supported the children she and her husband had every since she was young. He works as a security guard and his salary is very low. Because of this, Reyna has sold ice and frozen treats for several years now to augment family income and pay for such things as water and electricity. She then began to make cheesecakes, the sales of which also added income. It has been very difficult for them to make small improvements to their home because it's very hard to have enough money to buy all the necessary supplies at one time. Thus the need to call on Afodenic for financing to build concrete walls, which allowed her to feel safer. Now, she needs funding to install flooring for better hygiene because her house currently has dirt floors. This will also prevent her furniture from rotting in the bare dirt and she will also be able to repair the room division, which is currently made of durpanel (a type of pressed wood panel); she used this material because it's the least expensive. To begin, she will buy: cement, sand, flooring, lumber and nails to start the improvements and thus be in better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly E. is a 42 year old, married woman who lives in Pou Bay village, Takeo province. She earns a living through her general store while her husband, Mr. Kim Eng E., is a farmer. They have two children, one of whom supports the parents while the other one is a student in the local school.                 
Mrs. Ly E. is a grocer who can earn a small income to support her family. She wants to expand her business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries to sell. With this loan she will increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.
Her husband is in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for resale

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y dinámica, comparte su vida con su  esposo e hijos en su casa propia.

Desde hace un año, junto a su esposo trabajan brindando servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros, para ello cuentan con una camioneta para aproximadamente 12 personas. Ambos se esfuerzan mucho para que su trabajo sea productivo y les arroje buenas ganancias, es por ello que tratan de mantener su movilidad en óptimas condiciones. Su esposo es quien maneja la camioneta y Yovana administrar los ingresos y egresos, puesto que ella tiene un negocio paralelo de venta de productos de nutrición y para bajar de peso. Para el futuro, ambos quieren comprar otra camioneta parar formar su propia empresa de transportes.

Este es el cuarto crédito de Yovana con MFP y hasta el momento ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita refaccionará su camioneta para que siga brindando un buen servicio. También adquirirá más de los productos energéticos que vende.
texts.en:
Yovana, 32, is a very hard-working, dynamic woman; she shares her life with her husband and children in their own home. For the last year, she and her husband have been providing urban transportation services; they have a 12-passenger van. Both make great efforts to insure that their work is productive and that it generate good profits. This is why they try their best to keep their vehicle in optimum working condition. Her husband is the driver and Yovana manages income and expenses; she also runs a business selling nutrtition and weight-loss products. For the future, they want to buy another van and set up their own transportation firm. This is Yovana's 4th loan with MFP. To date, she has been responsible and punctual with repayments. She will use the requested funds to service her van so that it can continue to provide good service. She will also acquire more of the energy products she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For van service and maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ofa

texts.en:
Ofa F. is 35 and married with 4 children (ages 1 - 6).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Ofa has 2 years of experience in this business.  Ofa needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Ofa joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Ofa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria D. F. is from the village of Sawali Fuentes, Iligan City. She is 45 years old. Gloria is separated from her spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Burayla Murzabekova Group

texts.ru:
Бурайла, является лидером этой группы. Ей 47 лет. Ее супруг работает водителем в кирпичном заводе. Ее сын на заработках в России, старшая дочь студентка, вторая дочь на заработках в России, младшая школьница. Она на данный момент готовит земли для посева, в основном выращивание и перепродажа картофеля и кукурузы. Бизнес был начат 25 лет назад, ранее выращивали табак. Кредит запрашивается для закупа минеральных удобрений.

Рахматилла, 41, лет. Его супруга домохозяйка. Сам клиент занимается строительными работами. Кроме этого у его семьи есть земельный надел, где они выращивают овощи. Кредит нужен для закупа минеральных удобрений.

Сооранай 42 года. Супруг в данное время находится на заработках в РФ. В данный момент она ведет бизнес самостоятельно (супруг и сын сейчас в России): занимается внутренне-отделочными работами. Она самостоятельно принимает заказы, за аккуратность в работе имеет большой спрос. На кредит она планирует купить скот.

Дилбар, замужем. Супруг, Кожомкул, зарабатывает на жизнь работая трактористом. Клиент готовит земля, к весеннему посеву. Кредит запрашивается для финансирования полевых работ.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Burayla is the leader of this group. She is 47 years old. Her husband works as a driver at a brick factory. Her son is a migrant worker in Russia; the oldest daughter is a college student; the second daughter is also a migrant worker in Russia; and the youngest attends school. At this time, Burayla is preparing the soil for planting. Her business mainly consists in growing and selling potatoes and corn now. This business was launched 25 years ago; previously they were growing tobacco. The loan is being requested for purchasing mineral fertilizers. Rahmatilla is 41 years old. His wife is a homemaker. He works in construction. In addition, the family has a land plot which they use for growing vegetables. The loan is being requested for purchasing mineral fertilizers. Sooranay is 42 years old. The husband is a migrant worker in Russia. At the moment she keeps the business by herself (as her husband and son are in Russia): she does interior home renovation. She herself accepts orders from clients and her business is popular because she is very thorough in her work. She plans to use her loan to buy cattle. Dilbar is married. Her husband, Kozhomkul, makes a living as a tractor driver. She is now preparing the soil for the spring planting. The loan is being requested in order to finance farming work.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Soipei Ene Kitaei

texts.en:
Sopia Ene Kitaei T. is 24 years old. She is married to Pariken T. and is the mother of four children.

Sopia is a farmer and does the farming on her own piece of land which she has been working for the last three years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend the fifty thousand Kenyan shillings to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten acre wheat farm. Wheat has proven to do well in this area and the market is readily available to both retail and wholesale buyers.

She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Sopia's dream is do large scale farming and have her own farm machinery. 

She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer for her ten acre wheat farm

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi T. is married to a fridge mechanic by profession. Esi sells both Fante kenkey and Accra kenkey (Ga). Esi has been in the kenkey business for about a year now. Esi will add the loan she is hoping to receive to her original capital to buy bags of maize to prepare kenkey for sale. In great anticipation, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize to prepare kenkey

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mrs. Mely A. is from the village of P2 Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years of age and married to Domingo A., a carpenter, and at the same time her business partner. They were blessed with four children, all adults with their own families now.  Mely is presently engaged in buying and selling junk, particularly scrap metals, plastics and bottles. She and her husband have been engaged in this business for five years and earn approximately $220 a month from sales of their scrap metal, plastic and bottles.

 In 2007, Mely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital for their recycling business. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, and as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion and for buying another motorcycle for business use.
 
 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for their recycling business

loans.name: Bano Begum

texts.en: Bano begum lives in the historical city of Lahore, Pakistan. She is fifty four years old and stays at home to care for her five children — four sons and a daughter. Two of her sons make shoes along with their father who has been doing this work for the last 10 years. They receive orders from the shoe factories and shoe shops and earn profit by filling them on time. The other two work in the fruit market as fruit vendors. Bano has successfully completed two loans from Asasah and now has applied for the third time for her family business. With the loan amount they will buy leather, nails, and shoe polishers in bulk and fill larger orders on time to generate more profit.

loans.use: Purchase materials for shoe making business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily L. is from the village of Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 49 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Emily sells fish. Emily has been in business for 18 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. 

Emily joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC to purchase additional products to sell.  Emily is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.  This loan will be her second from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 
       
-------------------
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional capital of her fish selling business.

loans.name: Sayda Patricia

texts.es: Sayda Patricia tiene 30 años de edad, ella vive junto a su esposo en su casa propia, sus dos hijos que son menores de edad. Hace más de 15 años trabaja vendiendo ropa, la modalidad de venta lo realiza visitando a sus clientes, y luego de un tiempo se dispone a realizar las cobranzas de su producto ya que tiene su propia tienda en donde llegan algunos clientes, vecinos y familiares. Este trabajo es su principal fuente de ingresos, ella viaja a diferentes departamentos para adquirir variedad de prendas de vestir, en diversos colores y diseños que sean atractivos para su clientela, que en su mayoría es público femenino. Es su primer crédito y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sayda Patricia, 30, lives with her husband and two minor children in her own home. She has sold clothes for over 15 years. She visits her customers to sell items and gives them a period of time to pay since she has her own store where some customers, neighbors and relatives come by. This work is her main source of income. She travels to various departments to acquire items of clothing in a variety of colors and styles that will be attractive to her customers which are mostly women. This is her first loan and she pledges to be very punctual with repayments. She will use the requested funds to buy a larger amount of clothing thus increasing her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: La señora Ana Sánchez es Originaria de la Ciudad de León y se ha dedicado a trabajar arduamente para llevar el sustento a su mesa y así suplir todas y cada una de las necesidades de su hogar. Es importante destacar que ella es muy trabajadora y la razón por la que hoy en día está solicitando el crédito es para ser invertido directame en el pago de los estudios de su hijo porque así lo necesita y es de importancia destacar que su sueño es llegar a ver a su hijo convertido en un gran profesional para bendición de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. is originally from the city of Leon and she is a cook. Her family is made up of two minors. She has a small house that she has been improving with her own funds. This is her eighth loan provided through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and it will be used to cover personal medical expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover the university tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo N. is from the village of Taguma, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 35 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Domingo owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 6,200 PHP a month. In 2010, Domingo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair his motorcycle in order to provide better service. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. Domingo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle in order to provide better service

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Mrs. Phuong S. is a villager in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She was born in 1980. She and her husband, Mr. Kosorl Ros, are farmers who own a 2.5-hectare plot of land that they use to cultivate rice to sell in order to support their family. Mr. Ros also is a duck breeder who earns money from selling duck eggs. Since her husband’s duck breeding job is going well, she wants to help him expand it. So, Mrs. Phuong S. is asking for a loan to buy sixty more ducks. With the rest of the loan money, she will buy fertilizer and pesticides, and will hire workers for her farm. She is a mother of two children, one who is studying in school, and the other who is three years old. Mrs. Phuong S. and her husband are featured in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase sixty more ducks

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr:
femme de 38ans celibataire et mère de 4 enfants agée de 23ans à 8ans.Elle debute son commerce dans l'un des marché de la ville en 1992 avec un capital de 100000frs.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité en achetant des tomates fraiches, des choux,des pommes de terre,de la ciboule, de l'ail, des aubergines,des poivrons.
Malgré les difficiltés d'approvisionnement de certaines marchandises,elle séefforce à avoir une bonne gestion, reserve un bon étallage et un bon acceuil à ses clients.
ses Ambitions sont d'élargir son activite sur tous les marché congolais de la ville et devenir grossiste ainsi que offrir une bonne scolarisation à ses enfants et inscrire ses deux fille ainée dans des écoles de couture et de coiffure.
elle jouit d'une bonne réputation dans sa maison et son quartier.
texts.en:
This  38-year old woman is the mother of four, from 23 to 8 years of age. She had launched her business at one of the town markets in 1992, with a starting capital of 100,000 West African Francs. This loan will allow her to bolster her business by purchasing fresh tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes, scallions, garlic, eggplants, peppers, etc. In spite of the difficulty restocking some of her produce, she puts in an effort to manage her business well, maintain her stock level and offer a warm welcome to her customers. Her goals are to extend her business presence to all Congolese markets in her town and become a wholesaler, as well as to provide a good institution for her children and enroll her two older daughters in school for sewing and hairdressing.

She enjoys a good reputation in her neighborhood.

loans.use: Purchasing tomatoes,onions, eggplants, cabbage, scallions, garlic etc.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel P. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old. Noel is single. To make a living, Noel owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing photocopy services to local community members. Noel has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Noel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 45,000 PHP from GDMPC. Noel is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the 17th loan taken out by Noel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a hard-working man who runs a cafeteria.  He has employed two people in his cafeteria.  He also sells groundnuts.  He was previously selling fruit before he opened his cafeteria.  He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping him to increase his business stock through loans. 

 Julius is able to educate his six children with the income from his business.  He hopes to expand his business and open another outlet in the future.  He has requested 30,000 Kes to buy baking flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana D. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Susana is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Susana owns & operates a business making and selling snacks & other delicacies, especially cinnamon bread, in the local community. Susana is just starting this business because she finds that she is earning more in this cinnamon business than in a retail store.

In 2010, Susana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Susana is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Susana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a thirty five year old married man with six children living in his own house in Fort Portal Uganda.  He has a dream of educating his children up to tertiary level. For two years Christopher has been in the motorcycle business and the sector has helped him to promptly provide basic needs for his family. Christopher needs the credit to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José vive en la zona de villa copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es empleado en las fuerzas armadas, y también realiza trabajos de diseño grafico
Es soltero y no tiene hijos.
El crédito será destinado para el pago de pensiones en Diseño grafico en un instituto especializado, como también en la compra de computadora y que le servirá para sus estudios y también pueda realizar trabajos independientes.
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Jose lives in the area villa copacabana in the city of La Paz. 
He is employed by the army but also does graphic design projects.
He is single and has no children.
The loan will be used to pay for tuition at a specialized institute of graphic design, as well as purchasing a computer that he will use for his studies and to make independent work projects.
This is the sixth time that he requests a loan to Impro and the second time through Kiva.  His record qualifies him as client type 1 which means good repayment of his loan.

loans.use: Make payments to the Graphic Design Institute where he studies and also to purchase a computer

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna S. is from the village of Bayabas, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 37 years old. Myrna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a specialized retail store, busying and selling bananas in the local community. Myrna is just starting this business.

In 2007, Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business again. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Myrna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expanding the business.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor José Alfredo E. trabaja como Ayudante Fontanero en una empresa aguadora desde 5 años. Vive en la ciudad de Managua en el barrio Costa Rica

Es casado de 43 años de edad, tiene 3 personas a su cargo una de ellas es menor en edad escolar

Agradece a CEPRODEL, ya que le permite con este préstamo mejorar su vivienda y darles a sus hijos una vida más cómoda en una casa segura y saludable. Este es su primer crédito con CEPRODEL y espera pagar en tiempo y forma para poder seguir siendo cliente.
texts.en:
Mr. José Alfredo E. has worked as an assistant plumber at a water company for five years.  He lives in the city of Managua in the Costa Rica residential area.

He is 43 years old, married and has three people who are dependent on him for income.  One of them is school-aged.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL for the loan which he plans to use to make home improvements and to help his children live more comfortably in a healthy, safe home.  This is his first loan through CEPRODEL and he is committed to paying it back on time so that he can continue being a customer.

loans.use: For home improvement

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz lives in Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives with her family in a 2-room brick house in the small colony called Tariq. 

Mumtaz is 43 years old.  She is married to S. A., who is an embroidery expert. His shop is located in the market where he offers his clients his embroidery skills. He makes embroidery by hand and also with an embroidery machine. He crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes, which help attract more customers to his shop.  

Mumtaz is also very good in embroidery. She offers services to her community clients. She started this business 10 years ago to financially support her family and it is working well for her.  She is also a very good administrator – she manages her household expenses very well and fulfills her household work effectively. 

Mumtaz has given birth to 6 children: 2 sons and 4 daughters. Her eldest son works in a private factory and her elder daughter helps her in the embroidery business.  Only one of her children is able to get education. He is 12 years old and is studying in the 5th class.

Mumtaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her embroidery business. With the loan, she will purchase an embroidery machine to  help her finish orders on time and produce quality work.  She hopes her business will further improve after the loan investment.

Mumtaz is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that this will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy an embroider machine for embroidery business

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Guillermo se dedica a la cría de ganado lechero  y es productor lechero cuya producción la venda a la planta industrializadora de leche PIL;es crédito lo requiere para comprar un par de vacas lecheras para incrementar su producción de leche; su esposa le ayuda con las actividades agrícolas, tienen tres hijos   y ambas actividades son la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir gastos de su familia. Vive  en casa  propia ubicada en la Localidad de Tipampa en la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz. El cliente se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente desde el año  2007.
texts.en: Guillermo works raising milk cows and producing milk. He sells his milk to the industrial plant called PIL. He needs this loan to buy a pair of milk cows and increase his milk production. His wife helps him with the agricultural work and these activities are their source of income for covering the family expenses. They have three children. He lives in his own house in Tipampa in the Omasuyos province of the department of La Paz. The client is satisfied with the credits that have been granted to him since 2007.

loans.use: To buy a pair of milk cows to increase his milk production.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile P. is from the city of Labuyo Tangub City. She is 26 years old. Cecile is married and has one infant. To make a living, Cecile owns and operates a transportation services business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Cecile has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cecile joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecile has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cecile is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cecile from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Kitumbo Group

texts.en:
Zulfa S., who is in her early 30s, is single with two children. She has been running a small restaurant where she sells pancakes, cookies and chapati (flatbread). She has been in businesses for two years. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Zulfa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to start the business of selling chapati, cookies and pancakes and has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. Her dream is to one day build her own house.

Zulfa will share this loan with her loan group "Kitumbo," which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Zulfa is second from right in the front row.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 25 años, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el Centro Poblado llamado La Matanza, en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Alberto brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Transporte la gente en la ruta entre Olmos y sus caseríos. 

Desea realizar algunas mejoras a su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo. Asimismo desea comprar algunos accesorios que necesita para mantener su moto en buenas condiciones y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y hacer algunos arreglos en su domicilio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Alberto is 25 years old, married, and lives together with his family in La Matanza, in Olmos district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Alberto provides a passenger transport service in his motorcycle taxi (a vehicle which consists of a motorcycle with a cabin in back which is used for transporting people).  He transports passengers along the route between Olmos and its small villages.

Alberto would like to make some improvements to his vehicle which is his main work tool.  He would also like to buy some accessories which he needs to keep his motorcycle in good condition so that he can continue offering a good service.  With the help of this loan, he hopes to increase his income and make some repairs to his home.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on his vehicle

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristino, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, él vive con su esposa y su hija pequeña de 4 años de edad, él se dedica a los cultivos de hortalizas desde hace 20 años, aprendió el proceso de las hortalizas por al proyecto ejecutado por CRV-MAG, en el cual daban asistencia técnica a los agricultores sobre dicha producción.
El cultivara tomates en dos manzanas de terreno y para eso solicita un préstamo, para adquirir semillas, fertilizantes y abonos, estos insumos le ayudaran a mantener un buen cuido de la siembra y estar al pendiente de cualquier riesgo de plagas.
Su objetivo es trabajar siempre en las hortalizas ya que es un trabajo que le agrada realizar y que su buena cosecha depende del cuido y dedicación que se le brinde, espera que también su familia pueda progresar económicamente a través de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Cristino lives in the Corinto section of Morazán.  He dedicates himself to planting crops, and lives with his wife and small 4-year old daughter.  He has been in farming for 20 years, having learned the process through a project managed by CRV-MAG that gave technical agricultural assistance to farmers.  

He will grow tomatoes on two blocks of land, which is why he is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  These supplies will help him provide good care for the crops and watch for any risk of plague.  His goal is to always work in farming as is this a job he enjoys doing, and because yielding good production from the crops requires care and dedication.  He hopes also that his family will be able to progress financially through his work.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Las Dueñas I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “ LAS DUEÑAS I”, está integrado por 10 personas en este grupo se encuentra la señora Gabriela V. M. de 30 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 8 años de edad, su negocio es una Pastelería desde hace aproximadamente 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella quiere continuar invertiendo para que mucha gente conozca su producto ya que recientemente abrió una nueva sucursal y esta creciendo poco a poco por esta razón necesita los prestamos para continuar con sus sueños e invertir en más materia prima y fortalezca su negocio. Sus planes a futuro son expandir más su negocio con la apertura de más puntos de venta y brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, tamién quiere ver a sus hijos conm una carrera profesional para que logren sus sueños y la vean como un ejemplo a sehuir.
texts.en:
This group is called "LAS DUEÑAS I” and has ten members.  30 year-old Gabriela V. M. is a member of this group.  She has two children aged 4 and 8.

Gabriela's business is a cake shop and she has been in the business for approximately 11 years.  She would like to continue investing so that lots of people become familiar with her products since she recently opened a new branch and it is growing gradually.  She needs loans to continue making her dreams a reality, to invest in more raw materials and to strengthen her business.  Her plans for the future are to further expand her business by opening more sales locations and to provide her children with a better quality of life.  She would also like to see her children become professionals so that they can achieve their dreams.  She would like them to see her as an example to follow.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials for her cake shop

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is a thirty eight year old married woman with  two children.  She owns a house in Kasese Uganda. She has had a retail business for three years. Joy needs a loan  to buy clothes and shoes for her shop. Her vision is to educate her children and to  have a wholesale shop to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana vende de todo un poco, usted puede encontrar en su negocio, calzado, ropa, perfumes y hasta medicina natural y también asesoría en como consumirla, porque ella está muy bien formada en ese tema.  Ana  vive en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio, con su cónyuge tambien  comerciante y pensionado de una empresas y sus dos hijos en las edades de 20 y 25 años, uno de ellos estudia diseño gráfico y el mayor trabaja en una empresa.  Desde muy joven Ana es comerciante pues lo aprendió de su padre a sus 17 años de edad, por eso ahora en su negocios le va muy bien,  tiene como a sus principales clientes,  personal de oficinas, empleados bancarios, vecinos, familiares y permanentemente tiene referidos de sus mejores clientes, que con su vocación natural de servicio conquista,  logrando convertirlos en clientes fijos. Ana en su negocio  trabaja  7 horas diarias de lunes a  sábados,  vende principalmente a crédito y compra de contado de acuerdo a su recuperación de cartera. En el sector objetivo de su mercado,  tiene una gran competencia que constantemente invaden a sus clientes con todo tipo de ofertas, pero ellos la prefieren por la calidad de su servicio y el cumplimiento en los pedidos, además de manejar unos muy buenos  precios. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento a través de la línea credikiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen y sobre pedidos: calzado de caballero y perfume principalmente porque para el día del padre,  estos serán los regalos que sus clientes han encargado para ofrecerle un detalle a sus progenitores a propósito de esta fecha. Su meta más adelante es tener un punto comercial de los perfumes que traen los catálogos, porque así tendrán sus clientes acceso a muchas ofertas más oportunamente. Mientras Ana construye sus sueños,  continua trabajando en su negocio que le ofrece una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor de un 34% y que aspira a incrementar gradualmente.
texts.en:
Ana sells a little bit of everything.  In her business, you will find footwear, clothes, perfumes and even natural medicines.  You will also find advice about how to take them as she is very well trained in this area.  Ana lives in Ciudadela 20 de Julio neighborhood with her husband, who is also a salesperson and receives a pension from a private company, and their two children aged 20 and 25.  One of their children is studying graphic design and their eldest works for a company.

Ana has been a saleswoman since she was very young: she learned the business from her father when she was 17 years old.  For this reason, her business is doing very well.  Her main customers are office staff, bank employees, neighbors and family members.  She permanently receives referrals from her best customers.  With her natural vocation for service and achievement, she manages to turn these into regular customers.  Ana works in her business for 7 hours a day, from Monday to Saturday.  She mainly sells on credit and buys for cash, in accordance with the recovery of her portfolio.

She has a lot of competitors in her sector of the market who are constantly bombarding her customers with all kinds of offers.  However, her customers are loyal to her business as she offers good customer service and always fills her orders.  In addition, she offers very good prices.  

Ana is currently applying for her first loan through Kiva.  She will use the money to buy goods in greater quantities and fill orders - mainly for men's footwear and perfumes for Fathers Day.  These are the products that her customers have ordered so that they can offer a gift to their fathers on that day.

Ana's future goal is to have a sales location for the perfumes that she orders from catalogs so that her customers have access to a lot more offers at just the right time.  While Ana builds her dreams, she continues working in her business which has a return on sales of no less than 34%.  She aspires to increase this gradually.

loans.use: to buy products in larger quantities, to fill orders (men's footwear and perfumes)

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 31 años de edad, el es casado  y tiene un hijo menor de edad, Juan Carlos vive en Mórrope en un comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 300 familias allí el tiene casa propia,  la misma que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz.

Juan Carlos se dedica a brindar el servicio de mecánico, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.   

Juan Carlos está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles  para poder invertir en compra de repuestos y construcción de su zanja para revisión de caja mecánica

Juan Carlos tiene la seguridad de que su negocio cuenta con un mercado amplio de acción, lo que garantiza el éxito de su negocio, él es una persona perseverante y responsable, las personas que lo conocen lo describen como alguien amable y generoso.

Juan Carlos es una persona bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos tiene 31 años de edad, el es casado  y tiene un hijo menor de edad, Juan Carlos vive en Mórrope en un comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 300 familias allí el tiene casa propia,  la misma que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz.

Juan Carlos se dedica a brindar el servicio de mecánico, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.   

Juan Carlos está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles  para poder invertir en compra de repuestos y construcción de su zanja para revisión de caja mecánica

Juan Carlos tiene la seguridad de que su negocio cuenta con un mercado amplio de acción, lo que garantiza el éxito de su negocio, él es una persona perseverante y responsable, las personas que lo conocen lo describen como alguien amable y generoso.

Juan Carlos es una persona bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.

loans.use: Implementar su negocio con repuestos y una zanja para la revición de caja mecánica.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is 59 years old and widowed with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Victorina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Victorina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Victorina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Kitumbo Group

texts.en:
Omary, who is in his early 20s, is single with one small baby. He has been selling vouchers and housing units for mobile telephones for two years now.  He works from 6am to 10pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and he wants to use the loan to buying more vouchers, batteries and housing units for mobile telephones. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kitumbo" which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more vouchers,batteries and housing units for mobile telephones.

loans.name: Andrena

texts.en: Andrena, aged 39, is married with four children and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Andrena sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more ingredients for her snacks. Andrena has been a member of PMPC since this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her snacks.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal La Florida, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca ,esta ciudad  es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, también tiene varios lugares para visitar, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía la misma que cautiva el paladar de sus visitante, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 62 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 12 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, tres de sus hijos son casados e independientes, 8  trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y su última hija está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad siendo el fruto del sacrificio conyugal.
 
La Señora María se dedica a la ganadería y es comerciante de leche, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes y aves de corral que son para la venta y para su consumo. Otra de sus ocupaciones es la agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para su consumo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado.
 
Su meta es criar más animales.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a member of the Communal Bank “La Florida”. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, which is known for the beauty of its historical center. There are also different places to visit. Cuenca offers a wide variety of cuisines to captivate the palettes of its visitors. The people have maintained their culture and traditions.

Doña María is 62 years old, married, and has 12 children, all of whom are grown. Three of them are married and independent. Eight of them work and help her financially. Her youngest daughter is a college student in the city. Her husband works as a mason. The house in which she resides is her property and was built as a result of the sacrifices she and her husband have made.

Sra. María raises livestock and is also a milk vendor. She also raises guinea pigs and chickens to sell and for personal consumption. Her other job involves farming, but her harvest is only for her own consumption.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank and she will invest in the purchase of livestock. Her goal is to raise more animals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Davaasuren is 52 years old and lives with her two children and husband in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband supports the family business. Davaasuren operates a grocery products trading business. She started her business in 1991 at Han-Ord local market. She has many years of business experience. She has started to build a house with the profits she earned from the business. She is a diligent woman who is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more products at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase more products at the wholesale price

loans.name: Zayabayar

texts.en:
Zayabayar, 31, is a taxi driver who tries to work hard. He lives with his wife and three children in a his boss’s rental house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Before, he used to do passenger transportation and changed his business into taxi service recently. Besides that, he runs a phone-repair service in the morning.
 
He is one of fathers who wants to get a good education for their children. Now his son, Khongorjin, studies in a private Chinese language school and the fees are quite high. Therefore, he needs a loan to cover the school fee of his son. It is a actually important to him and his son’s future life.   

And Zayabazar has a plan to buy his own apartment where his family can live comfortably, and he has started saving from his daily earnings for his plan. But his taxi car, which is the main tool of his business, has had some defects lately. Therefore, he needs to renovate his car and is taking a loan to purchase the necessary spare parts for car repair as well as for his son’s school fee.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for car repair and to pay his son’s school fee.

loans.name: Houngbeke

texts.fr:
Houngbéké est un homme de 28 ans, il est marié à une revendeuse. Houngbéké a 2 enfants.
Houngbéké est un revendeur depuis 2009. Il a ouvert sa propre entreprise dans la laquelle il vend du matériel électrique à ses clients composés de toutes personnes. Il s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter du matériel électrique et satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Houngbéké, age 28, is married to a reseller and has two children. He's been a reseller since 2009. He created his own company to sell electrical goods to a very wide clientele. He gets his supplies in Lomé.

Houngbéké is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy electrical goods and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
From Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province, Mrs. Va is a 37-year-old married woman who has been working in agricultural work. Her husband, Mr. Horn, also works alongside her on their farmland. They grow rice crops and some kinds of beans both in the rainy season and in the dry season. Together, this couple can earn about $5USD each day, used for managing their household expenses and supporting their children to go to school. 

Mrs. Va has asked for a loan from Kiva to purchase crop sprayings and mineral fertilizers in order to make her plants grow well. For her future prospects, she hopes to improve her farming business and she dreams of having various agricultural materials like a plowing machine and a pumping machine as well.

loans.use: to purchase crop sprayings and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Adawa

texts.en:
Adawa is 43 years old. She is a married woman with seven children who are in school. She has a business selling tomatoes and green vegetables in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for eight years.

Adawa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more tomatoes for sale. She will use her extra income to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes and green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: José Pedro

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Pedro le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor y le preocupa la seguridad de su familia. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar el material que es, block, cemento, arena, varilla y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
