Don José Pedro es empleado de una compañía de limpieza de ropa como chofer de entregas. Con una parte de su sueldo planea pagar el crédito, ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida y que el patrimonio de sus dos hijos este en mejores condiciones y seguro para ellos.
texts.en:
José Pedro’s housing does not have a fence and he is worried about the security of his family. 

He is asking for a loan in order to buy blocks, cement, sand, and rods, and to pay the person who is in charge of building the fence.

José Pedro is employed by a laundry as a delivery driver. With a part of his salary he will pay for the loan, as this is the source of income he has for his family.

He wants to improve the quality of life and the family assets for his two children so they will live in better and safer conditions.

loans.use: to build a fence around the house

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Pauline has been selling clothes in Banana, Kiambu town. She is 25 years old and married to Tyson. They have one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add a stock of shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts.

In future, Pauline hopes to open a boutique for large scale trade.

loans.use: to add a stock of shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 38-year-old single lady who lives by herself and has her own business. Her business is selling cosmetic products and materials at her house and at her sister’s beauty salon where she helps her sometimes. 

Now Sanaa wants to buy more products that were requested by some new customers. By satisfying the customers she will be able to expand and open her own cosmetics store.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products for her business

loans.name: Ikolomani W.g Group

texts.en:
Violet is the facilitator of the Ikolomani W. group. Violet and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Violet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Violet takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Violet had a good maize yield, harvesting 12 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Violet was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Violet will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Ikolomani W. group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Violet is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread, lace, blouses, underwear, and shoes.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran lives in the Ddmashen village area of Sevan. He is 54 years old, married and has two sons. 

Tigran graduated from a technological secondary school, and after that he worked as an electrician for 17 years. After that, he started beekeeping. The past three years he has engaged in animal breeding as well. On his farm, Tigran rears cows, sheep and chickens. Only his wife helps him in his occupation, as Tigran’s sons live in Russia. Tigran sells agricultural produce from his farm. 

Tigran says beekeeping is the hardest, but at the same time, it's a very profitable business so he emphasizes it. He always produces high quality honey and thanks to that, he has many regular customers. 

This is Tigran’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon, and he has never delayed his repayments. 

Now Tigran needs a 1,000,000 Armenian dram loan to buy some bee families, a cow and fodder for his farm animals. This will allow Tigran to develop his farm and thus to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy some bee families, a cow and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is from Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Judith owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been in her business for 6 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Judith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,250 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sokheang's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Sokheang is aged 44 years and married with two children. To make a living, she has been growing vegetables and raising pigs. Sometimes, her husband helps to earn additional income by working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about 30,000KHR per day from the current business and manage to save KHR28,000 daily for the future needs. 
This is the fourth loan for Sokheang with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy more chickens to raise and chicken feeds for nourishing them. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise and chicken feeds for nourishing them

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia works hard to support her family. Lelia is married and has a ice cream vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lelia has been in this business for 24 years now.

In the future, Lelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Oscar Perez

texts.en:
The loan will allow me to manage my goal to turn my Grocery Shop into a basic grain distributor, that will give reputation to my Shop and I will be able to increase my profitsâ€?.

Due to my experience as the owner of this Grocery Shop, I consider that the key to success is that the clients prefer me because I have a good inventory, all the products that they need.

loans.use: I will invest in the purchase of basic products for the Nicaraguan feeding (Rice, beans, Oil, Salt, Sugar, tortillas, etc.) and in other products that are sold quickly like refreshments and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Priscilla wants to buy shares

loans.name: Chor

texts.en: Chor C. is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children.  Her husband works as a soldier, 1 son is a construction worker, 1 daughter works in a garment factory, and two of her children are students and help with her business.  Mrs. Chor sells small bottles of gasoline on the side of the road for motorbikes.  She also runs a small booth of cell phones that people can stop and use.  Her average profit per day is about $3.  She plans on using this loan to buy more gasoline in order to increase her profit.  She also would like to buy some wood in order to build a small home.  In the future, she hopes to continue expanding her business so that she can pay for all of her children to go to school.

loans.use: To buy wood to build house and to buy gasoline for selling on the road.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy at wholesale and sell at retail

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Description of Business

Cecilia has 4 years experience at her business. She began, selling various things, as a street vendor, something that required that she spend a lot of time away from home. Her husband helped her start a business at home selling juices, soft drinks and other beverages. She works everyday from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m.

Purpose of Loan

The loan will be used to buy merchandise for her business. She hopes to stock it with other kinds of beverages. She also wants to buy confectionaries. She would like to help her husband, a fisherman, buy fishing gear that he needs.

Personal Information

Cecilia is married. She’s 38 years old and she has 3 children, only one of whom is in school. Her husband is a fisherman. He comes home every 15 days to help with the household. Their house is made of cana (a reed-like wood) and has a dirt floor. Their goal is to have a small house made of cement which would improve the life of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Cecilia tiene una experiencia de 4 años en el comercio. Se inicio vendiendo artículos varios recorriendo las calles. Debido a que esta actividad le demandaba pasar mucho tiempo fuera de su domicilio. Recibe la ayuda de su esposo y monta un negocio de venta de jugos, colas, bebidas en su domicilio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para su negocio. Espera surtirlo con otra clase de bebidas, jugos, colas. Además de comprar productos de confitería. Desea ayudar a su esposo en la compra de una malla para que realice labores de pesca.

Información Personal

Cecilia es casada. Tiene 38 años. Su familia esta conformada además con 3 hijos. Solo uno estudia. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Regresa cada 15 días a su domicilio. Dando de esta manera un apoyo al hogar. Su casita es de caña y piso de tierra. Su meta es poder tener su casita de cemento. Dando de esta manera una mejor vida a su familia.

loans.use: Diversify the products that she sells.

loans.name: Aline

texts.es:
Mrs. Aline A. lives in the house of her parents located in Villa Pavón, on the east side of the city of La Paz with her husband and her four month old daughter. Doña Aline works as a secretary at a medical practice and her husband works at a veterinary clinic in La Paz. At the present they are living provisionally in a small room lent to them by her parents.

The loan will be used to finish three rooms on the second floor which are already under construction, (brick walls and wooden beams with "calamina" roofing).

This is the first time they have asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analisis shows a favorable qualification for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

La señora Aline A. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Pavón ladera este de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y su hija de cuatro meses de edad; la señora Aline A. trabaja como secretaria en un consultorio y el esposo trabaja en una veterinaria de la ciudad de La Paz Actualmente ocupan una habitación que fue cedida por sus padres de dimensiones pequeñas y en la que están provisionalmente. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de tres habitaciones en planta alta. Es una construcción que se encuentra en obra gruesa (muros de ladrillo y envigado de madera con techo de calamina). Esta es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construction of three rooms

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria has wonderful hands, with them she creates precious works of art of high quality, which are admired by her clients and have made her one of the preferred artisans for commissioning a craft job well made. Victoria has been working full time on creating embroidered cloth crafts. Her grandparents taught her how to embroider, and the experience of many years have made her an expert, as well as efficient in finishing commissioned jobs. With time, Victoria was encouraged to devote herself to embroidering as a means for survival, was offered an opportunity in a workshop not too far from her home. Now she is capitalizing her profits with which she hopes to open a general store in the future with the purpose of enhancing her quality of life. All this is motivated by the unconditional love she feels for her four children to whom she will keep giving her love every day. This is why she is requesting a loan with the goal of acquiring a greater quantity of thread, cloth, and needles to be able to optimize and improve her work. Remember that this hardworking mother and her little ones await soon the reply from your generous heart.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga and son, Kiva volunteers

Victoria, tiene unas manos maravillosas, con ellas realiza preciosas obras de arte y de mucha calidad que son admiradas por sus clientes y la hacen una de las preferidas para encomendarle un trabajo manual bien elaborado. Es así que victoria desde sus diez años se dedica de lleno al bordado de fustanes de manera artesanal, sus abuelos le enseñaron a bordar, y la experiencia de años la hicieron una experta y también ágil para terminar un trabajo encomendado.Con el tiempo victoria fue animada a dedicarse al bordado como un medio de supervivencia, le ofrecieron una oportunidad en un taller no muy lejos de su hogar y ahora está capitalizando sus ganancias con la cual espera a futuro abrir una tienda de abarrotes con el propósito de incrementar su calidad de vida, todo esto impulsado por el amor incondicional que siente por sus cuatro hijos a los cuales seguirá dando cada día todo su cariño.Es por ello que solicita un préstamo con el fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de hilos, telas y agujas a fin de optimizar y mejorar su trabajo. Recuerda que esta laboriosa madre y sus pequeñas esperan pronto la respuesta de tu generoso corazón.

loans.use: Buying more cloth, needles, and embroidery thread to continue and consolidate her craft for the benefit of her beloved children. (Compra de mayor cantidad de telas, agujas e hilos para continuar y consolidar su ocupación para beneficio de sus qeridos hijos.)

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis lives in the San Martin region of the province and district of Lamas and is a founding partner of the Los Chancas Communal Bank. For 28 years now, she has been selling cosmetics and for the last 8 years she has been running a restaurant selling prepared meals and sodas. Both are situated in her home in Pasaje Los Jardines Nº 100.

She is separated from her husband and has 5 children who are now professionals. She began her business casually, when a friend observed her charisma and personality and offered her this job, which she accepted with her faith in doing things the right way. That was how she began winning over clients one by one, house by house and now they are very faithful to her, so much so that she receives orders daily. Likewise, clients and friends go to her restaurant given the excellent treatment and customer service she offers.

With the loan of S/. 1,000.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy beauty products to increase her stock at home and take advantage of the bargains the companies she works with offer. She will also buy ingredients like meats of different varieties by the kilogram, vegetables, legumes and other products for the preparation of the dishes in her restaurant at her client’s request.

Gladis is a jovial and enthusiastic woman, and with the joy that characterizes her, she dreams of reaching old age in tranquility and surrounded by her children.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gladis vive en la región de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Lamas, es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Los Chancas, desde hace 28 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y desde hace 8 tiene un restaurante de venta de comidas y bebidas gasificadas, ambos ubicados en su domicilio en el Pasaje Los Jardines Nº 100 (en la parte alta de la ciudad de Lamas). Es separada de su esposo y con 5 hijos profesionales. Se inició en el negocio ocasionalmente, cuando un amigo observó su personalidad y carisma le ofreció este trabajo, el cual lo aceptó con la confianza de hacer bien la cosas, es así que fue ganando clientes uno a uno, casa por casa y ahora ya los tiene fidelizados, tan es así que los pedidos le llegan a diario, igualmente en su restaurante llegan clientes y amigos dado el buen trato y el buen servicio que se les brinda. Con el préstamo de S/.1,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará artículos de belleza para aumentar el stock que posee en su casa y aprovechar las ofertas de las empresas con quienes trabaja, así mismo comprará los insumos como carnes en kilos en sus diferentes variedades, verdura, menestras y otros productos para la preparación de platos según lo requieran los clientes del restaurante. Gladis es una mujer muy jovial y entusiasta, con la alegría que le caracteriza sueña con tener una vejez tranquila rodeada de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and ingredients to prepare the dishes in her restaurant.

loans.name: Tursunbek

texts.en:
Tursunbek is 35 years old and married with 4 children. His wife keeps house and looks after the kids.

Tursunbek farms a plot of land, which is the only source of income for his large family. He has been growing wheat and potatoes for 5 years now. The yield is sufficient for to feed his family and also generates enough for Tursunbek to support his family.

Today Tusunbek is requesting 1,000 Somoni (US$300) in order to purchase mineral fertilizers and potato seeds. The selling prices for the fertilizer and seeds today are lower than they’ll be in a month. This is Tursunbek's second loan. He has already shown himself to be a responsible client, and promises to repay the loan in 12 months

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer and potato seeds

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 42 years old, married, with two children, ages 20 and 2. She and her husband also take care of a 55-year-old person. Nuru owns a small cafe that she started in 2003. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Esthela Viridiana

texts.es:
Estela T. is a single mother and has 9-year-old daughter. Due to a lack of income and the need to cover the expenses for her small child, she began to save and with a little effort built a business on part of her mother's property, where she began to sell tacos, soups, cakes, etc. With the expenses she incurred, she went bankrupt and had to close. Then, she began to sell secondhand clothes using a mobile cart to the transport the merchandise, combining this with the sale of food: hamburgers, hot dogs, and soups.

Now, she wants to reestablish her business in order to restart the food sales in her mother's house, rent her cart and continue selling secondhand clothing. For this, she is seeking $750 that she will repay in 6 months. With your help, Estela will be able to raise her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Estela T. es madre soltera y tiene una niña de 9 años, debido a la falta de ingresos y verse en la necesidad de solventar los gastos de su pequeña empezó a ahorrar y con esfuerzo construyo un local en la parte del frente del predio de su mama donde empezó a vender tacos, sopes, tortas, etc., por el gasto que hizo se descapitalizo, y tuvo que cerrar entonces se dedico a vender ropa en tianguis apoyada con un carrito móvil, en el cual desplazaba la mercancía, combinándolo con la venta de comida: hamburguesas, hot dogs y sopes,

Ahora desea volver a habilitar su local, para reabrir la venta de comida en casa de su madre, rentar su carrito y continuar con la venta de ropa en tianguis, para esto requiere de US $750 que pagara en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Estela podrá sacar adelante a su hija.

loans.use: To remodel business.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David is 24 years old, and he dedicates himself to transporting city passengers on trufis route 115 (a trufi is similar to a taxi service, but with a fixed route).

David is a single young man with no dependents who still lives with his family. He has 90 months of experience in the field of transportation, an activity which he carries out with great responsibility.

There is quite a bit of competition in this business and, despite this, David has affiliated himself with trufis route 115 which guarantees him a stable income.

He plans to make some repairs and to repay his debt to Agrocapital. The current loan would be his third, and he did have some problems with falling behind previously but did complete his payments. He has current debts with other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

David de 24 años de edad se dedica al transporte de pasajeros a nivel urbano en la ruta fija de la línea de trufis 115. David es un joven soltero, no tiene dependientes pero vive en la casa de su familia. David cuenta con 90 meses de experiencia en el rubro del transporte de pasajeros a nivel urbano, actividad que realiza con bastante responsabilidad. Existe mucha competencia en el rubro, sin embargo David se encuentra afiliado a la linea de trufis 115 lo cual le garantiza un ingreso estable. Destinara el credito al arreglo de su movilidad y el saldo al pago de su deuda con Agrocapital. La presente se trata de la tercera secuencia, tuvo algunos problemas con el credito (retrasos) pero pago con normalidad. También presenta deudas con otras instituciones.

loans.use: Make repairs and cancel balance with Agrocapital.

loans.name: Adesatu

texts.en:
Adesatu is married and has one child. She is pictured above standing in front of her new store. She sells beans, gari (milled cassava), millet, maize, peanuts, and other food items. Adesatu has run her business for about four years now. She treks to the northern part of Ghana to buy her products and then sells them in town to other market women in the same business.

She wants to use her loan to buy more bags of cereals in case of future price hikes. She believes this loan will also help her complete her store so that she can store her products. Adesatu is a member of a group called Odwanwhefo Pa ("The Good Shepherd"). Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals to sell and finish building her store.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Ke S. V., 29, is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in an outlying area. Three children are students and two are too young to attend school. To meet the daily expenses she has a business bringing the clothes from the factory and tailoring them at home. Her husband is a construction worker from village to village. She and her husband can earn collectively about $5 each day. This rainy season her house is flooding, so the travelling around is not so easy. Now Ke needs to have some more money to purchase more clothes in a large amount to increase her profit. The more clothes she has, the more income she makes.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to sew for a profit.

loans.name: Pardali

texts.en:
Pardali N. is 39 years old. He is married, and he has 4 children. His wife is a housekeeper. Thus, Pardali’s business is the main source of income for his family. Pardali works hard in order to make his children happy and to provide them with a good education. In his business, he grows and sells crops such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cucumbers, and carrots. In fact, he has worked in the agricultural industry for ten years, and over that time span he has gained a great deal of experience and a love for the land. At the same time, Pardali raises small cattle to later sell the animals in the market.

As it is now the beginning of the sowing season, Pardali is planning to sow onions, potatoes, and carrots. Therefore, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000 Somoni ($900 USD) over a 9-month term to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. In addition, a portion of the loan proceeds will be used to purchase small cattle. Pardali is counting on your help, and he expresses his deepest gratitude to everyone for their support.

loans.use: To capitalize on the sowing season by purchasing seeds and fertilizer and to expand his cattle-raising/selling business by purchasing cattle.

loans.name: Fatma's Nyota Njema Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 45 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 15 and 12. She became a bites seller in 1998. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to expand her business by increasing her inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Hawa and Zawadi.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Hadija K., she is 33 years old. Hadija is a divorced woman with three children. She has been running a poultry business since 2007. This means that Hadija rears chicks and sells either the hens (once the chicks have grown) or eggs that they produce. This has helped Hadija earn a nice profit of $250 per month. She is now requesting a loan of $700 in order to purchase additional chicks and feed in bulk. In the future, she would like to open a second business to enable her to increase her profits further.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed in bulk.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin R. is 26 years old. Elchin sells cattle. As a rule he purchases calves in the central market, raises them, and then re-sells them at higher prices at the local market. Being in this business for 7 years now, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to raise them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning at five o'clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable and considerable income for his large family consisting of his elderly parents and brothers and sisters.

Today, Elchin is planning to enlarge his herd and to purchase cows and calves. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 1200 USD. Elchin thanks all for trusting and supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.en:
N. Zulaykho is 20 years old and single. She is running her own business for two years. Zulaykho sells bath towels and bed-clothes in the store which is located in one of the intensively inhabited parts of the city. She began her business in order to have an independent income and to support her parents.

Zulaykho is very nice and polite and has many clients. The business is quite stable and serves as a significant source of income for the family.

Now she requests 2500 Somoni (US$750) in order to increase the range of goods. Zulaykho is planning to pay the loan completely in six months. She promises to be accurate with the paying and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing of bath towels and bed-clothes to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Monday

texts.en:
Monday Aigbogon is 47 years old and married with four children. He sells foodstuffs like fufu made from soaked cassava. Fufu is a staple food in Nigeria. He purchases the cassava from farmers to make into fufu to sell. 

He uses his motorcycle to supply fufu to his customers in the market. The demands for his fufu are high. He is requesting a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more cassava to make into fufu to sell. He is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 32 años de edad, habitante de barrio El Paraisito en la capital de Managua, estado civil casado, su esposa es operadora de la zona franca. Los planes para su familia es terminar la construcción de su casa. Don Juan se desempeña en su pequeño negocio de enderezador y pintura automotriz con Diez  años de experiencia en el ramo de automotriz y un  año de independizarse, inicio como ayudante de pintura y ahorra tiene su negocio propio. Sus metas para su negocio es aumentar el volumen de producción mediante el desempeño con  mejores herramientas y ofreciendo servicio de calidad a nuestros clientes. Gracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra comprar herramientas como: soldador, un teche y otras herramientas que le puedan generar beneficios  en su trabajo y ofrecer cada día mejor calidad de trabajo a sus clientes, y así lograr captar mas clientes para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old, living in the Paraisito neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is married; his wife works for the Zona Franca ** His plan for his family is to finish construction on his house. Juan runs his small auto repair and paint shop with 10 years of experience in automotive work, and one year of working independently. He started as a painting assistant, and now he has his own business. His goal for his business is to increase his volume of production by having better tools and offering a quality service to his customers. Thanks to the loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, he will be able to buy tools such as a welder, a roof (for his business), and other tools that will allow him to generate more profits at work and, each day, offer his customers a better quality of service. Therefore, he will be able to gain more customers to have better income. **Translator's note: The Zona Franca is a governmental organization that regulates exportation from Nicaragua. See www.cnzf.gob.ni for more info (in Spanish).

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools such as a welder for his automotive shop

loans.name: Dun

texts.en:
Dun N., 49, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 
Since 2005, she and her husband have been selling soup from their home to earn a living and are able to make about US$7 per day. They are supported by two of their children working as electricians. This couple together have three children. 
Mrs. Dun N. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to expand her small shop selling soup.

loans.use: To expand her shop selling soup.

loans.name: Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Rey de Reyes",  están representados por la señora Pura quien presenta un como nexo consanguíneo con su hermano el señor Cristian al igual que la señora Dunia y Elizabeth pero ambos cuentan con ingresos totalmente independientes. Las socias de este banco tienen diferentes actividades algunas venden comida por las noches y son promotoras de cosméticos, venta de refrescos, pan, otros se dedican a actividades como la confección de prendas de vestir, serigrafía .como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia de la oferta y la demanda pero los socios saben como salir adelante por sus propios medios. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación de productos y para ampliar los lugares de atención de sus negocios así como para la compra de insumos y materiales.  Las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que se encuentran en su segundo ciclo demostrando capacidad y honestidad en su trabajo y en el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The partners of the "Rey de Reyes" communal bank are represented by Pura, who serves as a familial nexus between her brother Cristian as well as partners Dunia and Elizabeth. Each of them has a totally independent income from various activities--some sell food in the evenings, promote cosmetics and sell soft drinks and bread; others make clothing and silkscreen. As in all commercial pursuits, there is competition and demand, but these partners know how to get ahead on their own. This loan will help them diversify their products, expand their sales locations and purchase supplies and materials. The partners have experience in solidarity groups and are now in their second cycle, demonstrating aptitude and honesty in their work and in the fulfillment of their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Bé năm nay 55  tuổi , gia đình chị có hai con đang học đại học. Năm 2007  chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  và vay vốn để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh hàng nước. Anh Đức chồng chị hiện làm thợ sửa chũa xe đạp. Với thu nhập 5.000.000đ từ kinh daonh và công việc sửa xe của chồng chị Bé không chỉ hoàn trả vốn đúng hạn mà còn có thêm điều kiện để đầu tư cho hai con đi học
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm các loại chè, nước giải khát về bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị Bé, 55 years old, has two children who are both attending university. In 2007, she became a member of the TYM Fund and used a loan to invest in a business selling beverages. Her husband Đức works repairing bicycles. With a total monthly income of 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) from her business and her husband’s earnings repairing bicycles, Mrs. Bé was not only able to repay her loan on time but was also able to pay for her two children to go to school. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy various types of tea and soft drinks to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling tea and soft drinks

loans.name: Sovang

texts.en:
Sovang M. is 27 years old and she lives in Thmey village, in Kandal province.  She and her husband, Khut Chenda, use rice to make wine.  Since their business is doing well, they want to expand, but they do not have much money. 

Sovang decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to make more wine to earn income.  She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan.  She has two children who are enrolled in the local school.  Her husband is shown in the photo.

loans.use: Add to savings to make more wine to earn income.

loans.name: Irineo

texts.es:
Irineo  es socio del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Irineo es casado tiene 53 años, cuatro hijos de 21, 16,14 y 12 años, los tres últimos están  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Trabajaba en construcción civil pero no siempre tenia trabajo, terminaban de construir y se quedaba sin trabajo, eso era mortificante para el. Hace ocho años se puso a criar animales y con las ganancias de los animales junto y se decidió comprar una moto-car  para dar servicio.  
Irineo necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para el arreglo de su moto.
Desde que esta en Finca recibe orientación para sus negocio  a través de charlas, le a ayudado a administrar mejor su negocio, le gusta el compañerismo que hay entre las socias.    
El sueño de Irineo luchar por sus hijos y darles lo mejor.
texts.en:
Irineo is a member of the Mercedes Virgin Community Bank. He is a married father of four children, ages 21, 16, 14 and 12. The youngest three are studying at a state school. He had a job in civil construction, but there was not always work and he eventually lost his job and was unemployed, which was mortifying for him. He started raising livestock eight years ago, and with the earnings from that he bought a moto-car to do a taxi service.

Irineo is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to fix his vehicle. Since he is a member with Kiva partner Finca, he has received his orientation for his business and it has helped him administer his business better. He enjoys the companionship with the other members. Irineo's dream is to work hard for his children and give them the best.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make repairs on his moto-car

loans.name: Pedrico

texts.en:
Pedrico is a 42-year old farmer from the village of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. He is married to Jennilyn, 37 years old, who used to manage a hog-raising business. The couple has been blessed with two children: Jeric, 13 years old, who only finished his second year of high school, and Peter John, who is 4 years old. Pedrico is very thankful that his family has a good family relationship, and his wife is very loving and supportive of him.

Pedrico is requesting to avail a loan of PHP10,000 ($225 US) that will be utilized for his rice farm. According to Pedrico, this amount will enable him to avoid asking for credit from lenders in their town, who charge high interest rates. He believes that joining ASKI (the lending partner) will be of great help towards the growth of his farming. With the loan, he will be able to pay for farming supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, labor compensations, and other expenses.  

Pedrico, being a father of two children, is dreaming that his children will someday finish their studies in college. This is why he works so hard. He also hopes to be able to save more money from farming to pursue the business of hog-raising that his wife has done previously. This would give them an additional source of income, which would help in providing for life’s necessities.

loans.use: To pay for farming supplies and hired farm workers.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Living in the midst of crisis is very difficult, said Editha. Especially if you have a family depending on you, yet have no stable job. Editha is married to Raul, a micro entrepreneur; she sells vegetables in their village of Pieza Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya, a rural and peaceful place. They are both high school graduates and very unfortunate, lacking enough income to support their family needs.

Editha is asking for loan amounting to PHP 5,000 that will served as additional working capital for her vending business in their village so that she can somehow improve her business and will someday have a vending stall in their public market. Finally, Editha said that being part of this lending program will someday pave their way to becoming progressive. Just be patient always and hard working, ended Editha.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz es una mujer soltera que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, a sus 25 años siente que tiene las fuerzas necesarias para trabajar muy duro, vive en L. casa D. sus padres y anheL. mejorar su calidad D. vida. Tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado Santa Bárbara (mercado importante D. L. ciudad D. Juliaca), donD. venD. mercería (especias) a todas las personas que concurren a realizar sus compras diarias, elL. es muy alegre y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa, los cuales compran los condimentos que venD. con mucha tranquilidad, ya que saben que Beatriz es una vendedora D. confianza. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, ya que eso hace más amenas las largas jornadas D. trabajo y lo que le disgusta es tener que trabajar desD. tempranas horas D. L. mañana, aun así está dispuesta a sacrificarse, con tal D. mejorar su vida. Lleva 8 años en este negocio y anheL. tener un puesto más granD. donD. pueda venD. con mayor comodidad sus condimentos y otros productos adicionales. Este es el quinto préstamo D. Beatriz con MFP y quiere pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias D. su banco comunal, donD. participa activamente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercería para implementar mejor su puesto D. venta.
texts.en:
Beatriz is single and has always had to work hard, but she is 25 and has lots of energy. She lives at home with her parents and wants to improve her living conditions. She has a small stall in the Santa Bárbara market (an important market in the town of Juliaca) where she sells spices. She is very cheerful and always greets her customers with a smile. Customers trust her and the condiments she sells.

What she likes most about her work is chatting with other stall-holders, which makes the long working day more bearable. She doesn't like having to start work so early, but she is willing to make the sacrifice in order to improve her living standards. She has had her business for 8 years and would like to have a bigger stall, where she would be able to sell her condiments more comfortably as well as selling other products.

This is Beatriz's fifth loan from MFP and she plans to pay punctually since she does not want to cause problems for her partners in the community bank, in which she is an active member. She will use the $675 to buy more merchandise to improve the range on her stall.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Mrs. Annabelle A., 32 years of age and a resident of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, has a fish-selling business from which she and her husband earn a living. Despite experiencing frequent and varied challenges, they are committed to meeting those challenges rather than getting discouraged.

To feed and support their five children, Annabelle and her husband work hard selling their catch at the market and sometimes wholesale buyers from nearby localities come to buy their catch. They are now requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to acquire a fishing boat. Annabelle smiles at the thought of one day seeing her children receive their diplomas.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Rosie Lou

texts.en:
Rosie Lou P. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 38 years old. Rosie Lou is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosie Lou owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling kitchen utensils in the local community. Rosie Lou has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosie Lou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie Lou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosie Lou is requesting a new loan, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosie Lou from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family and pay the tuition of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ankadjidia 1 De (Ankadjidia De Zoha) Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes du groupe ANKADJIDIA 1 sont toutes mariées et  résident à zoha, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du Mali. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans, 3 enfants  et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
.Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne et tous les trois précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Elles veulent utiliser ce prêt actuel pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles veulent cultiver 7  hectares  en arachide, riz et mil.
Ces femmes espèrent sur une production moyenne de 2 tonnes par hectare soit 14 tonnes. Une partie de la récolte sera vendue dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires et le reste  sera destiné à la nourriture..
Le bénéfice de  la vente (estimé à 55.000 FCFA par femme en fin de campagne)  sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, la prise en charge des frais scolaire, de santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux de mariage des filles..
texts.en:
The 10 women of the ANKADJIDIA 1 group are all married and live in Zoha, a village in the Sous-Prefecture of Fakola, Prefecture of Kolondièba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. They have an average age of 28 and 3 children each on average, and they live in polygamous families. They met due to bonds of kinship and neighborhood.

When Soro Yiriwaso began to give rural loans which correspond to their work as farmers, these women seized the opportunity. They are on their fourth rural loan, and the three preceding ones were correctly reimbursed.

They want to use this new loan to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides. They want to plant 7 hectares of peanuts, rice, and millet. These women hope to have an average harvest of 2 tons per hectare, or 14 tons in all. A part of the harvest will be sold in the various weekly markets and the rest destined for consumption.

The profit on their sales (estimated at 55,000 F CFA per woman at the end of the growing season) will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan, cover school fees, for the health of their children, and for buying wedding trousseaus for their daughters.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
la joven Karla Patricia M. tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella al 100%.
ella se dedica a vender productos para uso personal como ser desodorantes, lociones, perfumes, talcos, aceites, shampoos, acondicionadores, esmaltes de uña, cremas para pies. etc.
Karla tiene 3 años de tener su negocio, con el cual ha logrado traer a la mayoria de sus clientes por su buena atencion y la calidad de su producto.
ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor, tiene que viajar a la frontera entre Honduras - El Salvador para comprar dicha mercaderia ya que en ese sector es mas barato todo.

loans.use: compra de desodorantes, cremas, lociones, perfumes, quita esmaltes, shampoo, acondicionador de pelo, esmaltes de uña, aceite para cuerpo, talcos

loans.name: Be Serious Group

texts.en:
Be Serious is a group of five borrowers led by Tethe D.. They live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Tethe is 27 years old and married with two children aged 5 and 8. She also takes care of one child orphaned in the war. Her children are all in school, the oldest in 1st grade. Tethe was unable to attend school herself because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Tethe’s business is a bakery, both producing the bread and selling it in a temporary market stall alongside the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for five years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic.

Tethe is taking the loan to purchase more raw materials like flour, oil, sugar, baking powder, etc., to meet increased demand. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have a bigger table in the main market and ultimately her own permanent shop. With the profits from her business she dreams of raising her family well in her own house and sending the kids to university.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials for her bakery

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 37 year-old business woman from the village of Cabisera 17-21 Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Ruben who is also her business partner. They have two children and both of them are studying.

Nora and her husband run a livestock business as their main source of income. Her husband is the one responsible for purchasing live cows and carabaos (a type of water buffalo) from different villages and the one who sells in the province of Pangasinan. Nora is in charge of looking for a good animal to purchase. The couple have been in this business since their children were still young.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to increase their business. It will help the business to be more profitable because she knows that the more livestock they sell, the greater the profits generated.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock.

loans.name: Snguon

texts.en: Snguon N., 49, is a local rice farmer who has been working in this sector since 1990. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland. They also harvest and sell their mature produce around three months after they began planting. From this business, they can generate an income of around $3 USD per day. This humble couple has three single children and one married child. One of their daughters has been tailoring from home for years, but she still requires more materials to support her service. Snguon N. is taking out her loan to buy a machine which will enable her daughter to sew clothes.

loans.use: To buy a machine which will enable her daughter to sew clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth T. has been a rice grower for quite a long time now. She grew up on the farm so that even when she was just a small kid, she was already familiar with the process from planting to harvest. She married a farmer. Her husband manages the farm. The harvest is what they use to pay the daily expenses in their home. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. This loan will go far in buying all the farming necessities. Receiving this loan is a big help to her to provide her family a bountiful harvest and better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy farm necessities

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita C. is from the village of Sto Nino, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Edita is separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. Edita owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Edita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Edita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Edita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es: La venta de madera es una actividad donde Graciela C. encontró la  rentabilidad  necesaria para conseguir objetivos personales. Ella cumplió los  43 años esta casada y tienen cuatro hijos,  es presidente de la asociación “Gaviotas” del centro focal villa Exaltación, su grupo esta formado por nueve integrantes y cada uno de ellos tienen diversas actividades, como ser la venta de fruta, actividad a la que se dedica Clotilde, Luisa teje mantas, Verónica vende celulares, Juan es Orfebre. La asociación Gaviotas precisa necesita comprar diferentes productos para poder iniciar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Selling wood is a profitable activity for Graciela C.. She found it necessary to engage in this business in order to achieve her personal goals. Graciela recently turned 43 and is married with four children. She serves as the president of the Gaviotas Association, which meets at the Villa Exaltación Community Center. Her group consists of nine members who are involved in different business activities. Here are a few examples:

• Clotilde sells fruit. • Luisa weaves blankets. • Verónica sells mobile phones. • Juan is a goldsmith.

The members of the Gaviotas Association need to purchase various products that are necessary to continue their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Obou

texts.en:
Obou S., currently in the business of selling beer at home, is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Obou, who is 41 years old and married to a peasant, has seven children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to establish a bar in the nearby market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria tiene 58 años esta casada con el Sr. Juan B., tienen 2 hijas que están estudiando en la Universidad, vive en la ciudad D. San Lorenzo  en su casa propia.
La Sra. Maria tiene una despensa en su casa propia hace 25 años, es un negocio familiar ya que trabajan todos los integrantes D. la familia, mediante sus esfuerzos lograron terminar D. construir una vivienda muy linda y poder pagar los gastos D. la universidad D. sus hijas.
Este crédito es para la compra D. mayor cantidad D. mercaderías a menor costo ya que se acerca las fiestas D. fin D. año.
Es una familia que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old and married to Mr. Juan B.. They have two daughters who are studying at university. They live in the city of San Lorenzo in their own home. Maria has had a store in her home for 25 years. It is a family business, and all of the family members work there. Through their efforts, they were able to complete construction on a lovely home and to pay college tuition for their daughters. This loan is for the purchase of a larger quantity of merchandise at a lower price, as the year-end festivities are near. This family has maD. much progress in life and give thanks to Fundación Paraguaya for all the support they have provided.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulk beverages (soft drinks, wines), foods (breads, noodles, cheese, sugar), cleaning products (soap, bleach), etc.

loans.name: Carla Mayela

texts.es:
La señora Carla Pastrana se dedica a trabajar en su negocio propio de venta de bolsos, fajas y gorras siendo ofertados en el mercado Central del departamento de Chinandega  donde desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana inicia estas ventas con el propósito de obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
Ella vende los bolsos de diferentes marcas al igual que las gorras y las fajas y esto es lo que atrae a las personas para comprar el producto. El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de la mercadería como lo son dichos bolsos, gorras y fajas para continuar llevando a cabo su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carla Pastrana works in her own business, selling purses, belts, and caps in the Central Market of Chinandega. She starts very early in the morning with the goal of obtaining income to maintain her household. She sells purses of different brands, just as she does with the caps and belts. This is what attracts people to buy her products. The loan she is soliciting will be invested in buying merchandise, including more purses, caps and belts, in order to continue with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY PURSES, BELTS, AND CAPS TO SELL

loans.name: Yudith Mercedes

texts.es:
Yudith es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Yudith es soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Yudith tiene un centro de masaje que se encuentra en un local alquilado, brinda servicios de tratamiento de belleza corporal entre otros, Yudith tiene proyectado ampliar su negocio.
Yudith necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una maquina de gimnasia pasiva.
Los sueños de Yudith son tener un spa grande.
texts.en:
Yudith is a member of the Community Bank "Violeta". She is single, 26 years old, and she has a son. Yudith runs a massage spa from a leased locale. She also provides beauty treatments. Yudith is planning to expand her business.

Yudith requires a loan of 1400 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of a resistance training machine.

Yudith's dreams are to own a large spa one day.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a resistance training machine.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny D. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Prk 8, Lacson, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and a vegetable-vending business. Jenny's husband, Rosauro, is 41 years old and works as both a farmer and a trader of scrap iron. They have three children who currently go to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.
Jenny joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2007 with the hope of helping her husband to improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF, she has been able to increase the family income by engaging in her general store and vegetable-vending businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of 12,000 PHP from her business activities.
Jenny is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP was used to fund the operation of both her businesses. It had a positive impact on both the businesses and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her sixth loan, of 18,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional inventory for her store and as capital for her vegetable-vending business. Jenny is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her store and as additional working capital

loans.name: Angel Pablo

texts.es:
Angel es un padre de familia de 56 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el pueblo joven San Martín una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja como chofer en una combi que cubre las rutas Chiclayo – Lambayeque y viceversa desde hace 20 años. Este negocio ha sido su fuente de sustento durante todo este tiempo y con ella ha sacado adelante a su familia. Su rutina empieza desde las 5 am y termina a las 10pm.

Las lluvias que se presentaron en la zona norte del país en las ultimas semanas provocaron algunos deperfectos en su vivienda. Por ello Angel se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le permitan ralizar las reparaciones correspondientes.

Angel es una persona alegre, carismática y muy trabajadora. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Angel is 56 and lives with his wife and their three children in the new out-lying area, San Martín , on the outskirts of the district of Lambayeque, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 20 years he has worked as a combi driver on the Chiclayo-Lamayeque route, and vice-versa. This business has been the source of income that has provided for and helped his family get ahead during all these years. His day starts at 5 am and finishes at 10 pm. The rains that have been falling in the northern zone of his country in the last few weeks have caused some problems with his house. That is the reason Angel is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new sols. The money will allow him to make the necessary repairs. Angel is a cheerful, charismatic person and very hard-working. He has worked with our institution in the past and has shown punctuality and responsibility when he needs to take care of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of house expenses caused by the rains

loans.name: Angela Del Rosario

texts.es:
La  microempresaria: Ángela del Rosario M. Sáenz tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos todos adultos y desde hace mas de 30 años tiene un comedor en donde ofrece servicios de comida corriente y fritos.

Esta microempresaria inicio este negocio vendiendo fritos (tajadas de banano con carne de cerdo) y posteriormente ha ido construyendo su comedor, inicialmente de madera y ha ido construyendo cada pared de cemento. Por tal razón esta solicitando para poder terminar con dos paredes que son de madera y así poder garantizar seguridad en su negocio.

Doña Ángela ha sido cliente de los programas que ADEPHCA ha impulsado con créditos y con estos ha ido construyendo su negocio con mas seguridad, es una de nuestras mejores clientes por la puntualidad de sus pagos y esta solicitando un financiamiento para comprar materiales que a continuación detallaremos, cabe mencionar que la mano de obra la asumirá con sus ahorros.

Necesita comprar: 2 quintales de Hierro 3/8 a US 50 cada quintal, 80 unidades de  bloques a US 1.50 cada bloque, 2 quintales de hierro ¼ a US 50 cada quintal, 2 metros de  arena a US 40 cada metro, 20 sacos de  cemento a US 12 cada saco, 2 metros de piedrín a US 50 cada metro y transporte de materiales US 60.
texts.en:
Microbusiness owner Angela del Rosario M. S. is 54 years old, a single mother, with three adult children. For more than 30 years she has run an eatery offering popular meals and fried food. She started her business selling fried foods (banana slices with pork), and subsequently has gone about building her eating establishment, initially of wood, and gradually cement for each wall. She requests a loan in order to do away with two wooden walls, and sustain her business. Angela has participated in ADEPHCA loan programs and has built her business to the point that it is more stable. She is one of our best customers, because she pays punctually. She is requesting financing to purchase materials shown below. We should mention that she will cover the cost of labor from her savings. She needs to buy: 2 quintals (quintal = 100 lbs.) of 3/8 iron, @$50; 80 units of blocks @$1.50/block; 2 quintals of ¼ iron @$50; 2 meters of sand @$40; 20 bags of cement @$12; 2 meters of rock finishing @$50; transport of materials, $60.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3/8 iron, blocks, 1/4 iron, cement, rock finishing

loans.name: María Dominga

texts.es: La señora A. L., se dedica a la administración de su pulpería personalmente, tiene dos hijos, uno mayor de edad y uno menor, tiene más de 30 años de tener su negocio, el que le ha permitido obtener sus ingresos para el sustento de su hogar, con este préstamo invertirá en productos como granos básicos para abastecer su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes, para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. L. manages her own grocery store. She has two children. One is an adult and the other one a minor. She has been working in her grocery store for more than 30 years and been able to make profits to maintain her home. With this loan she plans to invest in products such as basic grains to supply her business and offer them to her clients to make greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of basic grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn and beans

loans.name: C1186 Ituze Group

texts.en:
Ladislas is 45 years old and is married with eight children who are between 7 and 23 years old. He is the president of a group called “Ituze” and this group is commonly known in the business of selling a variety of goods in their shop since 2000. Their shop is open from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Ladislas and his team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company with the purpose of expanding their business. They hope that the use of this loan will allow them to start wholesaling to the retailers. With this wholesaling, they will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow them to keep reinvesting in the business for better progress.

loans.use: To purchase of a large quantity of goods for their store

loans.name: Lilia Esther

texts.es:
En el Barrio Santa María al Sur Occidente de Barranquilla, los vecinos son muy solidarios y constantemente reúnen fondos para obras que embellecen la zona y ayudan a que fluyan nuevos clientes en sitios donde antes no llegaban; este es el entorno en que se desenvuelve Lilia Esther C.   de 71 años y su familia, que viven   muy cerca a un lugar llamado "la Cascada", donde se realizan reuniones políticas y actividades como la celebración del día de la mujer entre otras, impactando el aumento de las ventas en la Miscelánea y refresquería que tiene Lilia, porque siempre hay un motivo de celebración; en la actualidad su refrigeración se ha tornado muy mala, porque un congelador “sacó la mano” y ella quiere reemplazarlo, por eso está solicitando su tercer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor de $1.800.000.

Lilia Esther es viuda y tiene 7 hijos de 33 a 59 años de edad, ella  desde sus 20 años llegó a Barranquilla procedente de Cartagena con una hija de 2 años y la ilusión de mejorar sus ingresos trabajando inicialmente como empleada doméstica;  tiempo después, se comprometió con su cónyuge y tuvo sus otros hijos, compro su primera casa y  desde allí comenzó a preparar y vender alimentos como  sopas, hayacas y fritos, finalmente  adquirió una casa mas amplia en el barrio Santa María, donde aun vive hace mas de 35 años. Lilia es un ejemplar mujer que con su empuje para el negocio, logró criar 7 hijos con muy buenas costumbres, enseñándole principalmente la honestidad y el valor por el trabajo.

Hace casi tres años impulsada por su hija, que también es clienta de la Fundación, se acercó a conocer sus programas y desde entonces ha recibido 2 créditos, con ellos ha ampliado su negocio y adquirió mejores ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades del hogar. Sueña con que algunos de sus hijos, que aun no tienen una casa propia, puedan gozar de un bien  familiar y tiene como meta organizar físicamente  su negocio realizando algunos arreglos locativos.
Sus mayores desafíos están relacionados con las temporadas altas y bajas, a las que siempre debe estar atenta, porque en las altas se incrementan sus ingresos pero también su trabajo y debe ahorrar, para que en “épocas de vacas flacas” o temporadas bajas, ella pueda resolver sus necesidades y no quedarle mal a nadie.
texts.en:
In the neighbourhood of Santa María, south west of Barranquilla, everyone joins together to raise money to make the area more attractive and bring in new customers who otherwise wouldn’t have visited. This is the environment in which 71-year old Lilia Esther C. and her family work. They live very close to a place called “La Cascada” where political meetings and activities like Mothers Day celebrations are held. All these visitors have a beneficial impact on Lilia’s sales of general goods and soft drinks. At the moment she has no refrigeration system as her freezer has broken down, so she wishes to replace it. For this reason she is asking for her third loan with Kiva partner, the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. Lilia Esther is a widow and has seven children aged 33 to 59 years. In her twenties she moved from Cartagena to Banrranqullia with her 2-year old daughter and the dream of increasing her income. At first she worked as a domestic servant. Some time later she got married and had her other children. She bought her first house and began cooking and selling food such as soup, hayacas (meat wrapped in cornmeal dough and banana leaves), and fried items. Later she bought a larger house in Santa María where she has lived now for 35 years. Lilia is a role model with her business drive and her well-mannered seven children. While she was bringing them up, she taught them honesty and the value of work. Encouraged by her daughter (who is also a client of the Foundation), about three years ago Lilia learned more about its programs and since that time has had two loans. She has used the money to expand her business and thus earn more money to cover household expenses. Her dream is that those of her children who do not yet have a home of their own will one day have their own house. Her goal is to make some physical changes to her business. High and low seasons give her some problems as her income is higher at certain times of the year. During those times she has to work harder and make sure she saves money for the tough times so she has enough to live on and not cause problems for anyone.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Jhonny Richard

texts.es:
El joven Jhonny tiene la edad de 32 años, padre de familia de dos hijos,
Para el no ha sido fácil poder construir su casa toda de concreto, ya que solo el arranque es de piedra, y luego de zinc ya que es de  pocos recursos económico,  su esposa trabaja como cocinera para poder ayudar a pagar los gastos básicos de agua, luz. El trabaja como guarda de seguridad,  y auque su salario es bajo, pero es fijo lo que le permite dar la alimentación a sus hijos.
Su anhelo es lograr una casa segura y digna para sus hijos que espera a través de estos financiamientos mejorar ya que es el medio viable, para poder avanzar en la infraestructura.
Este préstamo será destinado para el cambio de su techo, ya que por ser muy viejo se le pasa el agua, lo que le preocupa por la salud de sus hijos. Para esta obra comprara zinc, madera, clavos entre otros para hacer el cambio.
texts.en:
The young Jhonny is 32 years old and is the father of a family with two children. It has not been easy for him to build his house completely of concrete; only the first part is made of stone, and then it is zinc, since he has few economic resources. His wife works as a cook to help pay the basic expenses of water and light. He works as a security guard, and although his salary is low, it is regular, which allows him to feed his children. His goal is to have a safe and worthy house for his children. He hopes to improve his house through this financing, since it is a viable way to make progress on the infrastructure. This loan will be used to change the roof, since it is very old and it leaks, and this causes him to worry about the health of his children. For this work, he will buy zinc, wood, and nails, among other items, to make the change.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc, wood, nails, and other materials to change the roof and provide better comfort for his family

loans.name: Judith Marisol

texts.es: Judith Marisol C. de 41 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, de diferentes marcas y precios, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, en donde vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como maestro de matemáticas y junto a sus dos hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad. Judith es alguien que le encanta trabajar por el bienestar de su familia, ya que ha pesar de muchos esfuerzos, todo se ve retribuido de la mejor manera al ver a su grupo familiar viviendo de una manera estable y feliz. Ella trabaja de forma ambulante ofreciendo diferentes tipos de cosméticos como cremas, maquillaje, perfumes, y otros más, así mismo comercializa joyas, lo cual ofrece de casa en casa con sus vecinos y amigos. Sus ventas son bastante estables, por lo que desea poder aumentar su inventario para hacer crecer su negocio, ya que en la actualidad cuenta con muy poco productos. Judith solicita un préstamo por medio del cual compre mayor cantidad de cosméticos y así mismo de joyas, ella necesita poder contar con el dinero del préstamo hecho a Integral, debido a que sus ventas son al crédito, por lo que no siempre cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar todo lo que necesita. Judith desea mucho mejorar su negocio y de esta forma crecer como comerciante.
texts.en:
Judith Marisol C. is 41 years old, and dedicates herself to selling cosmetics of various brands and prices. She lives in the Department of Ahuachapán along with her husband, a math teacher, and her two children ages 16 and 14. Judith is someone who loves to work for the well-being of her family since, despite having to put forth a great effort, it is worth it to see her family living a stable and happy life. She works as a merchant, offering different types of beauty products such as creams, makeup, perfumes, and other items. She also sells jewelry, which she offers door-to-door to neighbors and friends. Her sales are stable, and she would like to augment her inventory to grow her business as she currently has very few products. Judith requests a loan in order to buy a larger quantity of cosmetics and jewelry. She needs to be able to rely on the loan made by Integral because her sales are done on a credit basis. For this reason, she does not always have the necessary capital to buy all the goods she requires. Judith wishes to improve her business and, in this manner, grow as a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Soputheavy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Soputheavy is 50 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its fourteen members who located in Prey Lve Lech village, Takeo province. Each member of this village bank loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. K. Soputheavy is a desert seller who is able to earn a small income to improve her family living. She is now requesting a loan to buy desert supplies to support her business activities.

Her husband, Mr. Thoeun Nav, is a construction worker who is able to earn a small salary to support his family living. This couple has four children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is a student, while the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making more deserts to sell

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom lives in the city called Lahore, with her family, in Pakistan. Her husband runs a construction supplies business while she helps her husband financially by doing an embroidery business. She prepares embroidered dresses and sells them to different cloth shops and generates an income for her family. She has been doing this work for over seven years. Embroidered dresses are in very high demand by the local people because they wear them not only on special occasions but also to parties.  

Kalsoom's husband has a shop in the nearby market and his clientele base is mostly construction workers. He not only sells to them but also supplies his products to different shops as well. Kalsoom has appied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy the construction supplies such as cement and sand in bulk in order to increase his profit. She is hopeful that with the help of investment her husband will be able to make more money and receive more orders.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies for selling.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia L. smokes fish and has eggs for sale. She is a married woman living together with her husband and five dependents. She has been educated up to the junior high level. Her husband is a refrigerator repairman. She helps her husband in providing the basic needs for her family. She wants to use the loan buy more eggs and fish to process for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emelia plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: buy more eggs and more fish to process for sale

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Eduardo es cliente antiguo  lleva trabajando junto a nosotros desde el año 2005 vino a la institución por recomendación de otro cliente, el se encuentra atravesando la decima tercera secuencia.  La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de celulares, repuestos de los mismo, cámaras fotográficas, filmadoras y otros mas, la misma que la desarrolla en  una galería de la zona gran poder, tienda  que es bastante concurrida por la clientela.  La familia del Señor U. esta compuesta por su esposa y sus tres hijos los cuales se encuentran en etapa de estudios es por ellos que desea superarse y darles una mejor vida y estudios.  El destino del crédito será la compra de celulares y flash memory con los cuales surtirá su negocio.
texts.en:
Eduardo has been a client for a long time. He has been working with the institution, which a friend recommended, since 2005. He is in his 13th cycle. He sells cell phones, replacement parts for cell phones, cameras, movie cameras, and other items. He sells from a store, which is much frequented by customers, in the Gran Poder area. Mr. U.’s family is comprised of his wife and their three children. The children attend school. He wishes to do well for his children, and he wants to give them a better life and education. He will use the loan to buy cell phones and flash memories cards to stock his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
