loans.use: Buy cell phones to stock his business

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria B. is from the village of Birayan, Rizal. She is 51 years old and the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Gloria is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, she sells fruit. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately $79 a month for this activity.

In 2006, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Gloria is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for the business. This will be her 8th loan from PMPC.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
This is Merlinda D. V., 48, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Alexis D. V. and mother to five young adults: two of whom are already working, while two are enrolled in school. The youngest child is still in high school. By the grace of God, Merlinda has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her youngest to college. A dream for most Filipino parents like Merlinda, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance a parent could give to their children.

Merlinda operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them, piecemeal, with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing, beauty products, food supplements and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy, due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Merlinda dreams to improve her present life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities and varieties of products, to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Ghyslain  Parfait

texts.fr:
homme de 30ans marié et père d'un enfant de 5ans ayant 4 personnes à sa charge. Après ses études universitaire n'ayant pas eu de l'offre sur le marché du travail, il se lance dans le commerce de l'alimentation en decembre 2009 avec un capital de 250000frs.ses recettes par jours sont de 6000 à 25000frs.

Avec ce prêt il veut renforcer son activité en achetant des boîte de conserve, des papier hygieniques,des boites de lait,des spaghetti, des boîte d'allumette, du fromage,du savon,pax.
 il à pour strategie de jouer sur les prix pour attirer les clients et de reserver un bon acceuil.

il aimerai être grosiste dans les jours futures grace à ses epargnes.Il veut aussi que sa famillé s'épanouisse socialement et veut faire de sa femme une commerçante.

Il jouit d'une bonne reputation
texts.en:
This 30-year old man is married, with one 5-year old child and four dependents to provide for.   Unable to obtain employment after his university studies, in December 2009 he launched a grocery business with a starting capital of 250,000 West African Francs. His daily sales range between 6,000 and 25,000 West African Francs. 

With this loan he would like to bolster his business by purchasing some canned foods, toilet paper, milk packs, pasta, matches, cheese, soap, Pax detergent etc. His strategy is to have attractive practice and offer a warm welcome to his customers. Some time in the future, he would like to save enough to become a wholesaler. He would like for his family to advance socially and for his wife to become an entrepreneur. 

He enjoys a good reputation.

loans.use: Purchasing soap, Pax detergent,canned food, mik packs

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet P. is 31 years old and lives in Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Filbert P., who makes a living as a painter, and has two children who are both in elementary school. By the grace of God, she has managed to help pay for her children's schooling and meet her family's everyday expenses.

Janet operates a small convenience store where she sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to people who live in her neighborhood. Her store is located next to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the people who live in her community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

She has applied for a loan for PHP 15,000 to continue operating her business by buying more items to sell to her customers. She is confident that this loan will give her business a boost and increase her income. She hopes to use this additional income to renovate her house. She is a devoted member of CCT and faithfully attends all of our meetings to share information and tips on how to succeed in business

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay mocrofinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Therecia

texts.en:
Therecia is a 60-year-old married lady. She is blessed with five children above age 35.  

She has been earning her living from tailoring for 25 years. She mainly makes and sells wedding gowns. She has three employees in her business. Apart from tailoring, she operates a posho mill (a grinding machine that crushes maize into flour) for extra income.  

She hopes to open other outlets for her business in the future. Being a member of the Masaa group in Faulu Kenya, she has been guaranteed a loan of 90,000 Kenyan shillings by the members. She will use the loan to buy fabric, cloth lining and threads.

loans.use: To buy fabric, cloth lining and threads

loans.name: Sveta's Group

texts.en:
Sveta M. is the resident of Aravan. She is the leader of this group. Sveta is 22 years old and married. Her husband works as a driver. They have two sons; both of them are preschool age (under 7).  Sveta herself is a farmer. Four years ago, with the initial investment of 5000 soms, she started to cultivate agricultural products. She makes 2000 soms per month selling  part of the harvest. Sveta applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase potato seeds. In the future she wants to start building a bath house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 24 years old. She is married and has two children, 1 and 2 1/2 years old. She has been working as a tailor for two years. Solange has requested this loan to upgrade her tailoring business. She hopes to establish a tailoring shop with the profit. She says that her business is crucial because it has allowed her to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more machines for her business

loans.name: Arnold Renzo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr: Arnold; el tiene 27 años. el socio es casado tiene 1 hijo  el socio  el socio es guía de turismo y a su vez el tiene un pequeño locutorio en alquiler y su esposa trabaja con el, ellos dan el servicio de llamadas telefónicas  nacionales y al extranjero, también cuentan con internet y tiene sus módulos, el socio cuando no tiene pasajeros, está a cargo de su locutorio situado en la calle Garcilaso, el socio es una persona muy trabajadora y desea tener su agencia de viajes y turismo en un corto tiempo, el socio desea comprar accesorios parea las máquinas y también invertir en su locutorio. El socio comprara accesorios para las máquinas y algunas pequeñas cosas que siempre faltan para su locutorio.

  El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “QORICHUSPA”. This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cuzco.  

The member is Arnold. He is 27 years old. He is married and has one son. He is a tour guide and he also rents a small studio. His wife works with him. They offer a service for making domestic and international phone calls. They also have internet and have modules. When he doesn't have any passengers, he runs his studio located on Garcilaso street. Arnold is a hardworking person and he wants to have a travel and tourism agency after a short time. He wants to buy accessories for his equipment and also invest in his studio.  He will by accessories for his equipment and also some small items that his studio always needs.  

Arnold is happy with the loan he has been given and committed to making his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member will buy accessories for his equipment and some small items that his studio needs.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean O. is from the city of calabayan ozamiz city. She is 31 years old. Mary Jean is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jean owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport services. Mary Jean has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mary Jean joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Mary Jean from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better transportation service

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
There are people who cannot tolerate uncertainties in life. At 50, Petronila M. tries her best to minimize the uncertainties in her business and in her personal life. Petronila is married to Gabriel, who works as a driver. They live in Dasmarinas, Cavite, where they raise their four children. One of them is in college while another one is in elementary. They have a child who already works for a living, and one who stays at home.

Petronila is a dealer of charcoal and wood as cooking fuel, applying her learning from the training CCT* provides to its community partners. She buys sacks of it and repacks it into small packs worth Php 10. This she does to make it affordable to people in her community who often use it for cooking. With these, she earns an estimated net income around Php 10,000 every month.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a Php 8,000 loan. She plans to use this to buy more sacks of charcoal and bundles of woods as fuel to boost her business. She looks forward to an increased income due to this effort.

Customers and financial matters will always be a concern for her, but Petronila knows that God has given her the ability to produce wealth; the first step is to believe, and the next one is to take action. She faithfully does so, and she holds on to the promise that her dream of a prosperous business and a happy, healthy family will surely come to pass, despite all the present uncertainties.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: more sacks of charcoal and bundles of wood for household fuel

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.en:
Abdumajid is a hard-working taxi driver from Khujand, Tajikistan. For the last 20 years, he has driven thousands of kilometers transporting passengers all around the city and at times around the country. Abdumajid started as a taxi driver because he was unable to find another good job. He makes about $15 in a typical day, which is enough to support himself, his wife and two children. Abdumajid has requested a loan of $1,000 USD to make some repairs to his car engine. One of the drawbacks to being a taxi driver is the potential for costly repair overhead. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Erick

texts.es: El señor Erick  es chofer; trabaja y es socio propietario en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa-TRUFI 8. El prestamo lo usará para la compra de una caja de cambios y mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos parta la manutención de su familia Vive  en alquiler con sus padres en la zona Ciudad Satélite de la ciudad de El Alto, tiene un hijo. No está casado.
texts.en:
Sr. Erick is a driver who works for and is a member of the Eduardo Avaroa Transportation Union 8. This loan will be used to purchase a gearbox and pay for maintenance of his vehicle.

His business activity is the main source of income for supporting his family. Erick lives in a rental property with his parents in the District of Ciudad Satélite in the city of El Alto. He is not married and has a son.

loans.use: Pay for maintenance & purchase a gearbox for his vehicle

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia C. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Sofia is married and has six school-aged children.

To make a living, Sofia plants and harvests rice for sale. Sofia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Sofia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Sofia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Sofia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Sofia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas O. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. O. buys traditional baskets to resell, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 80 on other necessary expenses. 

O. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more baskets to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy traditional baskets to resell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María tiene 45 años de edad. Es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 16 años. Vive en casa  familiar,  la cual está ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 10 años, Ana María se dedica a la venta y reparación de electrodomésticos, repuestos y accesorios similares. Cuenta con un puesto  fijo en el Mercado Modelo, un mercado grande y con bastante movimiento en Chiclayo. Ana María es bastante conocida en el sector y cuenta con clientela establecida. Desea aumentar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería para tener un mejor surtido en variedad. Esta inversión le permitirá lograr mejores ventas y mejor liquidez. Con mayores ingresos, podrá seguir solventando sus gastos familiares y los gastos escolares de su hija. Ana María es muy trabajadora y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana María is 45 years old.  She is a single mother and has a 16 year-old daughter.  She lives in her family home which is located in José Leonardo Ortiz district, in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. 

For more than 10 years, Ana María has been repairing and selling electrical appliances, spare parts and accessories.  She has a fixed sales location in the 'Mercado Modelo', a large and busy market in Chiclayo.  Ana María is quite well known in her field and has an established customer base.  She would like to increase her business by purchasing more merchandise so that she can have a better variety of products in stock.

This investment will allow Ana María to make better sales and improve her cash flow.  She will make more income which will enable her to continue covering her family expenses and paying for her daughter's education.  Ana María is very hard working and she has good personal and work references.  Her greatest desire is to continue growing her business so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ana De Jesus

texts.es:
Ana, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a vender pupusas y refrescos, vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad, ella comenzó el negocio por al apoyo de un familiar, realiza sus ventas todos los días por las tardes, actualmente solicita un préstamo de $300.00 para la compra de materiales para el negocio.
Su inversión será en leña, maíz, bebidas y otros ingredientes, esto le ayudara a tener una mejor solvencia de materiales en su negocio y podrá aumentar la producción.
Ella tiene como objetivo, ser una microempresaria de éxito, mejorar la atención a los clientes y estar en buenas condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives in El Transito, departmento of San Miguel, where she sells pupusas [a traditional stuffed flatbread made with cornmeal] and soft drinks. She lives with her husband and has two children of 10 and 16 years of age. She started her business with the help of a family member and sells her products every day in the afternoons. 

Currently she is requesting a $300 loan to purchase supplies for the business. Her investment will be in firewood, corn, drinks and other ingredients. This will allow her to have a greater quantity of materials on hand to use in her business so she will be able to increase production. 

Her goals are to be a successful micro-entrepreneur, to improve customer service and to be in good condition with her family.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn, drinks and other ingredients.

loans.name: Yefer

texts.es:
Yefer es un hombre de 31 años de edad  que tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Vive con sus hijos y esposa en un caserío del distrito de Tambogrande -  departamento de Piura. Lamentablemente el hogar de Yefer no cuenta con los servicios básicos, como luz, agua y desagüe.

Desde hace más de 4 años la actividad que desarrolla Yefer es la agricultura y ganadería. Él cuenta con un terreno agrícola de 1 hectárea en el cual tiene limón en producción que cosecha semanalmente. Además,  actualmente Yefer cría 15 ovejas.

Yefer solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo e 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y  para  realizar labores de poda y deshierbo.  Otra parte del préstamo será invertida en la compra de alimentos para el engorde de ovinos, que mejorarán su calidad y le permitirá, a Yefer, venderlos a un mejor precio beneficiando así su negocio. 

Con la ganancia obtenida con el desarrollo de su negocio, Yefer pretende mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, que actualmente es muy pobre.
texts.en:
Yefer is a 31 year old man who has two children in his care.  He lives with his children and his wife in a hamlet in Tambogrande District – Piura Department.  Sadly, Yafer’s house does not have basic utilities like electricity, water and sewage.

For over four years Yafer has been farming and raising livestock.  He has a one hectare field planted with lemons that he harvests weekly.  He’s also raising 15 sheep.

Yafer is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan that he’ll use to buy fertilizer for his lemon crops and to carry out tasks like pruning and weeding.  Another part of the loan will be used to buy sheep feed that will improve their quality and allow Yafer to sell them at a better price for his business’ benefit.

Yafer plans to use profits from his business to improve his family’s quality of life which is currently very poor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. Moses, 31, hails from the Kyenjojo District of Uganda and is the father of five children. He lives with them and their mother in a semi-permanent house. Having acquired his first motorcycle from maize produce sales, he dreams of owning at least ten motorcycles in the next ten years. He intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, tiene 50 años de edad, es originario de Boaco departamento ubicado en el norte del país ,pero vive en la ciudad de Estelí , de oficio comerciante el se dedica a vender herramientas de trabajo en una ferretería , esta casado , es padre de 6 hijos. Cuando el inicio este negocio tenia 38 años de edad, su inventario en aquel entonces era muy poco, comenzó con capital propio , el tuvo que vender un terreno que tenia para poder iniciar este negocio , anteriormente el vendía granos básicos pero después decidió que vender productos para ferretería se ganaba mejor además tenia que buscar como sacar adelante a su familia. Hoy en día su esposa lo ayuda a atender el negocio, esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. 
El solicito el préstamo para compras más inventario a su ferretería, sus ventas son muy buenas pero le hacen falta más productos para ofrecer. Con esta inversión  espera poder hacer crecer su negocio, pues podrá tener mas inventario para vender, hacer mas clientes, mejorar sus ventas e ingresos también.  
Su meta próxima es expandir su negocio y ahorrar para terminar de preparar a sus hijos para que tengan una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 50 years old, a native of Boaca department, located in the north of the country, but he lives in the city of Esteli. His trade is merchant and he sells iron work created in his hardware store. He is married and the father of 6 children. 

When he began the business, he was 38 years old. His inventory in those days was very small. He began with his own capital, and had to sell a piece of land to begin the enterprise. Previously, he sold basic grains but, later, decided to sell iron products to earn more money and advance his family. Today, his wife helps him attend the business, which is located in his house of residence.

Rigoberto is requesting a loan to buy more inventory for his hardware store. His sales are very good but he lacks more products to offer. With this investment, he hopes to expand his business. With more inventory to sell he will gain customers and improve both sales and income.

His immediate goals are to expand his business and save money in order to prepare his children for a university education.

loans.use: buy more inventory for his hardware store.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es: Evaristo, de 40 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Graciela de 43 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 03 hijos, a quienes desean otorgarle una mejor educación. Los campos de cultivo que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Evaristo, son el principal sustento que tiene su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que la cosecha de cacao, café, raíces de barbasco y palillos son de muy buena calidad y por lo cual sus productos son vendidos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que perjudican sus plantas, en consecuencia afectaría sus ingresos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos llenos de frutos, ya que son muy pesados y le quitan mucha energía. Evaristo necesita el crédito para comprar sacos de abono y así mejorar sus tierras y posteriormente cosechar frutos de buena calidad y en abundancia. Para el bien de sus ingresos esta a punto de pagar la totalidad del precio de un terreno ya que tiene planeado sembrar plátanos en todo el perímetro. Este será su primer crédito, por la cual se siente muy contento de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesto a devolver puntualmente los pagos programados. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Evaristo is 40 years old.  He is a cheerful and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 43 year-old Graciela.  They have three children from their relationship who they would like to provide with a better education. 

The farmland that Evaristo managed to acquire through a lot of effort, is his main source of support for his family.  His produce is very much in demand in the city of San Francisco since his cacao, coffee, barbasco and turmeric root harvests are very good quality.  As a result, they fetch a very good price.

What Evaristo most enjoys about his work is protecting his crops from the pest infestations which damage his plants and, consequently, affect his profits.  He has been in this business for 15 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his sacks full of fruit since they are very heavy and sap his energy. 

Evaristo needs this loan to buy sacks of manure so that he can improve his land and later harvest plenty of good-quality fruit.  In order to improve his income, Evaristo is about to buy a plot of land.  He is planning to grow bananas all around the perimeter.

This is Evaristo's first loan and he is happy to know that he will have financial support since it will enable him to safely buy what he needs.  For his part, he is ready to make his loan repayments on time.  Evaristo will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles to buy sacks of organic fertilizer with which to fertilize his land.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Flores Marie

texts.en:
Flores Marie is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Flores Marie is 26 years old and has two children who are in school.

Flores Marie has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Flores Marie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of lumber and other materials for her business.

Flores Marie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Flores Marie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more lumber and other materials for her furniture business.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.en:
Yovana is 30 years old and the single mother of one daughter who is eight years old. Together with her mother and sister, she participates in their family furniture making business. Yovana works in her family's store making and selling furniture seven days a week. She is proud that her family has had their furniture store for over ten years. 

Yovana is asking for a loan in order to buy more wood to make furniture and also other materials that they might need for the store. She is hardworking and committed to making all the payments necessary on time.

loans.use: to buy more wood to make furniture for her store.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Luis is 69 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. He is married with four children. Luis has a furniture making business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase materials needed for his furniture making. Luis has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for his furniture making.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es: Carmela tiene 24 años, convive con Juan de 34 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Teresa del distrito de Pichari. Carmela es una joven con mucho entusiasmo  y creatividad, ella viene dedicándose a labrar la madera desde hace ya más de 5 años en sociedad con su esposo, quien es el motor de su familia. Los muebles que Carmela y su esposo realizan tienen mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes, pues los diseños que tiene son atractivos y a un bajo  precio. Carmela está a gusto con el trabajo que tiene, lo único que le aqueja es que no cuenta con las herramientas necesarias, aún le faltan algunos, es por tal motivo que recurre a MFP, para solicitar un crédito para poder realizar con mayor eficacia sus muebles. Este es su primer crédito MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1000 nuevos soles que solicita podrá comprar herramientas de carpintería.
texts.en:
Carmela is 24 years old and lives with Juan, age 34. They have two children. Carmela and her family live in their own house in the community of Teresa in the District of Pichari. She is a young woman with great enthusiasm and creativity. Carmela started working with wood more than five years ago along with her husband, who is the engine that drives their family. The furniture they produce is in great demand among their customers. Their designs are attractive and are offered for a low price. Carmela enjoys her work, but what irritates her is not having the necessary tools since she lacks a few items.

For this reason, she approached MFP to request a loan to help her become more efficient in producing her furniture. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to complete her payments on time. The loan of 1000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy carpentry tools.

loans.use: to buy carpentry tools.

loans.name: Maristela

texts.en:
Maristela is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maristela is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Maristela has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Maristela requested a PHP 49,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy new beauty supplies for her beauty salon.

Maristela has been in this business for 25 years. Maristela would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new beauty supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Mwero Ngauma

texts.en: Mwero is a single 30-years-old man who does not have children of his own yet. His business is located at the busy Mwembe Tayari in Mombasa. He sells music discs and tapes to the local people in Mombasa. He has been in this business for ten years. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is the harrassment they get from the local government. However, he works hard from early morning until late evening to keep his business well performing. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy more music discs and cassettes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and, in the future, open a stall in Mwembe Tayari. He describes himself as honest and respectful.

loans.use: to buy music discs and cassettes

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.


For the past five years, she has operated a utensils selling business and also a food stall business, her other source of income. She sells at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of low demand because of high cost of products. She dreams of establishing a real estate (rental) house in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase kitchen utensils for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
L. señora Nelly nació en L. provincia D. Anta del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, elL. vive en L. ciudad del Cusco. 

L. señora Nelly tiene 48 años y es casada fruto D. esta unión tiene tres hijos, elL. es una madre trabajadora y responsable que saca adelante a su familia,  elL. es L. administradora D. los dormitorios que alquiL. D. su domicilio. Ya son 3 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien pero en esta oportunidad Nelly requiere el préstamo para ampliar el local y para hacer mantenimiento D. L. casa.    

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Esperanza” son cada treinta días en L. ciudad del Cusco. El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. L. mayoría D. los socios viven en L. ciudad del Cusco y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. artesanía, venta D. comida, venta comestibles, venta D. cosméticos y otros brindan servicios varios. 

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. (Los socios que está en L. parte inferior D. L. fotografía llegaron tarD. a L. reunión del banco comunal).
texts.en:
Nelly was born in Anta province, in Cusco department.  She currently lives in the city of Cusco.

Nelly is 48 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage.  She is a hard-working and responsible woman who gets her family ahead in life.  Her business is renting out some bedrooms in her home.  She has been in this business for three years and is doing very well.  However, she needs this loan to expand her premises and do some maintenance work on her house.

The members of the 'Nueva Esperanza' community bank meet once a month, in the city of Cusco.  The members of the bank are hard-working, entrepreneurial people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead in life and who work hard every day in order to proviD. their children with a better future.  Most of the members of this bank live in the city of Cusco and their businesses incluD. selling handicrafts, selling meals, selling food and selling cosmetics.  Other members proviD. services.

Cusco is known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is well known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and for the fact that it is home to one of the seven Wonders of the World (Machu Picchu).

(The members who appear at the bottom of the photo arrived late to the community bank meeting).

loans.use: to expand her premises and do some maintenance work on her house

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.en:
Malia Paula is married, 53 years old, and has 10 children. She owns and operates a business venture of planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.    

She needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week) to improve the business.

In 2010, Malia Paula joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
Karar is from Iraq. He is 21 years old, single, and lives with seven family members, three of whom work.

Karar owns a shop that sells car paint and repairs tire wheels. He has owned the shop since 2009.  He has a lot of experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3,000 in order to make a ceiling for his shop and to purchase a diesel generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to make a ceiling for his shop and to purchase a diesel generator

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria Eugenia es madre soltera de tres hijos en las edades de 12 a 18 años;    vivió en casa de sus padres en el municipio de San Jacinto; antes se dedicaba al oficio de las confecciones con sus hermanas y también atendía niños en un hogar comunitario, avalado por el gobierno nacional. Con su esfuerzo propio y apoyado por el estado nacional, ha logrado salir adelante y hoy tiene su propia vivienda y un nuevo  negocio que la respalda para generar ingresos y buscar cada día un mayor bienestar familiar. Ella además de confeccionar ropa, vende refrescos, gaseosas, cervezas que los tenderos y otros negocios compran bien frías para venderla; también con sus conocimientos de repostería vende postres en épocas especiales y encargados por sus vecinos y referidos por estos. Así es que cuando usted habla con ella se llena de entusiasmo porque dice que no le falta nada y esto es gracias a su trabajo juicioso y ordenado y sobre todo a su familia a quien agradece porque nunca la ha abandonado.
Su sueño de crecimiento muchas veces se ve truncado porque su capital es insuficiente para responder a su clientela, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, primer credikiva con el cual comprará refrescos en mayor cantidad para disminuir los costos, y estar provisionada para la época de Diciembre, donde repuntan sus ventas. De igual manera comprará un enfriador pues la nevera donde enfría los refrescos se torna insuficiente ante la gran demanda y telas para responder a unos pedidos de ropa infantil.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia is a single mother of 3 children between the ages of 12 and 18. She used to live in her parents' house in the municipality of San Jacinto. Before she used to sew with her sisters and also take care of children in a community house, endorsed by the national government. Through her own effort and supported by the state, she has managed to get ahead and now has her own house and a new business that supports her in generating revenue and seeking a better lifestyle for her family daily. In addition to sewing clothes, she sells soft drinks, sodas, beers which shopkeepers and other businesses buy icecold to sell. Also as she knows how to bake, she also sells desserts at special times commisioned by neighbours and people they know and recommend. So when you speak with her she is filled with enthusiasm because she says she lacks for nothing and this is thanks to her judicious and orderly work and above all to her family who she appreciates for never having abandoned her. 

Her dream of growth is often cut short because her capital is insufficient to meet clients' needs. This is why she has come for funding to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, the first loan with Kiva and with which she will buy soft drinks in large quantities to reduce costs and be provisoned for December when her sales rally. Likewise she will buy a cooler as the fridge where she cools the soft drinks is insufficient to meet the great demand and fabric to fill a few orders for children's clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, soft drinks and a cooler.

loans.name: Yuvinalis

texts.en:
Yuvinalis is 49 years old.  An enterprising businessman, he is married and blessed with two children aged 13 and 10 years old. He has been running a greengrocery for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Yuvinalis will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruit to add to his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to own a retail shop that will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables and fruit to add to his business

loans.name: Katy

texts.es: Katy de 21 años de edad  vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 3 años de edad en la Hermosa Cartagena, ciudad ubicada a orillas del Mar Caribe. Allí tiene un negocio de variedades, donde vende mercancía en un punto comercial ubicado en su propia casa. Ella inició esta actividad, con un préstamo que le hizo una amiga y desde ese mismo momento su negocio se convirtió en su forma de trabajo,  por eso su mayor sueño es ampliarlo y hacerlo crecer en términos de ganancias. Su meta más adelante es convertirlo en un almacén de gran tamaño, donde sus clientes encuentren todo lo que necesiten. Su mayor desafío  es la falta de capital de trabajo para responder a la creciente clientela, que  día a día se entusiasman con las relaciones comerciales que sostienen con Katy, quien conoce muy bien su mercado y se esfuerza por ser oportuna en los pedidos. En la variedad de Katy,  ella vende de contado y a crédito, sus clientes son los habitantes del barrio donde habita y  de los alrededores de él. En la actualidad está aplicando a su   credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará jeans, ropa femenina en general y calzado, preparándose para el fin de año, época en la cual sus clientes usualmente actualizan su guardaropas y compran vestidos para lucirlo en las fiestas navideñas y de año nuevo.
texts.en: Katy, age 21, lives with her partner and three-year-old child in the beautiful city of Cartagena, on the shores of the Caribbean. There she has a varied business, selling merchandise from her home. She started this business with a loan from a friend, and her business is now her job. For this reason, her greatest dream is to expand it and make more income from it. Her goal for the future is to make it a large store, where her customers will find everything they need. Her greatest challenge is a lack of working capital to respond to her growing customer demand. Every day her customers are excited to see her products. Her customers are her neighbours and residents of the surrounding area. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will purchase jeans, women's clothing, and shoes. This will help her to get ready for the New Year; this is a season in which her customers want to update their wardrobes and buy clothing so that they look good for Christmas and the New Year.

loans.use: to buy jeans, women's clothing, and shoes.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 41 years old, and he operates a farming business in his village. He lives a simple life with his wife and two children. Every day, he goes into the field and spends all of his time working. Despite the difficulties of farming, he has the courage to persist in earning his family's income. 

Danilo is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for his corn field. He hopes that, in the coming season, he will produce better crops in order to save for his family as well as his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernardina; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz y también vende gaseosas y cervezas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne, pollo y verduras y también para comprar maíz para preparar la chicha.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Bernardina, a member of “SAYHUA 3”, a communal bank located in the Urubamba district, in the Urubamba province and in the Cusco department.

Bernardina is 51 years old, she is married and she has 6 children. She alternates her daily chores with her retailing activity, selling food and drinks. She sells meals, chicha – a maize-derived fermented beverage – as well as fizzy drinks and beers. She works from 8 am to 5 pm, and thanks to this activity she can provide for her children. Her dream is to improve her meals selling activity. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to cook her meals such as rice, meat, chicken and vegetables, as well as to buy maize to prepare the chicha.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, meat, chicken and vegetables, and maize to prepare the chicha.

loans.name: Noeline's Group

texts.en:
Noeline's Group is comprised of two hard working women. Noeline is 22 years old, and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. For the past three years, Noeline has been working hard to manage her small market which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Noeline has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and will help Noeline to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Noeline hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a big saloon. 

Noeline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Noeline's future prospects by helping her to improve her economic status.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 
Marife used her last loan to purchase snack items to sell such as hot cakes (pancakes) and banana cue (bananas fried in hot oil, coated with sugar). Her business is progressing, and she is now taking a new loan to purchase cooking ingredients for making snack foods. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients for making snack foods.

loans.name: Ruth Meri

texts.es: La socia Ruth Meri continua con su negocio de compra y venta de frutas ella sigue con el negocio porque le ha ido muy bien y sigue llevando a Puerto Maldonado, la socia trabaja arduamente para seguir creciendo economicamente; la socia solicita en esta ocasión el prestamo para invertir en la compra de fruta e incrementar su mercado.
texts.en: Ruth Meri continues with her business buying and selling fruit.  She continues with it because she’s done very well and continues taking to Puerto Maldonado.  She works hard to continue growing economically.  On this occasion she’s asking for the loan to buy fruit and increase her market.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en:
Than was born in 1980. She has three children: two are in 6th and 5th grade and one other is still little. Her husband is an iron worker to earn a living. He earns about 7,000,000 VND per month. Than grows rice and she earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for a long time. Besides that, Than also helps her husband in making iron. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.

Her challenge in life and work is lack of capital to invest in her family’s iron workshop. Her dream is for her children to learn and to have enough capital to have their own careers, so they don’t need to borrow from anyone. This loan is one of the steps that will help her achieve this dream. She can invest in her iron store to gain earnings and save profits for her children’s future. Than is a hardworking and passionate businessman.

She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2013. In this first loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her family’s iron store. She always wants to expand her business and for her children to grow up well.

Other members of Than's group include the following:
Chan is 28 years old. She has three children. She is in the carpentry business. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her carpentry store. 
Nga is 35 years old. She has three children. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in breeding. 
Thuan is 23 years old. She has a child. She is in the carpentry business. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her carpentry store.
Mai is 23 years old. She has two children. She is in the carpentry business. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her carpentry store. 
Huong is 31 years old. She has three children. She is in the carpentry business. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her carpentry store.

loans.use: to invest in her family’s iron store

loans.name: Butooro Twekulakulanye Group

texts.en:
Jane a married woman of five children is a member of Butooro Twekulakulanye group. She basically does farming, which she began with the intention of raising tuition for her children. She also rears pigs to get additional income. 

She  wants the loan to buy more pigs. Her clients are community members. She hopes to build a big piggery project to supply most of the pork eating areas in the city. Her challenge is limited capital, which  she hopes to overcome if she keeps getting loans from Ugafode. She is hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Kagando Teachers Group

texts.en:
Joel is a thirty-eight-year-old married male with four children, of which three go to school. He has been a teacher for ten years and works eight hours a day located in the rural area. Joel needs money to buy construction materials like cement and timber and hopes to improve his home even though insufficient funds is a challenge being faced. Joel is a hardworking man.
He is a member of a group where each member guarantees the other since they don't offer security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement and timber.

loans.name: Afepeb Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AFEPEB est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. Le représentant du groupe, nommé Patrice (Celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgé de 47 ans a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Patrice est marié a une commerçante du nom de Yvette. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et a leur charge. Patrice vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Patrice vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans une région du Bénin depuis quinze ans. Patrice travail également dans un garage. Patrice s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Patrice ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des pièces de rechange des véhicules.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a Taxi for 16 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his Taxi because the current condition of his Taxi is not good it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Nusrat has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Nusrat's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Nusrat also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Nusrat is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of her husband repairing taxi

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Virtuous Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members must make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Sarah has been involved in community Work both in her local church as a Sunday school teacher and also at village level as a youth counselor. This has enabled her to know many parents in the area.

Her business idea stemmed from the plight of many working parents who have had problems getting house girls who are honest. She therefore decided to start a day care centre. She Charges USD 7 per child per month. The income she gets from her work is enough to pay the room she has rented and also cater for the household expenses. In 2004 She took a loan of USD 139 that enabled her to go for a nursery school course. The course was to prepare her for her new business. In year 2005 She took another loan of USD 139 that enabled her set her business.

loans.use: Given a loan of USD 150 she will be able to pay school fees for her daughter and limit withdrawals from her business. This will enable the business to grow and be self sustainable.

loans.name: Reyna  Ester

texts.en:
My name is Reyna Ester, and I hope to start a small company in the production of doughnuts that I will distribute throughout various schools in my town. With the help of this business I will be able to provide for my family, especially now that I am a single mother. This work will generate revenue to cover familial expenses. Right now, I need to buy sufficient high-grade material to prepare for the ever-nearing school year, a time during which the volume of sales increases.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre el Reyna Ester, cuento con una micro empresa de elaboración de Donas, las que distribuyo en las diferentes encuelas de mi ciudad, gracias a este negocio puedo sacar adelante a mi familia ya que soy madre soltera y esta actividad me genera ingreso para cubrir los gastos familiares, actualmente necesito compra suficiente matearia prima, tomando en cuenta que se aproximan las clases y el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: To purchase eggs, flour, margarine, sugar, fine salt, cornstarch, miscellaneous paper products, yeast, vanilla, olive oil, and butter.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira D/O Mohammad Esa was born in 1989 and lives in District 6 of Kabul City. She is single and shares a tailoring business with her brother who runs a tailoring shop in a market of Kabul City. At the start of their business, they worked in their home. After taking a first cycle loan from AFSG, they were able to open a shop in the market (a better business location) and expand their business. Now she is ready to begin the 2nd loan cycle so she can purchase more materials, make more clothes and earn better income for her big family.

***Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur.  In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.***

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, threads, needles, buttons, etc

loans.name: Mónica Julissa

texts.es:
Monica is a young woman full of desire to move up in the world. She is single and works as a secretary in the Palacio Federal. To help out her family economically, she started selling cosmetics to co-workers a year and a half ago. She likes the work and found a way to increase income and improve the quality of life for herself and her parents.

Thanks to the high quality of Monica's products, her demand has increased, and to be able to meet it she needs a loan of $250 to purchase more supplies. She plans to repay the loan within three months. You can be a part of Monica's success. She is sincerely grateful for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mónica es una joven con grandes deseos de superación, ella es soltera, trabaja como secretaria en Palacio Federal, y para ayudar económicamente a su familia inició con la venta de cosméticos entre sus compañeros de trabajo desde hace año y medio, a ella le gustan las ventas y ha encontrado en este oficio la manera de incrementar su ingreso, y de esta forma mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y sus padres.

Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa su demanda se ha incrementado y para poder cubrirla necesita de un crédito por $ 250 dólares para la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 meses. Se parte importante en los logros de Mónica, ella agradece sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Mrs. Sou H. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Her husband is a landlord and earns about $8 each day. To supplement his income, she runs a small laundry shop in her area, making about $3 a day. Two of her children work in a garment factory and the other two are in secondary school.

Due to an increase in the number of their tenants, this couple hopes to use this $1,000 loan to build additional rooms. By doing so, they will be able to cater to their growing tenant base and earn more with which to support their family.

loans.use: To build more rooms to accommodate more tenants.

loans.name: Giselle

texts.en:
Giselle D. is 34 years old. She has 2 children and lives in cohabitation with a house electrician in Yopougon in the south of Abidjan. For years, Giselle D. has been selling grilled pork in the Yopougon Selmer Market. She is actually the main provider for her family. Her common-law husband's business activities have been badly affected by the crisis in the house building sector in Cote d'Ivoire.

Now Giselle takes care of the school expenses of her children as well as the home expenses. She will use the loan to pay the school expenses of her children and purchase some goods to sustain her revenue resource.

loans.use: to purchase goods and pay school expenses

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 38 years old and married to a local builder in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.

She has 4 children and all are in school. Mariatu’s income is mostly spent on their education. Mariatu would like to diversify her business by including rubber buckets, plates and other utensils. To enable her to meet her dream, she is requesting a $275 loan.

loans.use: Diversify her business and attract new clients by adding a variety of kitchen utensils to her stock

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en:
Joan N. is applying for a loan through BRAC Uganda because she wants to add to her business stock of fresh food such as yams and Irish potatoes. With the loan, Joan wants to purchase fresh food from nearby villages. Joan has three children.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 47 years old, and is a local resident of the town of Saatli. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. She breeds cattle in her yard together with her husband. They have been engaged in this business since 1991 and are now quite experienced. Aida raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. Cattle breeding is traditional in this region, where there are no other jobs, and it can bring a good income. Aida wants to develop this business, to increase the number of calves by two.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Pashali

texts.en: F. Pashali is a 39-year-old farmer who sells milk to the local bazaar traders in a small village in the Saatli region. People in Azerbaijan  use dairy products in their every-day life, and it is a very profitable business. Pashali applied for 1100 USD to purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.use: Purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Yene

texts.es:
Yene is the mother of three children, whose ages are 15, 11, and 8. She has worked for 15 years selling articles for the home such as pots, utensils, plastic containers, etc. Nevertheless, she has worked for 6 years in the Arenera market in Huaycán due to the removal of street vendors.

Previously, she attended to a store where she sold candies and ice cream in the summer. She decided to leave this business because her first son didn't have anyone to care for him, and her store was very far from her house. This is why she started to work selling what little she had.

Currently, she has three children and has the help of her husband, who works in security, to maintain their home. She puts what she earns towards the construction of their home. In the future, she would like to open a store to sell jeans.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yene es una madre de tres niños cuyas edades son de 15, 11 y ocho años. Hace quince años que vende artículos para el hogar como ollas, cubiertos, recipientes de plásticos, etc. Sin embargo, recién lleva seis años trabajando en el mercado “Arenera” de Huaycán debido a un desalojo de ambulantes.

Anteriormente, ella atendía una tienda vendiendo golosinas y helados, cuando era temporada de verano. Decidió dejar este negocio a causa de su primer hijo pues no tenia quien lo cuidara y su tienda quedaba muy lejos de su casa. Fue de este modo que empezó a trabajar vendiendo lo poco que tenía.

Actualmente ella tiene tres hijos y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, quien trabaja como seguridad, para el mantenimiento del hogar. Lo que ella gana con su trabajo lo destina a la construcción de su casa. Más adelante ella quisiera abrir una tienda para vender ropa de jean.

loans.use: To obtain a stand in the market and to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Lower Nyamboyo Women Group

texts.en:
Ezekiel started his matatu (public service vehicle) transport business seven years ago with a second-hand vehicle.  Through hard work and determination, Ezekiel is able to feed, clothe, and educate his family of two wives and eight children.  

Ezekiel operates his business along the Kisumu – Busia highway, and is currently planning to buy another second-hand matatu (public service vehicle) to diversify his business.  With the help of his loan, Ezekiel will also be able to buy public service vehicles spare parts which he hopes to sell to generate more income for his family.  His long term business vision is to own a fleet of many public service vehicles.

loans.use: To purchase matatu (public service vehicle) spare parts

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 32 years old and a mother of two children, who are both in school. She is pictured above with one of her children.She has been selling plastic food and storage bowls, cups, and tissues in the local market for about three years now.

She wants to use this loan to increase her inventory and sales to help her husband provide for the family. She is a member of the group called Stewards. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls, cups, and tissues to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad, 32 years old, lives in Saida South, Lebanon, where he owns a small bakery shop specializing in selling "Manakish," the famous Lebanese "pizza" that everybody has for breakfast. Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,200 to do an aluminum "vitrine" for his bakery.  He believes  this decorating work will improve the visibility of his shop.

loans.use: To do some decoration work in his bakery.

loans.name: Sa

texts.en: Mrs. Sa O. Chea is a villager in Chambork Kantreanh Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She and her husband, Mr. Sitha Tuon, are garment factory workers. They are also farmers. They have two children who are too young to work or study. At present, Mrs. Sa O. Chea’s plantation has infertile soil. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for her field in order to make it more productive. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her field more productive.

loans.name: Mwashamba's Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Mwashamba is 34 years old and married with 6 children, aged between 2 and 15 years old. She became a food seller in 2005. Every day she works from 8 AM to 4 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mwashamba now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Hudhaima, Ramla and Amina.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her stock.

loans.name: Wari Wawas Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Germán Buch, a este pertenece la asociación “Wari Wawas”. Un grupo muy alegre que  junto  a su asistente de créditos, trabajan con Pro-Mujer con mucha responsabilidad.
La mayoría en el grupo son casados y con familias numerosas, Actualmente viven en alquiler en habitaciones pequeñas, ya que los gastos que tienen para la manutención de sus hogares no les permiten poder pagar ambientes más grandes.
La actividad principal de ésta asociación es el comercio, que varia entre varios productos, por ejemplo; venta de CDS, venta de ropa, bisutería, alfombras, etc.
Ahora requieren mas capital para la compra de mercadería en mayor cantidad de ésta manera aumentar sus ganancias y obtener ingresos que les permita mejorar su forma de 
Vida.
texts.en:
The group Wari Waras belongs to the German Buch focal center which is located in the city of El Alto. This is a happy group which works responsibly with Pro-Mujer.

The majority of the women in the group are married and have large families. They live in small rented rooms since their expenses do not allow them to have more spacious spaces.

Commerce is the main business of this group. It varies from the sale of CDs, clothing, jewelry, carpets, etc. They need more capital in order to purchase merchandise in larger quantities so that they can increase their profits and obtain income that will allow them to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale products.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mr. Keo K. is a farmer in Meoun Tumrong Village in Takeo Province and his wife, Mrs. Em Chroeb, helps him on the plantation. They cannot currently support their family well because they only have one business. Keo decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Keo is 30 years old and the father of three children who are all attending the local school. His wife is also presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: Keo would like to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.vi: Chị Phượng tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Tuy mới 19 tuổi nhưng chịPhượng đã có khá nhiều kinh nghiệm trong kinh doanh hoa quả. Hiện nay với sự giúp đỡ của chồng và nguồn vốn vay của Quỹ tình thương công việc kinh doanh hoa quả của gia đình chị đã cho thu nhập 2 triệu đồng/ tháng. N.ài kinh doanh buôn bán gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi nên  dù mới xay dựng gia đình nhưng kinh tếcủa vợ chồng chị Phượng khá ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 triệu đồng để đầu tư thêm vốn vào công việc kinh doanh hoa quả
texts.en:
Ms. Phuong joined TYM fund since 2007. Even though she is only 19 yrs old, she already has a lot of experience in selling fruits. Currently with the help of her husband and a loan from TYM fund, her fruit selling business brings in 122 USD per month. In addition to her fruit business, another source of her income is from raising animals. Therefore, even though recently married, her family's income situation is quite stable. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to invest in her fruit selling business

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright B. makes phone calls and also sells rechargeable phone cards. Bright hopes to expand his business by purchasing more rechargeable phone cards. He is 32 years old and single. He needs the loan amount of $525 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. He is grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, estado civil casada, tiene tres hijos de 2, 7 y 12 años de edad todos estudian en la primaria, los planes para su familia es ofrecerle un mejor porvenir a sus hijos y un patrimonio para el futuro.
Doña Rosa se desempeña en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida casera, desde hace diez años de experiencia en la atención al cliente, es mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo e incrementar el volumen de venta mediante nuevas variaciones de comidas. Con esta solicitud del préstamo  lograra invertir en nuevos producto y herramientas de trabajos como: granos básicas para preparar los alimentos y perecederos, asador, nuevas mesas y sillas para brindarle al cliente una buena atención a si como captar nuevos clientes para obtener mejores ingresos con las ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte section of the capital, Managua. She is married and has three children in grade school, ages 2, 7 and 12. She hopes to offer her family, her children, a bright future and to leave them an inheritance. Rosa has a small business selling homemade food. She has ten years experience in customer service, and would like to improve her business, expanding it and increasing sales by offering new types of food. In order to increase her income and sales, Rosa plans to invest this loan in new products and appliances, such as staples and perishable items for food preparation, a grill, and new tables and chairs to provide for and attract new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a grill, a plastic dining table and chairs

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru:
Шарипова Гулрухсор Саидовна родилась в 1984 году. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Одна из преуспевающих микропредпринимателей в районе Вахдат. Начала свой бизнес с торговли национальных платьев. Она у себя дома шьет национальные платья и продает их на рынке «Хайр» города Вахдат. В ее ассортименте товара, также имеются мужские чапаны(национальное пальто). Для сырья, некоторые комплектующие ее продукта, и некоторые готовые изделия в качестве ассортимента Гулрухсор покупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. 
Хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев для увеличения оборотного капитала.
texts.en:
Gulruhsor Saidovna S. was born in 1984. She is married and has two children. She is one of the successful micro entrepreneurs in the Vahdat region. She started her business with selling national Tajik dresses. She makes these dresses at home and then sells them on the Hayr market in the town of Vahdat. In her inventory there are also mens national coats. She buys raw materials and other supplies as well as ready-made goods to add variety to her inventory on the Korvon market in Dushanbe. Gulruhsor wants to get a loan for 2000 somoni (USD$550) for a six month term to increase her working capital.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials, threads and furniture
