loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Mrs.Ouch P., 58, is a widow who has three children, all of whom are married and live separately. Mrs. P. cultivates rice and vegetables crops on her own farmland, and has been rice farming since 1989.  Mrs.P. faces a problem, she has no cow to help her plow the farmland. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy a cow. The loan will allow her to better plow her farmland and provide her with an additional asset. Ouch P. lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
A. Rano is 48 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Rano has been running her business already for 5 years. With the assistance of her daughters, she fries and bakes pasties and patties with meat. They also have a small snack-bar serving their pasties and patties.

Rano and her daughters are very nice and polite people which allows them to have their clientele. The stability of business generates income for supporting the family. Today Rano requests 800 US Dollars in order to buy plates and dishes for her business and to repair the roof of her small snack-bar. Rano has gained a reputation for responsibility with her financial obligations and for keeping her word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing plates and dishes; repairing the roof

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom O. is 49 years old and she lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Sum Chab, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He also is a palm juice collector. Mrs. Mom O. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is 49 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other three are enrolled in the local school and the remaining is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Julia America

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Julia es soltera, tiene 58 años y 4 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, además los días sábados viaja a la feria de San Miguel en donde vende ropa variada.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, cerveza, gaseosa.
Los sueños de Julia son construir su casa de material noble y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. She is 58 years old, single, and has 4 children. Julia has a store in her home where she sells general groceries, and on Saturdays she travels to the San Miguel market where she sells a variety of clothing. Julia needs a loan of 1600 soles that she will invest in rice, sugar, beer and soda. Julia dreams of building her own home with sturdy materials and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: rice sugar, beer, soda

loans.name: Brak

texts.en: Brak P. is 45 years old and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store, earning about $3 USD per day. Her husband raises and sells pigs, and also makes rice wine, typically making $5 USD a day altogether. To earn more money, Brak P. needs a loan to expand her grocery store's stock.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store’s stock

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
“Let us fight poverty,” says Lalila, who is doing her best to earn income in her vegetable-vending business and keep her family away from the hardships of life. Laila is an optimistic mother and loving housewife of Roberto U.; although the family is poor, they strive hard to earn income for their survival and for the future of their children. She has been encouraged by her neighbors in Inaban Dupax del Norte in Nueva Vizcaya to request a loan of PHP 8,000.

Currently earning an average weekly income of PHP 500, which is of great help in providing for some of the family’s basic necessities, Laila aspires to grow her business and become more successful. She hopes to improve their living conditions with the continuing support of Kiva and by believing in her own capacity to achieve her life goals.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita G. is from the village of Guinabot in Sapang Dalaga. She is 50 years old. Esterlita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Esterlita makes and sells food. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to pay off her motorcycle. She uses the motorcycle to transport food products to her customers, especially those who live far from her shop. This will be Esterlita's fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to support her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for her motorcycle

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely M. is from the town of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Emely is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Emely owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Emely has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Emely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Emely has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Emely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Шоира продолжает расширять свой бизнес. У нее большой ассортимент детской одежды и обуви. За период кредитования она увеличила товарооборот и повысила уровень жизни. В этом году она отправила своих детей в летний лагерь. На следующий займ она хочет закупить летние платья для девочек.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Shoira continues to expand her business. She has a large assortment of children's clothing and shoes. During her credit history she has increased her merchandise turnaround and improved her quality of live. This year she has sent her children off to a summer camp. Her next loan she wants to use to buy summer dresses for girls.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer dresses for girls

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells provisions in her house. She has been in her business for the past 30 years and has been able to use her years of business experience to retain customers. 

Maria lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a widow with five children. Maria is 60 years old. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is married with two teenage sons. He lives in Kamenka and sells office supplies, books, text books and some retail items. He has established good connections with local schools and organizations which helps him keep his sale rates pretty high all year long. Gennadyi has been working in this sphere of trade for 10 years. Currently, he has 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His net profit amounts to 3,000-5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Gennadyi is seeking a loan of 8,488 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for the upcoming school year. Many students go shopping for office supplies at the markets before September 1st which is the official start of a school year in Ukraine. Gennadyi is hoping to generate extra income this season to continue growing his small business. He has an impeccable credit record and is hoping to repay the current loan without any problems as well.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies wholesale for an upcoming school year

loans.name: Nisolat

texts.en:
Nisolat is a humble mother who, with much effort, works on her land, growing carrots and potatoes to later sell in the markets of the closest towns or to traders from the same area. Her responsibilities as a mother have encouraged her to pursue farming activities to continue growing the best vegetables in the area. At the same time, she raises cattle with the help of her husband and children.

Now, Nisolat wishes to expand her business and to buy seeds and fertilizer for growing winter wheat.
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Mrs. Lay D. is a villager in Slaeng Kaung village in Takeo province. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fruit to resell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Kiev Pich, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Lay D. is 57-years-old and the mother of seven children, five of whom are workers in different positions, while another is a fruit seller, and the last is attending the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: Soun V., 36, lives with her three children and husband in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who typically makes about US$1 every day. Her husband has operated a horse cart business since 2004 and is able to make US$6 per day. Soun has an idea to make more money to support her family. She would like to take out a loan of US$700 to purchase rice and bean in bulk with a special wholesale discount and then resell it at the market.

loans.use: To purchase rice and beans to resell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes C. is from the village of Catibac, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 31-years old. Lourdes is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes buys and sells coconut husks. She also sells a variety common products used in her local community Lourdes has been in this business for over five years.

In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a loan of $125, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Enkhtaivan L. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and 2-year-old-son in Uvurkhangai province, central Mongolia. Her husband, Ankhbayar, supports the family by driving a taxi in the local area. L. operates a clothing and mink hat retail business. She travels to China twice a month to import clothes, which she transports back, to sell at the local market in her town. In the wintertime, she travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to purchase mink hats. These hats are expensive to purchase, but they are in great demand during the cold Mongolian winters. 

L. started her business after graduating from college. Finding quick success in selling clothes, she used her savings to purchase and expand her business to include selling hats. The hats have proven to be quite profitable and she continues to increase her sales and her earnings. L. is a very open-minded business woman, and credits her success to her good communication skills and positive relationships with her customers. For the future, she hopes to expand her business and open her own trading center. She is requesting a 2,700,000 tugrug (~1900 USD) loan to import more clothes from China and to purchase mink hats to sell this winter.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To import more clothes from China and to purchase mink hats to sell this winter.

loans.name: Oah

texts.en:
Oah M., 37, is married with four children. Three of his children are enrolled at a local high school. He resides in Batambong Province, Cambodia, with his wife and children.

To make a living, he operates his motorbike as a taxi driver at the local markets in the town, earning an income of $2.50 a day. His wife is a cleaner at a local university in the town, earning an income of $1.50 a day. The family is also assisted by one of his children who is currently employed in a local garment factory.

Oah M. and his wife are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase pigs to raise and sell when the price is good enough to make a profit.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man S., 26, is a grocer who owns a small shop along the road where she sells different kinds of foods to people who are nearby villagers or passers-by. She has a few employees who are her relatives to help her in selling foods and is typically earning approximately US$ 4 per day from her business.

Man S. is married with a lovely young child who is already enrolled in primary school, while her husband helps support his family by selling eggs at the market. Man S. wants to make additional income by investing in a new suitable business, but she doesn’t have money yet to start it. She is therefore looking for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL to order imported kitchen supplies, such as pans, plates, and spoons. She will sell them retail at the market.

loans.use: To order cooking supplies such as pans, plates, spoons to sell

loans.name: Oladunni

texts.en: Oladunni, age 44, is the leader of her lending group and has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years. Oladunni sells basic provisions and goes to market once every two weeks to buy her goods. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N160,000 to increase the scope and quantity of her goods in order to meet customer demands. The expected increase in profit will be used to supplement the income of her husband, who is a journalist, in order to provide for the basic and educational needs of their three children. Oladunni sends her sincere thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Dina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Dina es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 7 años atrás, vive en el distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de carne.

Dina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital y comprar más carne.

Con este crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles podrá comprar carne de: alpaca, cerdo y ovino.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar  su mercadería  y así progresar junto a su familia.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son  las reuniones con las socias y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Ms. Dina has been a member of the Communal Bank "Generación 2000" ["Generation 2000"] for 7 years. She lives in the district of Santa Rosa, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 26 years old, she is married and has one son. She studied until the 5th year of secondary education and she deals in meat. Dina tells us that with the first loan she requested from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos [Manuela Ramos Movement], 300 PEN, she was able to increase her working capital and purchase more meat. With this loan of 2,000.00 PEN she will be able to purchase alpaca, pork and sheep meat. Her dream for the future is to augment her merchandise and thus make progress with her family. What she likes best from her Communal Bank are the meetings with the other members and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat: sheep, beef, alpaca, pork

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 38 años, tiene 4 hijos: Jesús de 22, Gabriel de 14, Alexander de 12 y Andrés de 3 años; juntos y con muchas ganas de progresar viven en su acogedora casa que es propia.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica al pegado de todo tipo de pedrería en diversas prendas de vestir que le dejan diferentes comerciantes. Ella realiza esta actividad con la ayuda de una amiga, trabajan durante todo el día para aprovechar la luz natural. Por otro lado, le es muy rentable ya que las ganancias le alcanzan para mantener bien a sus hijos, pues lo debe hacer sola.
A su vez, disfruta mucho su labor porque es un trabajo  tranquilo y lo puede hacer en su casa, sin tener que movilizarse a otros lugares, además sabe que tiene paciencia y puede hacer todo tipo de figuras que le encargan sin problemas, ya que tiene muchas ganas de trabajar para salir adelante. 
Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa y vender toda clase de productos, para seguir saliendo adelante.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas para devolver la confianza depositada en ella. Tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de diversidad de pedrería para no tener que viajar hasta la ciudad cuando le hagan pedidos. También planea empezar a abastecerse con mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 38, has 4 sons: Jesús, 22, Gabriel, 14, Alexander, 12, and Andrés, 3. With the will to progress, they live together in her cozy house, which she owns.

For five years, she has been engaged in setting all types of precious stones into a variety of garments left with her by merchants. She carries out this business with the help of a friend. They work all day so that they can take advantage of natural light. This activity is very profitable, for the earnings she attains allow her to provide good support to her children. She has to accomplish this on her own.

She enjoys her work because it is a quiet job, and she can do it in her house without having to go to other places. In addition, she knows that she is patient and can make all kinds of shapes that are assigned to her, without problems. She has a great desire to work in order to get ahead. In the future, she plans to open a shop in her house selling all types of products in order to continue getting ahead.

This is the first loan she has with MFP, and she promises to be punctual in making each of her payments in order to justify the confidence shown her. She is thinking of investing the money in the purchase of a variety of precious stones so that she doesn’t have to travel to the city when they are ordered by customers. She also plans to begin supplying herself with merchandise for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials.

loans.name: Olailong B Acan Night Group

texts.en:
A. Night is a hardworking businesswoman and leader of her small group of six members. She is twenty-five years old and married with three children who are schooling.

Night is dealing in a business selling local brew and she has been operating this type of business for over three years. But due to insufficient capital, she is using the loan to purchase and stock millet, sorghum and so forth for her local brew business.

The loan is improving Night’s business whereby she hopes to enlarge her business for better profits.

loans.use: To purchase and stock millet, sorghum and so forth for her local brew business

loans.name: Chulumani Group

texts.es:
Pro Mujer celebra este año 20º aniversario como organización de apoyo a la mujer. El centro focal de Los Andes es uno de los más antiguos de la Regional de El Alto, a su vez la asociación comunal Chulumani es una de las más antiguas, pues cuenta con 25 ciclos en Pro Mujer (doce años y medio aproximadamente).

Los negocios que reportan las socias son: venta de calzados, ropa de bebé, tejido de chompas, tienda de abarrotes, venta de cañerías, tejido de mantas, macramé, venta de jugos y regrescos, venta de queso y de sal.

La señora Agustina Elena R. de 42 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos (2 mujeres y 1 varón), tiene el negocio de tejido de mantas durantes los momentos libres, en general en los dos últimos años ha estado viajando a los Departamentos de Cochabamba y Santa Cruz, llevando material escolar. Este negocio fue iniciado bajo el consejo de su hermana que ya tenía experiencia en el desarrollo de esta actividad económica. Sin embargo, estas no han sido las únicas actividades económicas que ha emprendido,  la  señora Agustina indica que en los 24 ciclos que ha sido socia de Pro Mujer a desarrollado diferentes negocios de acuerdo a las oportunidad que se le ha presentado.
texts.en:
Pro Mujer celebrates its 20th Anniversary this year as an organization that supports women. The main office in the Andes is one of the oldest in the El Alto Region, with the Chulumani being one of the longest standing communal associations, having had 25 loan cycles with Pro Mujer (approximately twelve and a half years). The businesses that the members conduct are: the sale of footwear, baby clothes, woven sweaters and blankets, canned goods, juices and refreshments, macrame items, cheese and salt, and a grocery store. Mrs. Agustina Elena R. is 42 years old and married with three children (2 girls and 1 boy). She has a blanket weaving business during her free time and has been traveling to the cities of Cochabamba and Santa Cruz these past two years, taking school supplies along with her. This business began under the advice of her sister, whom already had experience in the development of this type of economic activity. Nevertheless, these haven't been the only economic activities that Agustina has undertaken. During the 24 loan cycles that she has been a member of Pro Mujer, she has developed different businesses according to the opportunities that have been presented to her.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, paper, folders

loans.name: Francisco Tomas

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco Tomas R.actualmente labora para una empresa que brinda servicios de seguridad a otras empresas que requieren de tales servicios, su estado civil es casado y han procreado con su esposa un total de dos hijos un menor y el otro en edad escolar el crédito lo solicito para la compra de materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
El Sr. Francisco Tomas R.currently works for a company that provides security services to businesses. He is married and has two children; one child is school-age, the other not yet in school. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials and pay laborers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cement, sand, gravel

loans.name: Crisologia

texts.en:
Crisologia has a business catching crabs. She started this business in 1992. She has five children and her eldest is 21 years-old. One of her dreams is to have her children finish their schooling. 

She is requesting a loan of 19,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to have additional capital for her business. What she likes in CEVI is that the loans have low interest and there are only 20 weeks of repayment.

loans.use: To provide additional capital.

loans.name: Ruth Eroy Group

texts.en:
Ruth E. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Ruth is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ruth is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a business running a general store. She sells a variety of different products in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ruth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used towards her working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Ruth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban has been a farmer in Naivasha for the last three years.  He is 21 years-old and married to Grace Sangaile.  They have a year old baby.

Laban was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy seedlings, plough his land and plant crops such as potatoes and maize during this rainy season.

He plans to increase his yield by cross cropping in future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, prepare the land and plant.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 45 años, comparte su vida con su esposo e hijos en una casa arrendada. Hace mas D. 3 años se ha dedicado a la actividad agrícola, logrando así intensificar este trabajo, es así que diariamente prepara sus terrenos D. cultivo para la siembra. Por otro lado también se  dedica a la crianza D. reses, en donD. posee una vaca que procura alimentarla bien ya que muy pronto podrá parir un becerro y pueda darle suficiente leche. El trabajo y esfuerzo que puso en su agricultura y ganadería tiene su recompensa, el ver sus frutos sanos y tener animales vigoroso en su establo le da mucho ánimos D. continuar trabajando. Por tal motivo desea aumentar la cantidad D. animales que tiene esto le ayudará en aumentar su productividad. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser responsable con sus pagos, además considera que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono para sembrar alfalfa que servirá D. forraje para sus animales, asimismo podrá arrendar terrenos D. cultivo para sembrar papa.
texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old, and lives with her husband and children in a rented house. She has been working as a farmer for the past 3 years, and hopes to improve her production. She gets the land ready to plant every day. She also raises cattle, and has a cow that she feeds well and soon will be giving birth and producing milk. All the work and dedication Ana puts into her farm and caddle is paying it off, and seeing healthy vegetables and animals gives her the incentive to improve her productivity. This is her 7th loan with MFP, and she is commited to pay it back responsibly, as she thinks it will be very useful to the improvement of her business. With this loan she plans to buy fertilizers to grow more lettuce that she'll use to feed her cattle, and also to get more land to start planting potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizers and Land to plant potatoes

loans.name: Los Pisafuertes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Pisafuerte” esta representado por la señora Silvia Nair y conformado por 12 miembros, 3 varones y 9 mujeres todos se conocen muy bien y una gran mayoría del grupo son familiares entre primos, hermanos y sobrinos, con diferentes actividades y muy entusiastas. La señora Silvia Nair es una joven dinámica y soñadora pero muy entusiasta ella vive con su madre y se dedica  a la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo como ella es muy carismática tiene habilidad para vender y salir adelante ella aun no es casada pero tiene una pequeña niña a la cual saca adelante con su pequeño negocio, ella requiere del préstamo para incrementar su capital D. trabajo y poder aprovechar las ofertas para obtener mejores ganancias. El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. comida, cosméticos, venta D. cerveza, ropa, servicios médicos,  servicios D. transporte y sastrería. No hay mucha competencia ya que se dedican a diferentes actividades y saben como salir adelante en cada uno D. sus rubros. En cuanto al destino del crédito muchos utilizar el mismo en la compra D. insumos, herramientas D. trabajo reparación D. sus herramientas D. trabajo y capital D. trabajo para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida. Este es un banco comunal  ya tiene experiencia ya que este es su tercer ciclo pero también  trabajaban con  otra entidades financiera similares cumpliendo a cabalidad con cada obligación financiera que tienen y mejorando cada día mas con sus negocios.
texts.en:
The "Los Pisafuerte" group is led by Silvia Nair and comprised of 12 total members, 3 men and 9 women, who all have different activities but all very enthusiastic. Everyone knows each other very well, and the majority are related as cousins, siblings, nieces, or nephews. Silvia Nair is a dynamic young woman, a dreamer, and very enthusiastic. She lives with her mother and sells catalog-order cosmetics. Because she is very charismatic she has a knack for sales and for success. While she is not married, she has a small daughter whom she supports with her small business. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her working capital and to be able to take advantage of special offers so as to generate better income. The rest of the group members sell food, cosmetics, beer, clothes, medical services, transportation service, and tailoring. There is not much competition between members since they are involved in different activities, and they know how to succeed in each one of their categories. As far as the intended use of the loan, many plan to use it for the purchase of materials, tools for repairs, tools for work, and working capital in order to increase sales and make better income, which would allow them to to give a better quality of life to their children. This is a community bank that has three cycles of lending experience, but they have also worked with other financial institutions, fully complying with every financial obligation they have and improving their businesses every day.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Efigenia

texts.es: Rosa Efigenia H. M. D. V. D. 59 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo D. 65 años D. edad, quien le ayuda en el negocio a la señora Rosa. Ella se dedica a la elaboración D. trapeadores, los cuales elabora en su casa, y que posteriormente venD. D. forma ambulante junto a su esposo, Rosa venD. su productos en diferentes colonias, cantones y pueblos del departamento D. Ahuachapán, así mismo los fines D. semana se coloca cerca D. diferentes mercados, con la esperanza D. poder aumentar sus ventas. Ella es una persona muy humilD. y trabajadora, la cual desea salir adelante y D. esta forma contar con el dinero necesario para poseer una vida estable junto a su esposo. Rosa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual le sea posible comprar mayor cantidad D. tela, para la elaboración D. los trapeadores, así mismo comprar agujas para la maquina D. cocer y diferentes colores D. hilo, todo lo que le permita poder ofrecer mayor cantidad D. trapeadores y así aumentar sus ventas. Tanto Rosa como su esposo son personas que se esfuerzan a diario, dando el mayor esfuerzo que les sea posible para mantener su negocio a flote.
texts.en:
Rosa Efigenia H. M. D. V., age 59, lives in the Ahuachapán department. She lives with her 65 year old husband, and he helps Rosa in the business. She makes mops in her house, and she later sells them as a traveling salesperson with her husband. Rosa sells her products in different villages, cantons, and towns in the Ahuachapán. Also, on the weekends she sets up near different markets in the hopes that she will be able to increase her sales. She is a very humble and hard-working person. She wants to get ahead and have the money that is needed to have a stable life with her husband. Rosa is requesting a loan so that she can buy a greater quantity of fabric to make the mops. She will also buy needles for her sewing machine and different colors of thread. She will buy everything that will allow her to sell a greater quantity of mops and increase her sales. Rosa and her husband are people who put forth daily effort. They put forth the greatest effort possible to keep their business afloat.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, and needles to make mops to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to buy new land and start growing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single man living alone. He has owned a small cafeteria in his town since 2007 and has been working in this occupation for the past eight years. He offers all types of sandwiches. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. Being alone is very hard for him, and he has work hard to make his own business and meet his life needs. He is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase merchandise needed for his shop. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop and make places to receive his customers, such as a restaurant. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes B. is a widow who takes care of six dependents. She sells onions, fresh tomatoes, and other fresh vegetables at Takoradi and uses the profit she generates from her business to promote the general welfare of her home.

Agnes will use the loan to purchase extra onions and other foodstuffs to sell. With the new revenues from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a shop to sell in.

loans.use: To purchase extra onions and other foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”;  este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yudith;  La socia  tiene 47 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos es casada; La socia vende junto a su conyugue con la venta de repuestos y prestan servicio técnico,  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de repuestos para la venta.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Unidos Para El Triunfo" ("United for Triumph") communal bank, which is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Ms. Yudith. She is 47 years old, has 3 children, and is married. Together with her husband, she sells spare parts and offers technical service. Ms. Yudith is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of spare parts to sell. She is grateful for and values the loan offered to her, and she also promises to comply with her repayment plan as established.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy B. lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Since she got married, she has run a farming business to help her husband support their family. She has seven children and the younger ones are still in school.

With the money from the loan, Mercy plans to purchase farming tools and farming inputs like seed and fertilizer. She also wants to use the money to finance the labor of the people who will be hired during the harvest season. The additional income will go to her children’s education and to the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: To buy farming tools and inputs like seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida D. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 52 years old. Zenaida is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Zenaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Evanysa

texts.en:
Evanysa is 35 years old and she is married to a farmer. They have 3 children between 11 months and 9 years. All of their children go to school except the youngest.

She sells arts and crafts. Evanysa has spent 3 years in this business. With the loan she will buy more arts and crafts to sell. With the profit she will save money. She dreams of having a booming business to the extent of double what she has now.

loans.use: To buy more art crafts to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 41 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. She makes a living by farming and hog-raising. She plants and harvests rice crops and grows pigs for fattening. She sells her harvest and pigs at the market. Jean is in need of additional capital for the farm and pigs. She applied for a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI so she could continue with her business. Jean is planning to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her farm and piggery.

loans.use: To fund the farm and piggery

loans.name: Dương

texts.en:
Quý Dương Thị (20213020011) is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  

To make a living, Quý owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community.  Quý has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Quý joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Quý has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,944,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  

Quý is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & to use as working capital.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by her from SEDA.  Quý plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Quý Dương Thị (20213020011) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, Quý Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Quý thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Quý kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, Quý đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Quý đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Quý dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Rubén Wilfredo

texts.es: Rubén Wilfredo J. A. de 25 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Santa Ana, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa y una hija de 6 años de edad. Él se destaca por ser una persona muy responsable y amable, quien trabaja comercializando diferentes tipos de semillas, como: almendras, simillas de marañon entre otras más, las cuales él mismo se encarga de preparar junto a su compañera de vida. Rubén vende sus productos de forma ambulante por diferentes lugares de Santa Ana. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de más semillas así mismo para comprar fruta y obtener sus semillas, y de esta forma poder vender más y así salir adelante junto a su familia, la cual depende por completo del trabajo de Rubén.
texts.en: Rubén Wilfredo J. A. is 25 years old.  He lives in Santa Ana department together with his wife and 6 year-old daughter.  He is a very responsible and kind person who works selling different types of nuts such as almonds, cashews and others.  He prepares them together with his wife.  Rubén sells his products as a street trader in different places in Santa Ana.  He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in buying more nuts and also whole nuts from which he can obtain the inner nuts.  In this way he will be able to sell more and thereby get ahead in life together with his family who are completely dependent on Rubén's work.

loans.use: To buy whole nuts to obtain the inner nuts to sell

loans.name: Martha Tereza

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 25 Rosas.

En este hermoso lugar encontramos a la señora Martha, ella tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero que aún viven en su casa, su esposo es comerciante, vende mariscos.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo donde vende productos básicos, mariscos, queso, carne, etc., trabaja todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 19h00, nos cuenta que su tienda es pequeña pero que tiene de todo en cantidad y variedad ya son varios años que lleva con ella. Su mercadería la compra en Bahía y Portoviejo. Además también recibe en su local parte de la mercadería.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más productos para surtir aun mas su tienda como arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la tesorera del Banco. Su  sueño es tener una tienda mucho mas grande.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the '25 Rosas' community bank meet in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez which is known for its beaches, its good food and the warmth of its people.

In this beautiful place we meet Martha.  She is 47 years old, married, and has two grown-up children who still live with her.  Her husband is a salesman who sells seafood.

Martha has a small store where she sells basic household products, seafood, cheese, meat, etc.  She works every day from 7.00am to 7.00pm.  She tells us that her store is small but that she has everything in quantity and variety.  She has been in this business for several years.  She buys her goods in Bahía and Portoviejo.  She also receives some of her goods direct to her store.

Martha will use this loan to buy more products to stock her store such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, etc.  Martha has been in her community bank since the beginning and she is the current treasurer.  Her dream is to have a much bigger store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and other goods

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells cosmetics in Takoradi by moving from one area to another. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Mary has been selling cosmetics for three years. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetics to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César tiene 47 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas como el mango, la maracuyá y el limón, pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la ganadería y crianza de animales menores, el cría estos animales cerca a su domicilio cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en donde vive. El alimenta a sus animales con alimento balanceado y forraje. Los ingresos le ayudan para hacerse cargo de sostener la economía de su familia.

Actualmente César desea adquirir alimento para sus animales de modo que estos se desarrollen de mejor modo y sean vendidos a mejor precio. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500  nuevos soles con los que espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
César is 47 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the agricultural district of Tambogrande.  This is an area with a semi-tropical climate that is noted for mainly producing fruit such as mangoes, passion fruit and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

César works as a cattle and livestock farmer.  He raises his animals near his home and, when they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to his neighbors and the traders who always visit his area.  He feeds his animals balanced animal feed and fodder.  He uses the profits he makes in this business to support his family financially.

Currently, César would like to acquire feed for his animals so that they develop better and can be sold at a better price.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternative with which he hopes to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To acquire feed for his animals so that they develop better and can be sold at a better price

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie E. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 26 years old. Lennie is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Lennie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lennie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lennie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lennie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Lennie is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Lennie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Wafika

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 39 years old, married and has four children. 

Wafika is farmer and she has owned a cow farm since 2000. The main products are dairy items. She is well known in her local area and has good reputation.

She is requesting a $1200 loan to buy a cow so she will be able to increase her productivity and grow her business in the future.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Jaimer

texts.es: Jaimer de 40 años de edad, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, es un hombre  muy alegre y trabajador; esta casado con Ernestina de 31 años de edad y tienen 03 hermosos hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa en la comunidad de Ranramayo caserío del distrito de Santa Rosa. Jaimer, es el sostén de su familia se dedica a la agricultura, labrando la tierra desde hace 18 años. En su parcela cuenta con plantaciones de cacao y café; plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac; en tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de la mano de jornaleros por lo que tiene que contratarlos para avanzar con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio que se encuentran en el distrito de San Francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos  de cacao y café. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras y sembrar más plantas de cacao de manera tecnificada y así obtener cacao orgánico. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesto a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Con los  3,000 nuevos soles solicitados,  contratará peones para extraer los frutos del café.
texts.en: Jaimer, 40 years old, is a happy and hardworking man who originally hails from the Santa Rosa district. He is married to Ernestina, 31 years old; they have 3 beautiful children and live together in their own home in the community of Ranramayo, a hamlet in the Santa Rosa district. Jaimer is the breadwinner for his family; he works in agriculture and has been working the land since he was 18 years old. His land contains cocoa and coffee plantations, with plants that are native to the Río Apurimac Valley woodlands. At harvest time he needs a helping hand from contracted day laborers in order to proceed with harvesting  the beans. For him, the best part of his job is harvesting the beans from the plant; a time when he feels that the quality of his beans makes the months of hard work worthwhile. He believes that the hardest part of his job is transporting his produce from the farm to the warehouses located in the district of San Francisco, where he is offered better prices for his coffee and cocoa beans. In the future, he wishes to buy new lands and sow more cocoa plants using more modern methods so that he can produce organic cocoa. This is his tenth loan with MFP; he feels that this support will greatly help him to continue with his work, and he is wiling to comply punctually with his repayment schedule. He will use the 3000 Nuevo Soles to contract workers to harvest the coffee beans.

loans.use: To employ day laborers to help him harvest coffee.

loans.name: Necole

texts.en: Necole is a married woman who lives in Manapla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Edwin, who is 40 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have two children who are 5 months and 11 years old. Necole joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Necole has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13, 000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs. Necole is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca L. cuenta con 49 años D. edad, es madre D. dos hijas, una D. ellas D. cinco años D. edad y la otra con 31 años.
Francisca se dedica al comercio dirigiendo su despensa, donD. venD. todo tipo D. artículos, tales como arroz, pastas, carne, productos lácteos y otros. Además D. dicha actividad, Francisca se dedica a la preparación D. comidas rápidas con la ayuda D. su hija mayor.
Francisca agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad D. seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento.
Ella desea invertir el crédito en la compra D. comestibles, frutas, verduras, carnes, bebidas, artículos D. limpieza, D. aseo personal, etc.
texts.en:
Francisca L. is 49 years old.  She has two daughters aged 5 and 31.

Francisca owns a small grocery store.  She sells all types of goods such as rice, pasta, meat, dairy products, etc.  In addition to this business, Francisca also prepares fast food with the help of her eldest daughter.

Francisca is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they are giving her to continue growing in her business.  She would like to invest her loan in buying food products, fruit, vegetables, meat, drinks, cleaning products, personal care products, etc.

loans.use: to buy cereals, fruit, vegetables, meat, drinks, cleaning products, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian P. is from the village of Nampicuan, Aurora, Isabela. He is 28 years old and single. To make a living, Christian owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing rice processing/milling to local community members. Christian is just starting this business.

In 2011, Christian joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christian is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional rice sacks and other materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Christian from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice sacks and other materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO est né le 07 avril 2011. Au jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de GUINAW RAIL RAO. Il est composé de 04 femmes qui sont toutes du même village. Elles sont à leur première expérience par rapport au crédit au CAURIE-MF

Madame Fatou D. F. (debout à droite sur la photo, emmitouflée avec une écharpe blanche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de  54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont les deux sont majeurs et mariée. 

Elle gère un atelier de couture. elle fait aussi de l'élevage de petits ruminants et de l'aviculture

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de développer sa couture en achetant des tissus et des fournitures de coutures

Son objectif est de renforcer ses activités de coutures et d'élevage et constituer une épargne assez consistante au niveau du Banc Villageois
texts.en:
The solidarity group DEGGO was established on April 7, 2011 on the inauguration day of the Banc Villageois of GUINAW RAIL RAO. The group is composed of four women, all from the same village. They are on their first experience with regards to borrowing from CAURIE-MF. 

Ms. Fatou D. F. (standing at the right in the photo and snug in her white scarf) is the group’s leader. She is 54 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, two of whom are adults and married. Ms. F. runs a sewing shop. She also raises small ruminants and poultry. 

Her new loan will enable her to develop her clothing business by buying cloth and some sewing supplies and equipment. Her goal is to bolster her sewing and livestock businesses and to build up a fairly large savings account with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy cloth and sewing supplies and equipment

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es: La señora Bernarda tiene 40 años de edad y es originaria del estado de Guerrero, pero ya tiene radicando en la población de Zitacuaro aproximadamente  20 años dice que se vino a estudiar y acá se caso. Doña Bernarda es una persona muy alegre ella esta casada con el señor Jorge el cual es policía, ellos tienen 2 hijos una que estudia la secundaria y un pequeño de 5 años. Ella se dedica a vender almuerzos para diferentes oficinas de gobierno de su población, ella les vende café, jugos de diferentes sabores, guisados como pollo en barbacoa, pozole, pambazos, sándwich, tacos y muchas otras cosas más, sale a vender a diario en su bolsa de mandado. Ella tiene con este negocio más de 5 años y emprendió este negocio para tener una entrada extra de dinero a su casa para solventar los gastos del hogar. Dice que a ella desde muy pequeña su familia le enseñaron a cocinar ya que su familia se dedica a la venta de comida mexicana y como le sale la comida sabrosa ella hace la comida para vender. Comenta que con el préstamo que le están otorgando ella comprara insumos para hacer las comidas, plásticos para llevar a vender la comida, gas etc. doña Bernarda esta muy contenta y quiere agradecer a la financiera por la confianza que están depositando en ella.
texts.en:
Bernarda, 40, is originally from the state of Guerrero but has been living in the community of Zitácuaro for about 20 years.  She says she came to study and married here.  Bernarda is a very cheerful person.  She’s married to Jorge, who is a police officer.  They have two children, one in secondary school and the little one who’s 5 years old.  She sells lunches in various government offices in her town.  She sells them coffee, assorted flavored juices, main dishes like barbeque chicken, pozole, pambazos, sandwiches, tacos and many other things.  She goes out daily to sell from her grocery bag.

She’s been in this business for over five years.   She went into it to earn extra money to cover household expenses.  She says that since she was very little her family taught her to cook because her family was in the Mexican food business and, since her dishes turn out very tasty, she makes food to sell.

She comments that she’ll use the loan she’s being granted to buy ingredients for her meals, plastic containers to sell the food in, gas, etc.  Bernarda is very happy and wants to thank the financial institution for the trust they are placing in her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food preparation.

loans.name: Aganatia

texts.en: Aganatia is a thirty-six-year-old married man with four children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail shop business for six years which he started with a capital of 500,000 UGX, and now has 2,700,000 UGX as working capital. His hardship is paying the increasing town council fees, and his vision is business expansion plus educating his children. Aganatia needs the loan facility to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Virgen De Juquila Group

texts.es:
La señora Petra Constantina es integrante del grupo Virgen de Juquila, se encuentra en Cohuecan, Puebla, México, las integrantes del grupo son las señoras Ernestina, Petra Constantina, Maura y Manuelas van a comprar con su préstamo barro y leña para elaborar sus jarros, ollas, platos, cazuelas y pedestales, la señorita Luisa va a comprar barro, leña y pinturas para elaborar ollas, cazuelas y platos, la señora Diana va a comprar medicamentos analgésicos, antibióticos, gasas, etc. La señora Gabina va a comprar barro y tierra blanca para elaborar platos y tazas, el señor Guillermo va a comprar llantas y mantenimiento para su taxi para dar un mejor servicio.
La señora Petra Constantina tiene 65 años de edad ella es casada tiene 2 hijos Maura de 38 años de edad y Sebastián de 16 años de edad ya trabaja, ella se dedica a la alfarería, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar barro para elaborar ollas y jarros los vende a sus clientes crudos, ella inicio su negocio cuando se caso con lo que le daba su esposo fue ahorrando para  comprar el barro y fue con una vecina para que le enseñara a trabajar el barro, actualmente su hija le ayuda a elaborar las ollas y los jarros, su negocio es importante porque tiene trabajo y tiene dinero para la familia, ella está orgullosa de elaborar los jarros y las ollas y le gusta cuando las vende y tiene dinero, ella se siete contenta y feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir porque va poder comprar su material y tener en existencia para ir trabajando y otra parte la va a ahorrar, sus sueños y esperanzas son tener salud junto con la familia para vivir contentos. San Bartolo Cohuecan es un pueblo bonito siembran de temporal sorgo y maíz, celebran el 24 de agosto al patrono del pueblo San Bartolo hay muchos visitantes, hay feria, misas, comida para los visitante. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos porque nos ayudan mucho en los negocios y que nos bajen el interés”
texts.en:
Petra Constantina is a member of the Virgen de Juquila group, which is in Cohuecan, Puebla, Mexico.  Ernestina, Petra Constantina, Maura and Manuelas are members of the group.  With their loan they are going to buy clay and firewood to make their jars, pots, pans, and stands.

Luisa will buy clay, firewood, and paints to make pots, pans, and plates.

Diana will buy analgesic medications, antibiotics, and gauze, etc.

Gabina will buy clay and white sandy soil to make plates and cups.

Guillermo will buy tires and pay for maintenance on his taxi in order to offer better service.

Petra Constantina, age 65, is married and has two children.  Maura is 38 years old, and Sebastian is 16 years old and works.  She devotes herself to making pottery.  She requested her loan in order to buy clay to make pots and jars.  She sells them to her customers unglazed.  

She started her business when she got married.  She was saving the money her husband gave her in order to buy clay.  She went to a neighbor to learn to work the clay.  Currently he daughter helps her make the pots and jars.  Her business is important because she has work and money for her family.  She is proud of making the jars and pots.  She likes it when she sells them and has money.  She is content and happy with the loan that she will receive because she will be able to buy her material and have it in stock in order to keep working.  She will save the other part of the loan.

Her hopes and dreams are to have good health together with her family in order to live happily.

San Bartolo Cohuecan is a pretty town where seasonal sorghum and corn is grown.  The 24th of August they celebrate the patron saint of the town of San Bartolo.  There are a lot of visitors, a fair, masses, and food for the visitors.  

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “Thanks for the loans because they help us a lot in our businesses and that they lower our interest”.

loans.use: to buy clay to make jars and pots.

loans.name: Doris Yolanda

texts.es:
Doris de 29 años es madre de familia, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de Morropón, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Las cuales  se caracterizan por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Doris se dedica a la venta de ropa y de calzado, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos 3 años, su mercadería lo ofrece en su casa a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.

Al observar Doris que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Doris de 29 años es madre de familia, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de Morropón, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Las cuales  se caracterizan por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Doris se dedica a la venta de ropa y de calzado, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos 3 años, su mercadería lo ofrece en su casa a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.

Al observar Doris que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.

loans.use: Comprarmás mercadería para abastecer su negocio

loans.name: Genera

texts.en:
Genara is 58 years old and a widow with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her store.

Genara has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Genara aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Epifania; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de animales menores como pollos, cuyes y chanchos y la socia también se dedica a la agricultura donde tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz y los animales lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en la provincia de Urubamba, su esposo trabaja vendiendo el maíz llevando a diferentes lugares como Calca, Anta y Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y alimentos para los animales.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member belongs to the communal bank "Reyna de los Angeles de Urquillos" which is located in the Urubamba district, in the Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco.
