To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for resale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua K. sells oranges and gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) both in small and larger quantities at Takoradi.

Efua is married to a security man and they have five dependents. She has not received any form of education. She uses her income to support her husband in taking care of the children.

Efua will use the loan to purchase more gari and more fruit to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more gari and more fruit to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La Señora Elizabeth , es cliente de la institución  que se encuentra en su segunda frecuencia, la cliente se dedica a la  venta de  comida (almuerzo y platos extras) y los sábados y domingos cocina platos especiales como ser chicharon, fricase y chairo especial, el kiosco lo tiene Cubicado en la zona de Cota Cota ,  la Sra. atiende con la ayuda de su esposo Martin ,ellos tienen tres hijos en edad escolar y un pequeño de  tres años, ahora  la cliente solicita el préstamo para el anticrético de otro ambiente para atender en ambos ya que el ambiente esta cerca de su negocio, por lo que se solicita este financiamiento kiva.
texts.en:
This is Elizabeth's second loan with the institution. She sells food (lunch and side dishes), and on Saturdays and Sundays she cooks special plates such as chicharon (fried pork skin), fricase, and chairo (both types of stew). Her kiosk is located in the Cota Cota area. She runs the business with the help of her husband, Martin. They have three children in school and a three-year-old. She's requesting this loan for the "anticrético" (special lease arrangement in Bolivia in which the renter pays a fixed sum up front and is then returned the money when he/she vacates the property) of another location close to her current location so that she can attend to both.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lease of another location

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice has a mixed farm in the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya, where she has been farming for five years. Her farm produces maize and bananas which she sells to middlemen and milk which she sells through the Kigane Dairy Society. She mainly depends on the income from her farming to provide for her family.

Alice is 36 years-old. She is married with three children aged 12, 9 and 2½. Two of the children attend school.

Alice recently repaid her previous loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo of 35,000KES and has requested this loan of 70,000KES to purchase a dairy cow. She says that this loan will help her expand her farming by acquiring another quality dairy cow. The income from her farm will enable her to educate her children and improve the living standards of her family. Her biggest challenges have been unpredictable weather conditions, the high cost of farm inputs and lack of labour.

She plans to expand her farming by practising extensive maize, dairy and banana farming in future. She says that Juhudi has helped empower her economically.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Los Amigos Responsables Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “LOS AMIGOS RESPONSABLES” se encuentra ubicada en la Libertad, distrito de Comas, departamento de Lima, está conformado por 9 socios, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 5 meses. Sus miembros realizan diversas actividades de producción, comercio y servicio.
María quien a su vez asume el cargo de tesorera, tiene 44 años, es casada, trabaja realizando encuestas en esta campaña política en la empresa (DATUM), además en esta temporada aprovechara para vender turrones. El reciente préstamo lo utilizará en la compra de mercadería (turrones) por esta campaña.  
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y están comprometidos a cumplir con los pagos según el cronograma otorgado por prosperidad.
texts.en:
The Los Amigos Responsables communal bank is located in La Libertad in the district of Comas and the department of Lima. It consists of nine members who have been working with EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD for the past five months. The group members have different businesses in production, sales and services.

María, who has assumed the position of group treasurer, is 44 years old and married. She is working taking surveys during the current political campaign with the company DATUM. In addition, she will also take advantage of the campaign season to sell turrones (a nougat candy). She will use this loan for the purchase of merchandise (turrones).

All of the borrowers are grateful for the support provided and promise to make their loan repayments according to the timeline granted by PROSPERIDAD.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (turrones, a nougat candy) for the campaign season.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí, esta separada del esposo y vive con una sola hija; la actividad que realiza es la venta de tarjetas de teléfono en una tienda que esta ubicada en el cementerio general.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una computadora que le sirva de servidor porque quiere instalar un Servicio de Internet, y de esta manera generar mas ingresos ya que tiene mucha demanda.

Fue cliente de Impro en el pasado y ahora vuelve a solicitar un nuevo crédito a través de Kiva;  por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Gladys lives in her parents' house in the zone of Villa Nuevo Potosí.  She is separated from her husband and has one daughter.  She sells telephone  cards at a store located in the general cemetery.

She wants a loan in order to buy a computer so that she can install internet for her clients, which is in great demand, and thereby generate more income.

She has been a client of the Impro microfinance partner in the past and is coming back now to ask for a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a computer in order to access internet service

loans.name: Selonah

texts.en:
Selonah E. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Masinulondon, Tabao Proper, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and crab fishing (Panggalan). Her husband Borlongan, who is 36 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 4 to 8 years old. Selonah joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Selonah has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to buy more stock for general store and maintenance for crab traps so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children. Selonah E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of goods to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are transportation and rent bills.

She sells purified water in a shop at wholesale and at the market. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Elizabeth faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish two more branches for selling purified water in the future. 

With the Kshs 35,000, she wants to purchase 50 plastic containers to store purified water for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 50 plastic containers to store purified water for resale.

loans.name: Betuel Cardoso

texts.pt:
Betuel C. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, tem 22 anos de idade vive maritalmente, é pai de 2 filhos de 4 e 2 anos não vão a escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras para pagar o seu internamento na Escola Secundária porque da escola para sua casa dista 30 km. Vive na casa própria e responsabiliza se pela sua mãe e irmã que vivem com ele.

Saiu da Matola para Namaacha quando o pai vendeu propriedade de terra na Matola. Então inicia sua actividade pesqueira e comercial. E proprietário de um barco a remo e um estabelecimento comercial que obteve atraves do rendimento nas suas actividades de venda de combustivel e com ajuda da Hluvuku e kiva. Tem como melhor marisco o (peixe) e conta com ajuda de dois empregados e consegue 10.000.00mt por mês dependendo mas da estação do tempo.

Nunca teve empréstimo em outros Bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravas de amigos que são nossos clientes. Este é terceiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com qual ira comprar redes de pesca para aumentar o volume do stock e satisfazer a clientela. Os anteriores créditos de (10.000.00 e 5.000.00mt) forão para a mesma actividade.

Tem como objectivo dar inicio da sua obra e adquirir mas empréstimos para comprar mas um barco para reforçar seu negócio.
texts.en:
Betuel C. was born in the town of Matola, in the Maputo Province. He is 22 years old and is in a common law marriage. He has two children who are 2 and 4 years old and not in school. He went to school until 7th grade but didn't continue due to lack of financial resources to pay for boarding school for high school. The school was 30km away from his home. He lives in his own house and supports his mother and sister who live with him. 

He left Matola to go to Namaacha when his father sold his land. He then started his commercial and fishing business. He owns a row boat and a store. He was able to own them with his income from selling fuel and with Hluvuku and Kiva's help. His best product is fish. He has two employees to help him and makes 10,000 meticais per month, depending on the season.

He has never had loans with other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through friends who are also our partners. This loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticais, is his third. He will buy fishing nets to increase his inventory and please his clientele. The previous loans were for 10,000 and 5,000 meticais and were used in the same activity. 

His goal is to start working and to request more loans to purchase another boat to increase his business.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing nets and hooks

loans.name: Edith María

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Edith, ella tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 3 y 2 años. El marido es comerciante.

Ella es una ama de casa que para ayudar a su marido y  a su familia  solicito este crédito para utilizarlo en el negocio que tiene su marido, el trabaja en la compra y venta de bidones de agua, el todos los días se desplaza en su moto que la ha adecuado para cargar muchos bidones, con la que sale a recorrer y entregar a los muchos clientes que tiene y a los que día a día entrega. Trabaja desde las 8am hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que su marido lleva en este negocio ya  tres años y que en la actualidad tiene muchos clientes.
 
Este crédito que ella solicito es para comprar diez bidones con botellas y agua para tener sus propias botellones  con lo que el producto le saldría más barato y tendría más ganancias. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que viven en casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Increíbles (The Unbelievable Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

We find Edith, 21, here.  She is in a common law relationship and she has two children who are 3 and 2 years of age.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a housewife who, in order to help her husband and family, requested this loan to use it in her husband’s business.  He sells large containers of drinking water.  He goes out every day on a motorcycle that he has adapted to carry a large amount of water jugs to deliver water to his large number of customers who he has to deliver to every day. He works from 8am until 8pm.  Our friend tells us that her husband has had this business for three years now and he has quite a few customers.

The loan she requested is to buy ten water jugs and water for them to store so that the product will be less expensive that way and their profits will be higher.  This is her third loan with the communal bank and she likes it because interest rates are low.  Her dream is to have her own house because they currently live in her mother’s house.

loans.use: To buy ten large jugs of drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Maryrose's Group

texts.en:
Maryrose A. is from the village of Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 23 years old. Maryrose is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Maryrose is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Maryrose owns & operates a business operating motorcycle transport services. Maryrose has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maryrose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maryrose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Maryrose is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maryrose from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Gelasia

texts.en:
Gelasia is a married woman from the town of Panglao. She has a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business. She earns from it daily. She also tends a small parcel of a rice farm. She says the harvest is very helpful, as she does not have to buy rice for her family to eat. Gelasia hopes to have a stable business.

Gelasia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Gelasia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María pertenece al Banco comunal “Vida Nueva”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Longaví. Ella se dedica a la confección y venta de disfraces para fiestas, desde hace 15 años.  María compra sus materiales en la ciudad de Linares y en Santiago, su material de trabajo es principalmente ropa usada la que  remodela, para obtener novedosos diseños de disfraces. Además tiene un bazar en el cual vende sus disfraces. Su hija le ayuda en la venta de disfraces dentro del bazar.
María tiene clientes frecuentes particulares y un colegio, al cual vende disfraces para fiestas escolares.
Con este préstamo, pretende comprar disfraces para fiestas en tallas más grandes.
Su sueño es aumentar el número de clientes, incluidos los colegios, y de esta manera aumentar su producción. Además quiere aprender a coser y comprarse una maquina de coser y una de bordar. Su motivación es aumentar la producción de disfraces, y abastecer a todo Longaví con sus productos y de esta manera agrandar su negocio.
Para María la ayuda de Fondo Esperanza ha sido fundamental en su negocio, ya que le ha permitido financiar y conocer mas de su negocio a nivel comercial y de gestión. Gracias a los ingresos de su negocio María ha podido financiar  los estudios superiores de su hija.
Longaví es una comuna de la región del Maule, zona central de Chile. Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa “cabeza de serpiente”. Es una comuna eminentemente rural, agrícola, emplazada entre montañas, precordillera  y cordillera, de gran belleza natural, siendo su punto más alto el cerro Nevados de Longaví, con 3.242 metros de altitud.
texts.en:
María belongs to the Communal Bank “Vida Nueva” (New Life), which is in the city of Longaví. She has been producing and selling party dresses for fifteen years. María buys her materials in the cities of Linares and Santiago. Her work material consists primarily of used garments that she repurposes into new designs of gowns. She also has a bazaar where she sells the dresses. Her daughter helps with selling dresses in the bazaar.

María has many regular customers, including schools, which purchase dresses for school functions. With this loan, she plans to buy party dresses in larger sizes.

Her dream is to increase the number of customers, including schools, which she serves. This requires that she increase her production. In addition, she wants to learn how to sew and purchase both a sewing machine and an embroidery machine so that she can expand her business.

For María, the assistance from Fondo Esperanza has been essential to her business. It has enabled her to finance her business and learn more how to manage it. Thanks to her earnings, María has been able to fund her daughter’s higher education.

Longaví is a commune in the region of Maule in central Chile. Its name in the Mapuche language means “head of the serpent”. This is predominantly a rural farming area situated in the foothills between two mountains of great natural beauty. The highest point of Longaví is the snowy peak that stands 3,242 meters above sea level.

loans.use: Acquire party dresses

loans.name: Gladys Noemí

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHASKA ÑAHUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys Noemí; la socia tiene 33 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de productos secos como mana, fideos entre otros, la socia viaja al Valle Sagrado para vender sus productos también vende en Cusco pero siempre viaja por el Valle y también está en las distinta ferias dominicales, la socia a la vez vende productos de belleza como cremas, colonias, perfumes entre otros más ella es consultora de las líneas Avon y Esika. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos  secos para su negocio y también para la compra de productos de belleza.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Chaska Ñahui Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Cusco District, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Gladys Noemi is 33 years old, has a live-in partner, and has two children. She works buying and selling dried goods like nuts, pasta, and other items. She goes to Sacred Valley as well as Cusco to sell her goods, but she always travels through the valley and to different Sunday markets. Gladys Noemi also sells beauty products like creams, colognes, perfumes, etc. She is a consultant for Avon and Esika.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of more dried goods for her business, as well as for the purchase of beauty products.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: To purchase more dried goods for her business, as well as beauty products

loans.name: Monicah Wangui

texts.en:
Monicah has practised farming in Nduyu, Njeru town for the last nine years.  She is 42 years old, married to James Gathura. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be her fourth loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

In future, Monicah hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Gotov

texts.en:
Gotov C., 52, is married and lives with his wife and a son in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife is self-employed and his daughter attends a local secondary school. 

His wife helps him with the business. He began selling consumer goods in 2002. He started his business with the working capital of 1,200,000 MNT. Then he got a loan of 600,000 MNT from XacBank in 2004 and now his working capital exceeds 8,000,000 MNT in addition to his inventory and his container at the local market. 

He imports his consumer goods from Beijing and goes to China once or twice a month. Gotov is a hardworking and active person who says, " We want to save some money in order to help our youngest son start his life." 

He is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to resell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie S. is from the village of Poblacion, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods,  shampoo, soap, rice per kilogram,  beverages, breads & toothpaste in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 26,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, snack foods & a sack of rice. This will be the 20th loan taken out by Rosemarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, snack foods & a sack of rice.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito D. Puno y departamento D. Puno, tiene 64 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos independientes.  Agustina tiene grado D. instrucción  primaria (incompleta). 
Ella se dedica  a la venta D. artesanías,  trabaja  con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos, desD. hace cinco años.  Su préstamo inicial fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio D. venta D. artesanía.  Agustina trabaja junto con su esposo.
Con este préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles,  comprará 10 cubos D. lana para la fabricación D. las chompas, chalinas, gorros, ponchos y comprará otras mercaderías para su negocio.
También nos cuenta que trabaja en otra actividad, se dedica a a la venta D. carros junto con su esposo, actividad que desarrolla para apoyar a su esposo.
Su sueño es ser compradora D.  terrenos para luego venderlos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y  la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the communal bank "Sweet Dawn", located in the district of Puno and the department of Puno. She is 64 years old, married, and she has 2 grown children. Agustina has a primary school education (incomplete). 

She sells crafts and she has been with the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 5 years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles and she used it on her crafts business. She works together with her husband. 

This loan is in the amount of S/.3000 nuevos soles and she will purchase 10 cubes of wool to make jackets, sweaters, hats, and wraps. She will also purchase other merchandise for her business.

She also has another business. She sells cars with her husband. She is involved in this business to support her husband. Her dream is to buy land for later resale.

What she enjoys about her communal bank is the meetings, the timeliness, and the responsibility.

loans.use: to purchase 10 cubes of wool to make jackets, sweaters, hats, and wraps.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es: Mateo tiene 51 años, asegura que se siente feliz al haber conformado una familia unida. Pues se casó con Elva de 48 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales sólo viven con Mayner de 21 años, en su vivienda propia, ubicada en el caserío de Huaylahuichan. Como todo hombre tuvo que afrontar dificultades. Recuerda que para pagar la educación de sus hijos, llevaba lo poco que sembraba directo a comercializarlos y casi no ganaba lo suficiente, hasta que hace 30 años,  con el apoyo de su esposa compró grandes extensiones de terreno donde actualmente cultiva maíz, arveja, alfalfa, además papa, lo que le permite obtener ingresos económicos con las cuales compró más chacras, construyó su casa y vive cómodamente. Mateo admira a Elva, su esposa, pues ella es la gran gestora de todos sus logros, “es una mujer emprendedora y decidida que supo destinar bien el dinero que llegaba a sus manos”, asegura, por ello sin temores afirma que es ella la que administra todo el dinero que gana.  Él, a la vida le pide tranquilidad, además como siempre está ahorrando para más adelante poder construir una casa de hospedaje donde atender a los clientes y generar ingresos sin tanto esfuerzo. Pues se prepara para su futuro, en donde ya no tendrá las mismas fuerzas para trabajar la tierra. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde está seguro que accederá a futuros créditos porque refiere que con sus ahorros, sus pagos puntuales, más el trabajo activo que desempeña en su banco comunal garantizan como una persona responsable. Con el dinero solicitado, invertirá en el pago de las 7 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, puesto que las tierras que posee los alquilará a un precio mayor y así ganar algo extra de dinero, con ella piensa comprar semilla de maíz  y abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Mateo is 51 years old.  He says that he feels happy to have formed a united family.  Mateo is married to 48 year-old Elva, with whom he has three children.  Only 21 year-old Mayner still lives with them in their home, which they own.  They live in the small village of Huaylahuichan.

In common with every man, Mateo has had to face difficulties in life.  He remembers that, in order to pay for his children's education, he used to take the small amount of produce that he grew and sell it straight away.  He almost didn't earn enough until, 30 years ago, he and his wife bought large stretches of land.  This is where he currently grows corn, peas, alfalfa and potatoes.  This purchase allowed him to make more income which he used to buy more land.  He built his own home and now lives comfortably.

Mateo admires his wife Elva because she is the great manager behind all of their achievements.  "She is an entrepreneurial and determined woman who knew how to make good use of the money that came into our hands", he says.  For this reason, he is not afraid to admit that his wife is the one who manages all the money that he earns.  Mateo is looking for relaxation in his life.  He is always saving up so that he can build lodgings in the future where he can serve his customers and make income without so much effort.  He is preparing for his future when he will not have the same strength to work the land.

Mateo is a member of the "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank and this is his seventh loan from MFP.  He is certain that he will access future loans because he says that his savings, his punctual loan repayments, and the active work that he carries out as a member of his community bank guarantee him as a responsible person.

Mateo will invest the loan he has requested in paying for seven hectares of farmland as he will rent out the land that he already owns at a higher price and thereby make a bit of extra money.  He plans to use this to buy corn seed and organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to rent seven hectares of land to farm

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.es:
Patrocinia, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y ropa, vive con su esposo y tienen 3 hijos. El negocio de ella es el comercio de ropa que lo realiza durante la semana en horas del día, por las tardes vende pupusas.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para preparar la pupusas como, quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, condimentos, también compra de ropa como faldas, blusas, ropa interior.
Este préstamo le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio y generar mayores ganancias, el sueño de ella es poder obtener su propia casa, para vivir dignamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Patrocinia sells pupusas and clothes. She lives with her husband and they have three children. Patrocinia sells clothes throughout the week during the day and then sells pupusas in the evenings.

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for preparing pupusas such as cheese, pork, corn, and condiments. Patrocinia will also buy clothes such as skirts, blouses, and undergarments.

This loan will help strengthen her businesses so that she can generate more income. Her dream is to obtain her own house so that her family can live decently.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: La Señora Irma tiene 35 años D. edad, socia D. la alcancia comunal mujeres emprendedoras, es casada con 3 hijos en la etapa escolar, actualmente tiene una tienda D. productos D. abarrotes y otros, la socia realiza las compras a tempranas horas D. la mañana para dedicarse durante el día a la atención D. su bodega. El Préstamo solicito es para la compra D. una vitrina y exhibición D. los chocolates, galletas, caramelos, bebidas etc. La socia esta ubicada al centro D. las socias esta vestido con chompa color rosada. El Préstamo Solicito D. s/.1,000.00 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Irma, 35, is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) communal bank.  She is married and has three, school age children.  She has a store where she sells groceries and other items.  She does her purchases early in the morning so that she can tend to her store the rest of the day.

She requested the loan to buy a display case to display her chocolates, cookies, candy, beverages, etc.

In the photo, she’s in the center of the members wearing a pink sweater.  The loan she asked for is for 1000 new soles.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Deice Mireya

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorad se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Deice es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y uno de 16 años, dos de sus hijos estudian la mayor en universidad y el menor en colegio todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer tiene un bus.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, nos cuenta que la mayor parte de sus ventas son bajo pedido. Trabaja todos los días más que todo en las mañanas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y también le mandan desde Colombia. Tiene 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y nos cuenta que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos se realicen como profesionales.
texts.en:
The “De Colorado” communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renowned nationally and internationally.  It is the place of the famous “Panama” hats.

Deice is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the interest rate is lower than in other credit institutions.  She is 45 years old, married and has three children, two adults and a 16-year-old.  Two of her children are studying.  Her older daughter is in the university and the youngest is in high school.  All her children still live with her.  Her husband’s a driver and has a bus.

She is a housewife who in order to earn her own resources sells all kinds of clothes door to door.  She also sells from home where her customers come to buy.  She tells us that most of her sales are order based.  She works every day mostly in the morning.  She sells on credit and collects payments every two weeks.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise and she also has items sent to her from Colombia.  She’s been in this line of work for 12 years and she tells us that she started it with the first loan she got from the institution.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Batmunh is 51 years old and lives with his wife and five children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvs province of Mongolia. His older son is a herder and his second son works for a private company. His younger three children attend college and secondary school. He manages a rag making business in his town with the help of his wife. He makes a variety of rags with different styles and designs. His products are well-known amongst his customers for quality and durability. In addition he makes shoes for all ages. 

Batmunh's family members all assist in his business operation. Therefore he is planning to expand his business in the future. He is a polite man who says, "We are committed to making quality products for our customers." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase a sewing machine and some materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and some materials

loans.name: Lima Poty Ii Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado Lima Poty II esta formado en la ciudad de Santani, cuenta actualmente con 10 miembros, todas ellas trabajan de forma responsable y dentro de un ambiente de cooperación. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo
La Sra. Anuncia es peluquera, se dedica a esto desde hace ya varios años, en su barrio es muy conocida, la mayoría de las mujeres de las zonas aledañas vienen hasta su peluquería, ya que es muy buena en lo que hace. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, por medio de su trabajo ha logrado salir adelante.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de gel, tintes, aerosoles y demás que utiliza en el ejercicio de su profesión.
texts.en:
The group "Lima Poty II" was formed in the city of Santani.  It now has 10 members, and all of them work in a responsible way and in an atmosphere of cooperation.  These members formed a close knit group,  and are able to carry out joint activities to strengthen their partnership.

Anuncia is a hairdresser who has been in this line of work for a number of years.  She is well-known in her neighborhood, and most of the women from the surrounding areas come to her beauty salon, since she is very good at what she does.  Anuncia is a very hardworking woman, and through her work she has managed to get ahead.

She requests a loan to buy hair gel, dyes, hair spray, and other items that she uses in her work as a hairdresser.

loans.use: to buy hair gel, dyes, hair spray and other supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Narcisa es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive por una comunidad aledaña a la parroquia del Valle, este lugar es de clima frió y nos regala una hermosa vista de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes áreas de trabajos.

Doña Narcisa tiene 31 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es propia siendo el sacrificio de su trabajo.

La Señora. Narcisa labora como empleada domestica, este trabajo lo ejerce hace un año, trabaja de lunes a viernes todo el día y los sábados medio día. En su casa se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cerdos a los que los vende en su propia comunidad.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar su casa.

Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Ms. Narcisa is a member of the Los Talvos communal bank. She lives in a community near the Del Valle parish, where the climate is cold and the landscape provides beautiful views. The people there work in trade, animal husbandry, and agriculture, and many people work various jobs in the city of Cuenca.

Narcisa is 31 years old. She is a single mother with two children who are 14 and 9 years old. Her first son is studying in high school and her younger son is in a little school in the city. The house they live in is her own thanks to her work and sacrifice.

Narcisa has been working as a domestic employee for one year. She works all day from Monday to Friday and a half-day on Saturdays. At home, she also raises chickens and pigs, which she sells in her community.

This is the third loan she has taken out through the communal bank and she is going to invest it in construction materials to finish her house.

Her goal is to finish her house as it is still missing a few things.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Ana Bertha tiene la edad de 20 años, solo estudio hasta el bachillerato y esta casada con el señor Carlos y trabaja como ayudante de Albañil, ellos aun no tiene hijos.
Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de 2 años inicio a trabajar en la venta de articulos para la cocina ya que deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y a formar un patrimonio para sus hijos que piensan tener en un futuro.
Ella realiza sus ventas casa por casa con sus amigos de la comunidad.
Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de ollas, bajillas, caserolas, sartenes, cucharas, vasos y platos para posteriormente venderlos en su comunidad.
Ella espera que con este credito su negocio pospere ya que desea en un futuro tener los recursos para darle a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y ofreceles estudios.
texts.en:
Ana Bertha is 20 years old and completed up to high school.  She is married to Carlos who works as a builder’s assistant.  They do not yet have children.

She tells us that she started to work selling kitchen items a little over two years ago, as she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and build an inheritance for the children they plan to have in the future.

She makes her sales from house to house to her friends in the community.  She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of pots, dishes, casserole pots, frying pans, spoons, glasses and plates to later sell in her community.

She hopes that her business will prosper with this loan, as she wants to have the money to provide her future children with a good quality of life and schooling.

loans.use: to sell dishes.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the Philippines. Gemma has a retail shop where she sells rice,  pancakes, snacks, and canned goods . She has had this business for 18 years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Gemma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is a businessman who is 31 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last five years, he has been selling oil. He earns extra income from his retail shop. He has employed five people to help him to operate the business. For the next five years, he wants to add more employees in his business.  He is requesting a loan of 19,995 Kenyan shilling to buy oil. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, it has enabled him to improve his business and his living standards.

loans.use: To buy oil

loans.name: Usuhbayar

texts.en:
Usuhbayar is 36 years old and lives with her four children in a ger in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. She is the only provider for her family.  Her four children are high school students. 
Usuhbayar started her business in 2007 by selling meat. Even though her income is relatively low, she is happy with it and has a very bright vision for her children and herself. She is a diligent and open-minded person who says, 'I'll expand my business and some day I hope to be a successful and well experienced businesswoman.' She is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to purchase meat and livestock.

loans.use: to purchase meat and livestock.

loans.name: Guillermo Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Guillermo tiene 42 años, la ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado en donde la mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan a buscar el precio de sus productos a un precio accesible. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este medio de vida, Guillermo tiene que mantener a su esposa y sus tres hijos, quienes son lo más importante para él. Ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de zapatos para fútbol, zapatos para beisbol, botas, sandalias, zapatos deportivos entre otros.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 42 years old.  His business is located in the market where the majority of his customers always come to look for his products at an accessible price.  He has had this work for more than six years.

Guillermo has to support his wife and three children, who are the most important thing for him.

He has requested a loan to buy soccer shoes, baseball shoes, boots, sandals, and sports shoes, among other types.

loans.use: to buy soccer shoes, baseball shoes, boots, sandals, and sports shoes, among other types.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Felisa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. Felisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Felisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Fatuma has a food stall business.  She has been in this business for less than one year and she works 6 days out of every week.   Fatuma sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail. She also generates additional income through selling piped water and doing computer work.  

Fatuma has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy fresh fruits and vegetables like mangoes, pineapples and cabbages.   The main business challenges for Fatuma include seasonality and perishability.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a deep freezer to keep her fruits and also to start growing some of the fruits.   

Fatuma lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Juan  Jelman

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Juan Jelman se dedica arduamente  a laborar como conductor, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace siete años. Es soltero y tiene una persona a su cargo que le proporciona las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen.

El señor Juan Jelman ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como perlines, cinz, para poder reparar techo que se encuentra en mal estado, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In Managua, Juan Jelman has worked hard as a driver for seven years. He is unmarried and takes care of one other person, who gives him the necessary support to get ahead.

Juan Jelman has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan for improving his home. He will use the loan to buy construction materials like beams and sheet metal to repair his roof, which is in bad shape, and thereby provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 31-year-old man from Kisumu City. He is married to Mary, who operates a hotel in the city, and they have three children.

John runs a mobile phone accessories shop in Kisumu and has been doing this for the last two years. He makes a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He is taking his first loan which he will use to buy mobile phone chargers, mobile phone spare parts and other phone accessories. 

From the profits, John intends to inject some capital into his wife’s hotel business so as to increase the family income and also pay back his loan. His hope is to own a big mobile accessories shop where he can sell items at wholesale to other small scale traders.

loans.use: To buy stock of mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Katia

texts.es: Katia, de 23 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, decidida y con deseos de progresar, es conviviente con Diego, y junto a sus tres pequeños hijos de 5, 3 y 1 años de edad viven en casa de sus suegros. La actividad que realiza Katia, es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad en su bodega instalada en la casa donde vive, iniciándose hace 2 años con un capital propio, al cual fue haciendo rotar e incrementar. Viendo  la buena acogida que tenía, puede ahora enviar productos a los caseríos que están ubicados a los márgenes del río Ucayali, contando para esto con el apoyo de su suegro que se encarga de los traslados. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico que le permite apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de alimentación y crianza de sus hijos, ya que muchas veces con el ingreso económico de mototaxista, no les alcanzaba y pasaron algunas necesidades, siendo ayudados por sus suegros. Ante esto fue que decidió generarse sus propios ingresos. Este será el primer crédito con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, para así tener un buen record crediticio. Además se siente cómoda con su grupo ya considera a los integrantes ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de una mayor variedad de productos para surtir su bodega, considera que con mayor variedad tendrá más preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Katia, 23, is a diligent, determined and hardworking woman who wants to get ahead. She lives with her partner, Diego, and their three children, 5, 3, and 1 years old, in her in-law’s house. Katia sells grocery staples in a small store set up in the house where she lives. She opened the store two years ago with her own capital, which she has reinvested and increased. Based on how well received she has been, she can now send products to the settlements located on the banks of the Ucayali river and relies on her father-in-law’s help for this, since he is entrusted with those deliveries.

What Katia likes about her work is the ability to earn an income that allows her to help her partner with the expense of feeding and raising their children,  since his income as a motorcycle taxi driver is often not sufficient and they have to rely on her in-laws’ help for some of their necessities.

This will be her first loan with MFP and she is requesting a small amount so that she will be able to meet her commitments. She promises to make her payments on time in order to have a good credit history. As well, she feels comfortable with her group since she considers the members to be responsible and supportive people. She will invest the 800 soles requested in the purchase of a greater variety of products to stock her store. She feels that with a larger inventory she will better meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to stock her store.

loans.name: Mutekesi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mutekesi Group in Western Kenya! Getrude is the facilitator of the Mutekesi group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Getrude takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Getrude had a very good maize yield, harvesting 22 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Getrude was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Getrude  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Getrude will educate her children and repay the loan.

In 2012, the members of Mutekesi group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The picture shows Getrude and her group with the field officer far right.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es: Yony, de 49 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 33 y 5 años, el mayor es independiente mientras que el menor vive con ella y es la razón para que día a día trabaje mucho ya que desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Yony consiste en realizar trabajos de costura, realiza diseños propios y los vende; asimismo compone prendas. Tiene un pequeño taller en su casa en donde espera todos los días que lleguen sus clientes quienes les son fieles, pues hace un bueno trabajo además de tener un acabo perfecto y algunos detalles muy significativos. Lleva realizando esta actividad por 34 años y esta muy feliz de poder generar ingresos con algo que le gusta hacer tanto. AL principio cuando se inicio, no sabia muy bien algunas técnicas pero con el tiempo fue aprendiendo. Ahora con 34 años de experiencia es toda una maestra y por eso es que tiene muchos clientes a veces que esperan para que les pueda atender sus pedidos. Tiene como proyecto el poder ampliar su negocio y así poder satisfacer a todos sus clientes. Este será el segundo cerdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero ya que le permitirá estar mas tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará materiales para seguir con su trabajo, además comprará una maquina remmalladora para dar mejor acabado a sus creaciones.
texts.en: 49-year-old Yoni is a good and kindhearted woman. She lives with her partner with whom she has two children aged 33 and 5. The older one is independent. The younger one lives with her and is the reason why she works hard every day, since she wants to provide her child with better living conditions. Yoni's work is sewing. She designs her own products and sells them, and also makes jewelry. She has a small shop in her home where every day she waits for her customers to arrive. Her clientele is faithful because she does good work and, besides, she has perfect finish and very significant detailing. She has been in this business for 34 years and she is very happy to be able to get an income from something she so enjoys doing. When she first started, she didn't know some techniques very well, but in time she learned them. Now, with 34 years of experience, she is a master and that is why she has so many customers who sometimes wait until she can take their orders. She has a project of expanding her business so that she can satisfy all of her customers. This will be her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will get financial support, since it will allow her to be more relaxed and go ahead with her business plan. With the requested amount of 1.200 soles she will purchase supplies in order to keep working. She will also purchase an overlock sewing machine so she can give better finish to her creations.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Luz Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Luz Eugenia se dedica a la compra – venta de carbón a los diferentes restaurantes, asaderos de pollo y todo aquel que necesite desde hace tres años, esta labor la realiza gracias a un amigo de su padre quien le ofreció este trabajo, desde entonces almacena el carbón en un espacio de su casa. Esta actividad brinda el sustento necesario para la señora Luz Eugenia y sus padres quienes tienen 87 y 97 años por lo que tienen que ir constantemente a controles médicos mus costosos, por lo que la señora Luz Eugenia necesita de la compra de carbón con el cual pueda atender la demanda de fin de año y tener los recursos necesarios para cuidar la salud de sus padres.
texts.en:
For three years Luz Eugenia has been buying and selling charcoal to different restaurants, to chicken broilers, and to all that need it.  The work that she does is thanks to a friend of her father who offered her this work.  From then on she has been storing the charcoal in a space at her house.

This business activity gives the needed support for Luz Eugnia and her parents, ages 87 and 97.  Her parents need to continually go to doctors, which is very expensive.

Therefore, Luz Eugenia needs to buy charcoal to be able to take care of the end of the year demand.  She also needs the resources to take care of her parents’ health.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 20, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Pov has been running a business selling traditional medicines for over two years. He has extensive experience and success in his business. He also takes the medicines to other provinces around the country to sell them there. His wife helps him run the business. 

In order to improve his business, Pov is asking for a loan of USD 1,000 to raise capital in order to buy more more traditional medicines to sell and make more profit. In the future, he would like to purchase a new car to transport his medicines to sell around the country. Moreover, he plans to build a new concrete house.

loans.use: to buy more traditional medicines to sell.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Menunatu. She is married and has two children who are 10 and 6 years old. In 2002, Menunatu established her plastic slippers, baby items, head ties and cosmetics business. She began her business because she was not educated to be employed in an office. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business as profit. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Menunatu requires a loan to buy more plastic slippers, baby items, head ties and cosmetics. In the future, Memunatu plans to build a house and to give her children a quality education.  She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers, baby items, head ties and cosmetics

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. Afin d'élevé le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Émilienne (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 30 ans. Émilienne est veuve, mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Émilienne et son mari. Pour cette raison, Émilienne collecte des bouteilles vides, qu'elle revend depuis huit ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Émilienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Émilienne sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe GBENONKPO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des bouteilles vides.

loans.name: Fran

texts.en:
Fran's wife Luljeta(in the picture) does cleaning, yet the money she makes is way below the minimum pay; she barely makes $70/month in cash.The thing is that if she doesn't contribute to her retirement pension, she will get zero money when she retires. There is no retirement supplement or social assistance or something along this line, unfortunately, that's the law in Albania. Their family doesn't own any land either, so that they could use it as a main source of income.They only manage to keep 30 chickens and a pig in the very little front yard. Fran works as a carpenter for some furniture company for a monthly pay of $237.
The loan that Fran is requesting will be used to pay for the retirement pension contribution of his wife.

loans.use: to pay for the retirement pension contribution of his wife

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is originally from ManabÃ­ but has lived in Guayaquil for 15 years. He owns a small store where he sells groceries and other food items. He learned the business from his parents who provide some support for him but cannot give him credit. His wife also helps out at the store, but in order to grow he needs a source of capital other than the loan sharks. With the credit he plans to increase and diversify his inventory. Currently his profits average about two dollars a day.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Kayivi

texts.en:
A. Kayivi is married and the mother of four. At home, she takes care of her young son. Her business selling smoked fish provides income and helps her husband, a farmer, to cover household expenses. She is a resourceful woman, and she applies everything she knows to her work, which results in a product of exceptional quality. Although there is an ever-increasing customer demand, she lacks the funds to meet it. And so she is requesting a loan of $650 to augment her production of smoked fish. The loan will be the capital for smoking fish to sell. The success of her business, which she calls «Bon Goût» (Good Taste) will allow her to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants, Madame A. Kayivi a à sa charge son petit fils. Elle exerce comme activité la vente de poissons fumés pour pouvoir disposer d’un revenu et contribuer aux charges du ménage avec son mari cultivateur. Femme ingénieuse, elle met tout son savoir-faire au service de ce travail, ce qui confère à la production une qualité exceptionnelle. Avec une demande de plus en plus croissante, elle n’a pas suffisamment de moyens pour satisfaire tous les clients. Elle sollicite un crédit de $650 afin de pouvoir augmenter sa production et satisfaire les demandes. Le crédit servira donc de fonds de commerce pour l’achat, le fumage et la vente du poisson. Le succès de cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire, smoke, and sell fish

loans.name: Khorshid

texts.en:
Khorshid D/O M. D. was born in 1941 and lives in District 13 of Kabul City. She is married and has four family members. She and her husband own a fresh fruit cart. She was married young, wasn't able to complete her education, and has faced a lot of financial problems. To overcome these problems, she decided to take part in her husband's business. This wasn't easy, as they didn't have the capital they needed to expand their sales. Then she heard about the loan programs. Her first loan enabled her to supply more customers. She has finished her 1st loan cycle, and wishes to participate in the 2nd cycle. Khorshid has learned that if she is able to purchase more fruit, she will have more sales and increase her income. 

***Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur.  In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.***

loans.use: To purchase apples, melons, and other fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts
